story:
Story of My Book


Crescent Earth is a mystery through time, full of adventure, heartbreak, and more than a few twists and turns.

My name is Ilia, and I am the author of Crescent Earth. I wrote this book because I’m obsessed with crime fiction, conspiracy theories, and, most of all, life and how we navigate our way through it. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover something new, find answers you seek about yourself, let your imagination run wild. This is an opportunity to escape into the exciting world of the unexplained, to glimpse the future, and maybe even come to terms with the past.

In the future of 2130, human-like androids live among humans both on Earth and off-world, co-existing and sharing knowledge. When one such android kills James Mason’s father, James, accompanied by his partner, Tom, will have to chase the robot to the Moon base of Peary-I. But on his path to revenge, James will uncover his dark family history and enter the world of espionage, conspiracy, and flying saucers.

You will love this book if you grew up on The X-Files and The Twilight Zone, if you enjoy mystery and science fiction that deals with the unexplained.

Crescent Earth speaks to sci-fi fans who want to grapple with the themes of love and loss in a new, exciting way.

Ultimately, I hope that Crescent Earth inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can we cope with death and move on with our lives?
  • What would we do differently if we could turn back time?
  • Do we have a say in life, or is it all predetermined?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing love, family relations, and the unbearable weight of the past will change us all for the better.



What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer of 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!


About the Author


Ilia Epifanov is a Ghostwriter and Developmental Editor, born in St. Petersburg, Russia, and currently living in Los Angeles. He has a degree in Creative Writing for Entertainment and makes a living helping fellow authors achieve their writing dreams. Ilia has written comics and books, including 30+ Romance and Mystery novels he has ghostwritten in the last 6 years. In his spare time, Ilia likes to take his two Pomeranians to the park and read crime fiction and comic books.

For more information, you can connect with Ilia at ilia.a.epifanov@gmail.com or on social media:
IG: instagram.com/d_a_warner/
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/ilia-ghostwrites/
FB: facebook.com/danny00110010/


International Preorders


For international preorders, please send me a private message.


Risks & Challenges


The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #CrescentEarth and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ilia Epifanov

story:
This is the first time such a detailed work on the topic of morels has been published – it’s a world first!
We have done everything to make this book a work of quality, through and through. Every single aspect, from the text to the illustrations, paper, printing ink, or the cover, will delight both your senses and your mind.

 

 

 

To compile this monumental work on European morels, the authors worked tirelessly for several years.
Using their combined experience in medecine, research, university lecturing, mycology, and illustration, they have created a masterpiece which collects all the most up-to-date knowledge on this well-known mushroom.
Fuelled by their passion for this extraordinary mushroom, they set out to share their knowledge with clarity, method and concision.

 

 

You will be able to discover in this beautiful book, documented, illustrated which treats at the same time the history, the origin of morels, but also all the kinds of existing morels, the secret of the growth and the description of their anatomy. 

 

 

When you open this breathtaking book of scholarship, you will be able to admire the representation of morels in the visual arts, the place of morels in Western literature. You will also learn how to try to tame its culture, if you have difficulty finding it in your region.

 

 

 

 

 

The mission of our publishing house is to share knowledge, culture, and art. For over 16 years, we have brought together authors to share their experience and insights on specific themes.
In these troubled times of pandemics and uncertainty, and despite all of our efforts,  we are facing the same financial difficulties that menace the publishing sector as a whole. On top of this, large-scale distributors, agents, and online sales platforms (especially one well-known global website) are asking for a larger share of profits than ever. All these factors have made it necessary for us to ask for support from you, who values the preservation and sharing of books, reading, and culture.
This kind of book is costly to put together. The money you donate will be used to cover technical costs, and any remaining funds will be directed to the authors, translators, illustrators and others who worked hard to bring this book to life.

 

 


I “caught” mycology when I was twelve. A few mushrooms spotted in the woods, a book (the first of many), and a mycologist, Jacques Van der Steen (1947-1991), who hosted mycological outings where I spent my holidays. The French Mycological Society saw me grow up, I met other fungi lovers, and I learned that knowledge is transmitted best via the heart (and with a touch of humor).
As a university lecturer in the Lille Pharmacy Faculty, I mostly teach mycology and ecology to future pharmacists. My research is focused on the symbioses between fungi and plants, and the phylogeny and classification of Basidiomycota, with some side-trips into Ascomycota, such as this book.

Pierre-Arthur MOREAU

 

Originally from the north of France, I arrived aged 2 in Noyon (in the Oise), home to Jean Calvin and Charlemagne, then studied in the Amiens Faculty of Pharmacy. After defending my pharmaceutical doctoral dissertation, I set up my pharmacy in Pont-l’Évêque (Oise) in 2001. Passionate about mycology since 1986, I studied under Marcel Bon, wrote numerous articles on my local fungi, and focused on morels. I authored the first worldwide classification of morels in 2012, and I travel around the Oise and beyond to record and photograph fungi. I also identify them every year at the annual Senlis mycological exhibition.

I am an ex-trumpet and handball player, an amateur of Gaulish and Roman coins – ultimately though, all my passions reconnect me to morels.

Philippe CLOWEZ

 

 

Philippe and Pierre-Arthur have contributed considerable improvements to the awareness of an unsuspected diversity among morels. Henceforth, it is entirely possible that, thanks to them, and the impact of this remarkable book, many ‘morel hunters’ may pay more attention to the actual identity of the specimens they had acquired for culinary purposes.

Their decisive work will permit the pursuit of scientific enrichment, through an improvement of the biogeographical, or even ecological understanding of these very particular mushrooms. Like any well-constructed monograph standing on solid foundations, it marks a new stage: the benefits of the knowledge collected here will quite probably act as a springboard for future discoveries and a new flourishing of morchellology, particularly in France and Europe.

Professor Régis COURTECUISSE, University Professor

 

We have just published a book, a European and worldwide first, on the topic of "Morels of  Europe".

This reference book was written and illustrated by well-known specialists in this domain. 
The text and illustrations are all original and unpublished.
The latest research on this fungus contained within is the result of several years of in-depth research.

This 374-page work is available to you as a subscription.It will be sent in sturdy packaging, individually wrapped in cellophane.

We attach to this message a selection of pages from this unique book, as well as a subscription warrant. Thank you for supporting the work of these passionate researchers.

We thank you for your time, and look forward to your reply. 

Benoît ROLAND, Editor

 


 

€10:

  • a voucher code on our website to get a discount on shipping costs for your future order on https://www.capregionseditions.fr/en/


€20:

  • a voucher code  
  • a nice bookmark

the design of the bookmark has to change


€50: 

  • a voucher code
  • a lithograph of Xavier Carteret : you have the choice between 3 masterpieces of Xavier Carteret in A3 sheet


€70: 

  • a voucher code
  • a copy of the book "Morels of Europe"


€150:

  • a voucher code
  • a lithograph
  • bookmark  
  • signed copy of the book "Morels of Europe"

the design of the bookmark has to change


€1,000 and more: a special experience :  

  • a video conference with the authors of the book
  • your name is added to the acknowledgement list in the book
  • signed copy of the book
  • a lithograph
  • a bookmark
  • a voucher code

 

 

Since our beginnings, we have sought to share the kind of topics that can open a gateway to emotional and intellectual discovery.
We are lucky enough to work with fantastic authors who care deeply about the quality of their work, and who are intent on sharing their expertise.
We work with a dedicated technical and creative crew of photographers, illustrators, graphic designers, proofreaders, translators, and IT and visual technicians, whom we value greatly and pay fairly. They are at the heart of every project and have been working with us for years, contributing their enthusiasm, finesse and skills. 

 

 

€75,000


The budget covers the following: proofs, translation, the author’s wages, printing, and shipping the finished books. 
Cap Regions Éditions will invest €25,000 in the form of a bank loan and has already invested over €12,000.


 

60 days, from December to February  2021.
We will keep backers informed at every stage, through financing and project execution.
Your backing will allow us, as independent publishers, to continue doing what we do best: supporting the contractors who make every project possible, and work together to bring ideas to the world via the magical medium of books. 

The first batch shipment starting from April 2021 if we achieve our goal. It shall arrive by few weeks after safely and timely.
Shipments can be delayed if unfortunately we do not reach our goal of 75000€ to cover production expenses.

 

 

Title: Morels of Europe
Authors: Philippe Clowez - Pierre-Arthur Moreau
Preface by Professor Courtecuisse
Scientific and art book.

Decorated with magnificent illustrations by Xavier Carteret, as well as evocative photographs.

The authors share their impressive combined discoveries and knowledge on the topic of this unique mushroom. Every aspect is covered in-depth, from ecology to microscopy, classification to depictions in art.

The result is both entertaining and educational!


Size: 23 x 31 cm or 9,05 x 12,2 inches
Cover: Canvas cover with Dustcover
Pages: 374
Four-colour process printing
Public price after release: 79€ (90$)
Publishing date: as soon as we reach the budget goal


Contents:
Over 550 photographs, heretofore unpublished
6 plates, most of them originals, created by Xavier Carteret
8 educational graphs
Scientific analysis of over 35 morel series


Over 25 reproductions of ancient drawings and documents
English and Latin indices and an extended bibliography complete this unmissable work for any mycologist or mushroom-lover – the first of its kind, covering every possible aspect of European morels.

 

People who contributed to this book and to this campaign


 

Thank you

If you have any questions about Morels of Europe or backing this book on Indiegogo, feel free to email directly - contact@capregionseditions.fr

You can also discover our website at https://www.capregionseditions.fr/en

story:
Take Massive Action is a book about taking action now to transform your life for the better in the future.

Studies show that more than half of U.S. workers are not happy and are not satisfied with their work. This is alarming and more can definitely be done to mitigate this situation. 

While we often look to others such as our bosses for guidance, we may need to take a different approach to actually change the situation at hand. 

Many people think that you have to wait for the right opportunity, but I believe in another approach. Which is to take action now. Build momentum. Grow. And generate the right timing even if you are unsure of the results.

My name is Christina Kumar, and I am the author of Take Massive Action. I wrote this book because many people still think that they need to wait for the right opportunity before they take action, but I have found after working with and speaking to world-renowned leaders is that they all share a common element that propels them to success. This common element is taking action. Are you ready to learn how leaders across many different industries approach taking action in their own ways to guarantee their success and generate momentum? You will learn how to take more action towards your goals, build new strategies that will help you gain momentum, and think outside of your professional comfort zone.

Take Massive Action takes us through the journey of success and gaining the confidence needed to obtain it. It navigates us through the real-life stories of extraordinary individuals who were once everyday people. These select individuals were able to apply the wisdom they needed to take action in their own lives. Their actions resulted in million-dollar companies, breakthrough ideas known all around the world, and international recognition.

I hope that, in reading this book, you will start to build fresh momentum in your life.

I feel compelled to write about this because I too had thought that you have to wait for the right timing, but then I learned, in an eye-opening way, how this is not accurate. I started to research and talk to those whom I admire, many of them who are at the top of their fields. Along the way, I learned some very important strategies that changed the views which I had been programmed with.

Take Massive Action is for anyone who wants to change their life for the better, create more opportunities, or who is seeking something new. 

In this book, you will gain inspiration and new ideas from uplifting stories of people that I interviewed such as...

  • The world's leading expert on how to license a product idea and his journey of becoming an inspiration to millions.
  • A glass-blowing artist who became the co-founder of a billion-dollar company because of a need to solve his own problem.
  • The creator of the cell phone.
  • An entrepreneur whose one-of-a-kind approach to creating a game has sold 32,000,000 games worldwide.

 

You will love this book if you desire to grow and want to take more action to achieve your dreams!

 

Take Massive Action is a nonfiction book that speaks to business owners and entrepreneurs as well as those wanting to make changes in their lives. 

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters [1-3]. In this section, you will learn about the importance of why starting now is important. You will hear about the experience of top-performing leaders on their unique journeys to success; with all the ups and downs. This section will also include background and insights from myself, Christina Kumar, on how starting toward my goals before I was fully ready has impacted my life in profound ways. 

Part 2 contains chapters [4-9]. In this section, we learn about the Principles of Action. It includes key principles that can be used to take successful massive action to help you reach your goals. This section also includes some key information never released to the public before from the inventor of the cell phone himself!

Part 3 contains chapters [10-12] and the conclusion. In this section, we learn how to develop an action to momentum mindset. This section also includes examples that have worked for other leaders on developing key mindset techniques that can help propel you towards what you want. 

Please use this form for international shipping or send a private message.
 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • A ticket to the LAUNCH PARTY!

And much more!

Christina Kumar is a journalist and founder of Christina Kumar PR, a public relations firm. She has been featured in Yahoo! Finance, MSN, Huff Post, ABC News 10, Aol, and Go Banking Rates among others. 

Before this, Christina had won 1st place in a Google for Entrepreneurs powered competition which had furthered her interest in business.

Her passion is helping leaders grow their dreams and make the world a better place.

When Christina isn’t writing, you can find her interviewing interesting people from entrepreneurs to musicians!

Christina believes in giving back to her community and has partnered with the Northern California Filmmaker’s Coalition to contribute to the film industry in Northern California which helps enable greater access to film financing as well as gives local talent more opportunity to showcase their skills.

For more information, you can connect with Christina Kumar at ChristinaKumar@mail.com and at https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinakumar1 on LinkedIn.

 

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #takemassiveaction and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

 

Thanks again,

Christina Kumar
story_txt:
Take Massive Action is a book about taking action now to transform your life for the better in the future.Studies show that more than half of U.S. workers are not happy and are not satisfied with their work. This is alarming and more can definitely be done to mitigate this situation. While we often look to others such as our bosses for guidance, we may need to take a different approach to actually change the situation at hand. Many people think that you have to wait for the right opportunity, but I believe in another approach. Which is to take action now. Build momentum. Grow. And generate the right timing even if you are unsure of the results.My name is Christina Kumar, and I am the author of Take Massive Action. I wrote this book because many people still think that they need to wait for the right opportunity before they take action, but I have found after working with and speaking to world-renowned leaders is that they all share a common element that propels them to success. This common element is taking action. Are you ready to learn how leaders across many different industries approach taking action in their own ways to guarantee their success and generate momentum? You will learn how to take more action towards your goals, build new strategies that will help you gain momentum, and think outside of your professional comfort zone.Take Massive Action takes us through the journey of success and gaining the confidence needed to obtain it. It navigates us through the real-life stories of extraordinary individuals who were once everyday people. These select individuals were able to apply the wisdom they needed to take action in their own lives. Their actions resulted in million-dollar companies, breakthrough ideas known all around the world, and international recognition.I hope that, in reading this book, you will start to build fresh momentum in your life.I feel compelled to write about this because I too had thought that you have to wait for the right timing, but then I learned, in an eye-opening way, how this is not accurate. I started to research and talk to those whom I admire, many of them who are at the top of their fields. Along the way, I learned some very important strategies that changed the views which I had been programmed with.Take Massive Action is for anyone who wants to change their life for the better, create more opportunities, or who is seeking something new. In this book, you will gain inspiration and new ideas from uplifting stories of people that I interviewed such as...
The world's leading expert on how to license a product idea and his journey of becoming an inspiration to millions.
A glass-blowing artist who became the co-founder of a billion-dollar company because of a need to solve his own problem.
The creator of the cell phone.
An entrepreneur whose one-of-a-kind approach to creating a game has sold 32,000,000 games worldwide.
 You will love this book if you desire to grow and want to take more action to achieve your dreams! Take Massive Action is a nonfiction book that speaks to business owners and entrepreneurs as well as those wanting to make changes in their lives. The book is written in 3 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters [1-3]. In this section, you will learn about the importance of why starting now is important. You will hear about the experience of top-performing leaders on their unique journeys to success; with all the ups and downs. This section will also include background and insights from myself, Christina Kumar, on how starting toward my goals before I was fully ready has impacted my life in profound ways. Part 2 contains chapters [4-9]. In this section, we learn about the Principles of Action. It includes key principles that can be used to take successful massive action to help you reach your goals. This section also includes some key information never released to the public before from the inventor of the cell phone himself!Part 3 contains chapters [10-12] and the conclusion. In this section, we learn how to develop an action to momentum mindset. This section also includes examples that have worked for other leaders on developing key mindset techniques that can help propel you towards what you want. Please use this form for international shipping or send a private message. This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
 When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
A ticket to the LAUNCH PARTY!
And much more!Christina Kumar is a journalist and founder of Christina Kumar PR, a public relations firm. She has been featured in Yahoo! Finance, MSN, Huff Post, ABC News 10, Aol, and Go Banking Rates among others. Before this, Christina had won 1st place in a Google for Entrepreneurs powered competition which had furthered her interest in business.Her passion is helping leaders grow their dreams and make the world a better place.When Christina isn’t writing, you can find her interviewing interesting people from entrepreneurs to musicians!Christina believes in giving back to her community and has partnered with the Northern California Filmmaker’s Coalition to contribute to the film industry in Northern California which helps enable greater access to film financing as well as gives local talent more opportunity to showcase their skills.For more information, you can connect with Christina Kumar at ChristinaKumar@mail.com and at https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinakumar1 on LinkedIn. 
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #takemassiveaction and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support! Thanks again,Christina Kumar

story:
***UPDATE***

We reached our goal in just 10 DAYS - thank you ALL for your incredible support! Please note that this campaign is not over until end of May, so please continue to spread the word so more people can learn about this and pre-order their copy. Any extra funds raised will be used to hire more talent in Lebanon to complete the project as needed, and beyond that funds will be donated to NGOs working on post-explosion relief efforts.

Again, thank you!

About the Project 

The August 4th explosion destroyed much of our beloved Beirut. It killed 210 of our loved ones, injured at least 7,500 of them, damaged or destroyed 77,000 of our homes and businesses, displaced 300,000 of us, and emotionally devastated millions of us.

Hello everyone. My name is Zeina. I'm a Lebanese-American who has lived in Beirut for the past 10 years.

Like so many others, the explosion on August 4th crushed me. Everything turned dark. Days and nights were full of pain. Full of tears.

One month after the explosion, on one of the rare days that I got myself out of the house, I ran into an old friend of mine, Angelique, at a farmer’s market. She was sitting with a guy named Elyah. I thought they were lifelong friends, only to discover the surprising story of how they met:

When the explosion happened, Angelique was sitting in Sip Cafe on Gemmayze Street. The blast tore right through the coffee shop. She was badly injured and was struggling to find her way to the hospital amidst the horrific scenes in front of her. Strangers came to her aid along the way.

Sip Cafe After the Explosion; Photo Credit: Omar Jheir

What she didn’t know was that around the same time, Elyah had stumbled upon her purse in the debris. He took it and kept it safe for her, even though he had no idea who she was. Later that night, he got the courage to open up her purse, found her name, posted it on Instagram, and asked if anyone knew anything about her.  

Days later, he found her, and returned her purse. And there I was, one month later, witness to their new, growing friendship.

After hearing Angelique’s story, I realized the importance of recognizing the extraordinary things that ordinary people did (and continue to do) during this time of tragedy; to honor the lives that were lost and those that were left behind in their wake; to come to terms with the very real pain that still haunts us today, while being aware of the solidarity and support that emerged during one of the most devastating times of our lives.

And that’s when I decided I wanted to create a collection of stories that emerged in the aftermath of the Beirut Explosion. I teamed up with veteran writers Nadia Tabbara and Romy Lynn to guide the process of curating, coaching, and bringing together this book to its final stages –– a book that reflects true events with real people whose experiences deserve to be documented and never forgotten. 

Will history tell the many stories of our trauma, our pain, and our deep, personal losses? We must find ways to keep these stories alive - because by remembering these stories, we remember what could happen when corruption, lack of accountability, and lack of transparency take hold of a country. August 4th is the heartbreaking outcome for those of us in Lebanon.

August 4th Memorial in Gemmayze by Mariam Hamieh; Photo Credit: Ali Chehade

Once published, 100% of the profits from book sales will be donated to NGOs supporting families devastated by the Beirut Explosion.

The selection of these NGOs will be made in a transparent manner in partnership with 3QA, a social enterprise based in Lebanon specialized in organizational assessments. A dedicated 3QA committee will assist us in conducting the due diligence and review of funding applications submitted by NGOs, to then propose a final selection and ensure oversight of funding.

About the Stories

I’ve been collecting testimonials since October 2020 and now have 25 stories to share with you. Although they are only a small fraction of the voices and experiences that deserve to be heard, they represent the courage and selflessness exhibited by thousands of people.

While the people of Lebanon are still mourning, and while true healing can never take place without justice, (something we must continue to fight for), every story you read will bring to life the true spirit of the human condition and our collective drive to protect and to support.

This book will be called "We Were There". Here are some of the stories you will read about:

  • A missing woman in a coma with no family in Lebanon, found by a stranger who stayed by her side to support her throughout her entire traumatic journey and recovery
  • A young man who rushed to Beirut from Akkar, sleeping on the streets for several days with no money and nowhere to go, insisting to stay to help
  • A young lady who developed a mental health hotline and stayed awake during the nights out of fear of missing a single urgent call 
  • A young expat living in the Ivory Coast who built an online platform to locate missing people
  • A wedding planner turned relief-reconstruction-rescue worker
  • A lonely, elderly man who found a community of support after the explosion
  • A Palestinian Civil Defense volunteer who, despite resistance from authorities, found a way for him and his peers to provide support and save lives
  • And so many more....

I can continue to tell you about the many other stories in this book, but will leave it for other voices to share.

By preserving these stories, we spread the experience to thousands more –– a powerful form of nonviolent action –– with the hope that this book may ultimately become an archive and a tool of resistance.

Progress to Date & Next Steps

Over the past few months, I have been working closely with Nadia Tabbara, Romy Lynn, Niamh Fleming-Farrell, and Jasmina Najjar - all of whom have been guiding, advising, and supporting the development of this project. Together, we have formed an incredible team of over 20 professional writers who are now also involved in this book project.

We are aiming to follow this timeline going forward:

After this initial book printing for this crowdfunding campaign, we will aim to get the book further published and distributed through bookstores and online in Lebanon and abroad to increase awareness of these stories, and to raise additional funds for NGOs supporting families affected by the blast.

Basic book production and publication costs are estimated at around $11,000, covering: 

  • Writers (these are skilled writers who are each matched with a story contributor to produce a well-written story reflecting the true experience of the contributor)

  • Editors

  • Translators (we want to make the book available in English and Arabic to make it accessible to a wide audience; if we raise enough funds we will also translate it to French)

  • Illustration, Graphic Design, & Layout

Variable Costs depending on number of books ordered and funds available:

  • Printing

  • Marketing & Promotion 

As project curator, I’m fully volunteering my time and not receiving any compensation for this project. 

As noted above, beyond the core costs, all additional funds raised via this crowdfunding campaign and later sales of the book will be donated to local NGOs working on post-blast relief and recovery, in collaboration with 3QA.

The more we raise, the louder our voices. 

* To learn more about each perk, click on the boxes to the right. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that times are tough these days, and not just in Lebanon. If you are unable to contribute, I completely understand. Instead of a financial contribution, please consider sharing this link with your friends, family, and social media networks. The more we raise, the more books we can print and sell, and the more we can make sure history is honestly written and the stories of August 4, 2020 are never forgotten.

----

Please see the below FAQs for more information.

Should you have any further questions please email us at

weweretherebeirut@gmail.com

To stay in touch, follow us on: 

Instagram: @weweretherebeirut

Facebook: We Were There

THANK YOU!

story:
30% of all proceeds above $10k will go to college scholarships for Latinas through LUPE Fund and Latina Surge.

Thank you for your support!

Uncolonized Latinas is about breaking free from the limiting cultural narratives that have kept us from achieving extraordinary success.

Many of us, immigrant Latinas and daughters of immigrants, are first generation to get a college degree, to pursue a corporate career, or to open a business, and we feel we are figuring it all out by ourselves, as nobody at home can provide us with guidance or a roadmap. 

We are trailblazers, going after goals no other female in our families had access to. And in these new spaces, we may feel different, and sometimes, lonely.

At the same time, we struggle with our cultural narratives. So many of us have been feeling less, or not as good, or we think we need to change who we are to succeed. We tend to think we need to do it all, by ourselves, as we support multiple generations in our families. And many times, we work very hard hoping somebody will notice, not asking for what we need.  We stay silent, and that silence is cultural.

These times are calling us Latinas to think about ourselves in a new way, and to unite and work collectively as we embrace the unprecedented opportunities that were not available to our female ancestors, but that are opening up for us.

Our non-Hispanic allies are also being called to manage and mentor diverse talent in a new way, in which an in-depth understanding of the Latino culture and of the particular barriers to success that Latinas face, become a huge plus to be an effective leader or mentor.

In this book, Valeria Aloe hopes to instill in you the same passion and excitement that she has for Latinas, envisioning our community as the future of the United States and all of the Americas, as we confidently go after bigger and better opportunities. 

  • Embrace our collective greatness, as we honor our stories and where we come from.
  • Become more aware of the limiting cultural narratives that have been running us, many times unconsciously.
  • Strategize how to better support your career or business, learning from those Latinas who figured out how to navigate the system.
  • Feel motivated, as a Latina, to take action to thrive in your career and life from a place of self-love and self-esteem. As an ally, feel more confident and become more effective when leading and mentoring diverse talent.

You will love this book if you are a Latina professional or business owner who wants to succeed, but feels you have not reached your maximum potential yet, if you feel alone or not understood in your journey, or if you are frustrated with systemic bias and competition within our Hispanic community and beyond.

Also, if you are an ally who wants to support our Latinas succeed, from a place of understanding where we come from, and how can team up to create bigger and better results together.

The book is written in 4 parts:

Part 1: Where we come from: Introduction + Chapters 1-4.
A look into how colonization and immigration shaped our mindsets, how this influences our thoughts and decisions, and how immigration trauma does not stop with the migrant generation, but impacts its descendants. We will also take a deep dive into the “Hispanic Paradox”: we are great contributors to the US economy and culture, but we have not embraced our power yet.

Part 2: How a colonized mindset shows up: Chapters 5-11.
You will have an opportunity to explore the limiting cultural narratives and specific behaviors that keep you from achieving extraordinary success (feeling unworthy or inferior, feeling that you do not have a voice, feeling unsafe in positions of visibility, etc) and you will gain insights into moving past those limiting narratives as you learn from the experiences of Latinas that look and sound like you.

Part 3: How systemic bias and our own colorism act as magnifiers: Chapters 12-14.
Understand the external factors that amplify your inner limiting voices creating a perfect storm that keeps you away from manifesting great success, including widespread systemic bias, micro-aggressions, division and competition among Hispanics, and colorism within our community.

Part 4: How to build a new collective, starting with YOU: Chapters 15-19.
Explore practical strategies that will support you in embracing your uncolonized inner essence, in finding your voice, and in showing up as your authentic self. You will also gain insights into accessing and navigating the system, through education, personal brand building, networking, mentoring, and more, as you learn from what has worked for other Latinas who have trailblazed new spaces.

If you pre-order the book now, you will be jumping into an EXPERIENCE and a MOVEMENT.

You will join the author in an experience, as an insider of her publishing journey:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (shipping within the U.S. is included), a handwritten thank-you note, and tickets to my Virtual Launch Party.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of the book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from the book, with the opportunity to review it and provide early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting the cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join the Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • Depending on the package you choose, you can get tickets to the exclusive 3-part “Cultural Narratives” workshop series, where you will challenge how you have been viewing your life, create action steps to better support your career or business, and connect with other supporters. Or, you can have a private "Mindset Breakthrough" session with the author and get a 60-day mindset journal.
  • And much more! (For custom-built Workshops + Book bundles for your organization or community, contact the author at valeria@abundanciaconsciente.net. Curriculum: Young Leadership, Emotional Intelligence, Stress Management, Diverse Talent Managerial Training, Hybrid Workspace Best Practices).

And you will become part of a movement by supporting emerging Latina voices, currently making up for less than 5% of the publishing industry. This movement not only gives visibility to our stories, it creates a platform for Latinas to increasingly step into new spaces of leadership and influence. 

This book will be published with New Degree Press, and pre-order tiers were set up to help cover the costs of publishing it. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor who will revise and publish the manuscript in January 2022.
  • The Cover Design for the book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of the book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for the book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for the book when it ultimately publishes this Winter.
  • The Spanish Translation, to also reach our Spanish-speaking Latinas!

Campaign Goals:

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)

Tier 2: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

Tier 3: Hit $11,000 and we’ll get a Spanish ebook/softcover edition.

Tier 4: Hit $13,000 and we’ll get a Spanish audiobook edition.

Valeria Aloe, founder of Abundancia Consciente - a multicultural strategy, talent development, and executive coaching firm - was born in a small rural town in Argentina and has lived in the U.S. since 2004.

The first in her family to attend college, to pursue a corporate career in global companies, to open her own business, and to raise a family in a new culture, Valeria understands how challenging it can be when you are the first one to go after a goal no other family member had access to, particularly when you struggle with your beliefs about yourself and what is possible for you to achieve.

After more than 20 years in a corporate career, working across 7 different countries in brand management and business development, with companies such as PriceWaterhouse Coopers, Procter & Gamble, Citibank, Reckitt Benckiser, and more, Valeria experienced a burn-out that led her to soul-search for her true purpose. Since 2016, she dedicated her career to support immigrants and women of color confidently go after bigger and better opportunities, and has coached and worked closely with more than 400 diverse entrepreneurs and corporate professionals. Valeria supports multiple organizations by helping them understand the Hispanic culture, and by developing training programs and coaching platforms for diverse women and entrepreneurs.

She holds Business Administration and Finance degrees from Universidad Catolica Argentina, where she graduated with honors while working full time to finance her education. She also holds a Master in Business (MBA) from the prestigious Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth, and a Master in Spiritual Science from the Peace Theological Seminary and College of Philosophy.

Outside of writing and working on her consulting business, Valeria enjoys time with her husband and two kids. She snowboards, sings in a choir, loves researching about conscious leadership and spirituality at work, and loves travelling to Argentina to visit her family.

You can connect with Valeria at valeria@abundanciaconsciente.net, as well as on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, or her website www.abundanciaconsciente.net 

 

For international preorders (if you live outside the U.S., except if you are ordering an e-book), please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the value of the perk you chose (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Email the author at valeria@abundanciaconsciente.net and share your email address, so that we calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically the mailing of the book to you. We have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of the book is contingent on the publisher we use. The author will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as the book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of the book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

If you cannot jump in at this time, you can still get a signed copy of Uncolonized Latinas. The author will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #UncolonizedLatinas and tag the author as well as the publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Use these tags:
Instagram - @ValeriaAloe_author / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @ValeriaAloe / @NewDegreePress
LinkedIn - @ValeriaAloe / @NewDegreePress

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
The best is yet to come!

Valeria
story_txt:
30% of all proceeds above $10k will go to college scholarships for Latinas through LUPE Fund and Latina Surge. Thank you for your support!Uncolonized Latinas is about breaking free from the limiting cultural narratives that have kept us from achieving extraordinary success.Many of us, immigrant Latinas and daughters of immigrants, are first generation to get a college degree, to pursue a corporate career, or to open a business, and we feel we are figuring it all out by ourselves, as nobody at home can provide us with guidance or a roadmap. We are trailblazers, going after goals no other female in our families had access to. And in these new spaces, we may feel different, and sometimes, lonely.At the same time, we struggle with our cultural narratives. So many of us have been feeling less, or not as good, or we think we need to change who we are to succeed. We tend to think we need to do it all, by ourselves, as we support multiple generations in our families. And many times, we work very hard hoping somebody will notice, not asking for what we need.  We stay silent, and that silence is cultural.These times are calling us Latinas to think about ourselves in a new way, and to unite and work collectively as we embrace the unprecedented opportunities that were not available to our female ancestors, but that are opening up for us.Our non-Hispanic allies are also being called to manage and mentor diverse talent in a new way, in which an in-depth understanding of the Latino culture and of the particular barriers to success that Latinas face, become a huge plus to be an effective leader or mentor.In this book, Valeria Aloe hopes to instill in you the same passion and excitement that she has for Latinas, envisioning our community as the future of the United States and all of the Americas, as we confidently go after bigger and better opportunities. 
Embrace our collective greatness, as we honor our stories and where we come from.
Become more aware of the limiting cultural narratives that have been running us, many times unconsciously.
Strategize how to better support your career or business, learning from those Latinas who figured out how to navigate the system.
Feel motivated, as a Latina, to take action to thrive in your career and life from a place of self-love and self-esteem. As an ally, feel more confident and become more effective when leading and mentoring diverse talent.
You will love this book if you are a Latina professional or business owner who wants to succeed, but feels you have not reached your maximum potential yet, if you feel alone or not understood in your journey, or if you are frustrated with systemic bias and competition within our Hispanic community and beyond.Also, if you are an ally who wants to support our Latinas succeed, from a place of understanding where we come from, and how can team up to create bigger and better results together.The book is written in 4 parts:Part 1: Where we come from: Introduction + Chapters 1-4.A look into how colonization and immigration shaped our mindsets, how this influences our thoughts and decisions, and how immigration trauma does not stop with the migrant generation, but impacts its descendants. We will also take a deep dive into the “Hispanic Paradox”: we are great contributors to the US economy and culture, but we have not embraced our power yet.Part 2: How a colonized mindset shows up: Chapters 5-11.You will have an opportunity to explore the limiting cultural narratives and specific behaviors that keep you from achieving extraordinary success (feeling unworthy or inferior, feeling that you do not have a voice, feeling unsafe in positions of visibility, etc) and you will gain insights into moving past those limiting narratives as you learn from the experiences of Latinas that look and sound like you.Part 3: How systemic bias and our own colorism act as magnifiers: Chapters 12-14.Understand the external factors that amplify your inner limiting voices creating a perfect storm that keeps you away from manifesting great success, including widespread systemic bias, micro-aggressions, division and competition among Hispanics, and colorism within our community.Part 4: How to build a new collective, starting with YOU: Chapters 15-19.Explore practical strategies that will support you in embracing your uncolonized inner essence, in finding your voice, and in showing up as your authentic self. You will also gain insights into accessing and navigating the system, through education, personal brand building, networking, mentoring, and more, as you learn from what has worked for other Latinas who have trailblazed new spaces.If you pre-order the book now, you will be jumping into an EXPERIENCE and a MOVEMENT. You will join the author in an experience, as an insider of her publishing journey:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (shipping within the U.S. is included), a handwritten thank-you note, and tickets to my Virtual Launch Party.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of the book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from the book, with the opportunity to review it and provide early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting the cover and title.
You will be invited to join the Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
Depending on the package you choose, you can get tickets to the exclusive 3-part “Cultural Narratives” workshop series, where you will challenge how you have been viewing your life, create action steps to better support your career or business, and connect with other supporters. Or, you can have a private "Mindset Breakthrough" session with the author and get a 60-day mindset journal.
And much more! (For custom-built Workshops + Book bundles for your organization or community, contact the author at valeria@abundanciaconsciente.net. Curriculum: Young Leadership, Emotional Intelligence, Stress Management, Diverse Talent Managerial Training, Hybrid Workspace Best Practices).
And you will become part of a movement by supporting emerging Latina voices, currently making up for less than 5% of the publishing industry. This movement not only gives visibility to our stories, it creates a platform for Latinas to increasingly step into new spaces of leadership and influence. This book will be published with New Degree Press, and pre-order tiers were set up to help cover the costs of publishing it. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor who will revise and publish the manuscript in January 2022.

The Cover Design for the book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of the book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for the book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for the book when it ultimately publishes this Winter.

The Spanish Translation, to also reach our Spanish-speaking Latinas!
Campaign Goals:Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)Tier 2: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.Tier 3: Hit $11,000 and we’ll get a Spanish ebook/softcover edition.Tier 4: Hit $13,000 and we’ll get a Spanish audiobook edition.Valeria Aloe, founder of Abundancia Consciente - a multicultural strategy, talent development, and executive coaching firm - was born in a small rural town in Argentina and has lived in the U.S. since 2004.The first in her family to attend college, to pursue a corporate career in global companies, to open her own business, and to raise a family in a new culture, Valeria understands how challenging it can be when you are the first one to go after a goal no other family member had access to, particularly when you struggle with your beliefs about yourself and what is possible for you to achieve.After more than 20 years in a corporate career, working across 7 different countries in brand management and business development, with companies such as PriceWaterhouse Coopers, Procter & Gamble, Citibank, Reckitt Benckiser, and more, Valeria experienced a burn-out that led her to soul-search for her true purpose. Since 2016, she dedicated her career to support immigrants and women of color confidently go after bigger and better opportunities, and has coached and worked closely with more than 400 diverse entrepreneurs and corporate professionals. Valeria supports multiple organizations by helping them understand the Hispanic culture, and by developing training programs and coaching platforms for diverse women and entrepreneurs.She holds Business Administration and Finance degrees from Universidad Catolica Argentina, where she graduated with honors while working full time to finance her education. She also holds a Master in Business (MBA) from the prestigious Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth, and a Master in Spiritual Science from the Peace Theological Seminary and College of Philosophy.Outside of writing and working on her consulting business, Valeria enjoys time with her husband and two kids. She snowboards, sings in a choir, loves researching about conscious leadership and spirituality at work, and loves travelling to Argentina to visit her family.You can connect with Valeria at valeria@abundanciaconsciente.net, as well as on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, or her website www.abundanciaconsciente.net  For international preorders (if you live outside the U.S., except if you are ordering an e-book), please do the following:
Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the value of the perk you chose (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
Email the author at valeria@abundanciaconsciente.net and share your email address, so that we calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically the mailing of the book to you. We have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of the book is contingent on the publisher we use. The author will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as the book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of the book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.If you cannot jump in at this time, you can still get a signed copy of Uncolonized Latinas. The author will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!
Please use #UncolonizedLatinas and tag the author as well as the publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!Use these tags:Instagram - @ValeriaAloe_author / @newdegreepressFacebook - @ValeriaAloe / @NewDegreePressLinkedIn - @ValeriaAloe / @NewDegreePress----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!The best is yet to come!Valeria

story:
Overview

 

South Austin has music, great food, and plenty of people keeping it weird. What we crave is space dedicated to our community. A place where families and local creatives can sit down with a cup of coffee and a good book to revel in the magic!

Thanks to happenstance and the magic of friendship (David Schunck, owner of Good Buy Books, who is partnering and advising in this new venture), we have the sudden opportunity to open Reverie Books in South Austin, a longtime dream. 

A dream is a reverie, the state we sometimes find ourselves in when we enter a bookstore. Together, we have imagined a place -  a family business, small, but mighty. A bookstore promoting our community. 

Reverie's mission:

  • Create an inclusive space offering something for everyone (bestsellers, YA, children’s area sci fi, science & nature) 
  • Prioritize social justice and give voice to the experiences of women, LGBTQ+, and marginalized communities
  • Spotlight local authors and poets
  • Give back to Austin through partnerships with area nonprofits, and
  • Create a space for coming together through writers circles and performances/readings by local writers, poets, and songwriters.

Reverie Books is about books, clearly, but it's also about community. It’s a place we need in South Austin that has so far been unfilled.

 

MAKING REVERIE A REALITY: BUDGET AND TIMELINE

 

The timeline to make this happen is short. We need you now. This is a phenomenal opportunity for our community. Reverie Books needs your support to raise immediate startup funds by mid-July 2021. We aren’t eligible as a new business for a standard business loan, but I can get what we need through flash lending with some of the funds already in place. I am dedicating my personal savings along with funds raised through sale of musical instruments to the bookstore, along with the majority of what I earn through teaching and consulting over the coming months.

So, thanks to the community of writers that encouraged me to reach out! I was a bit shy about it, but the supportiveness of the community is giving me courage. My goal is to raise 20K here and another 20K through angel investors, and l everage those funds into a regular bank loan to cover inventory purchasing. In addition to proving up our suitability for a bank loan - which is critical -  the immediate crowdfunding funds raised here will be entirely dedicated to:

  • improving and repairing the current space (paint, bathroom repair, light fixtures, children’s area) ~$10,000
  • legal fees to establish Reverie Books with the state; ~$2,000
  • purchasing POS and inventory control systems; ~$3,000
  • subscriptions to software and American Booksellers Association resources ~$600
  • web development ~$4,000, and
  • a really good vacuum (no, really, the dust! It must go!) ~$400

 

Investment funds will be dedicated to the ordering of stock and future needs. This venture is a dream come true, but a big part of realizing this dream depends directly on the success of this fundraiser. 

 

What You’ll Receive

 

During the last, hard pandemic year, the importance of community has become apparent to so many of us. I’m looking forward to bringing that gratitude forward in the new space.
 

  • For donations up to $250, donors will receive early swag like coffee mugs, tote bags, bookmarks and stickers (see thank you gifts to the right - logo’s coming soon!)
  • Early supporters and investors will receive special acknowledgment through a giving wall mural and VIP admission to events. 
  • For donations $250-$1,000, those who are interested can also be invited to participate in the design and buildout, book selection, etc. (totally optional, but fun!)
  • For an investment of over $1,000, a donation can be made here or 
  • Get in touch with me directly through this site for other investing options.

 

Over the last few months, rejoining our family and friends has been a true light and inspiration. We are inspired by and grateful for the support already shown to Reverie Books. Together, we will make this dream a reality!

 

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute financially, it's ok! There are some other ways to help out, and any support is meaningful.

1. Spread the word. We can't get this done without letting people know about it, so if you know people who would be interested in getting Reverie going, let them know!

  • Facebook: @Reverie Books
  • Instagram: @reveriebooks
  • Email your people!

2. Donate books around LGBTQIA+, BLM, social justice, feminism, First Nations, and other marginalized communities specifically. Any Bestsellers, Sci Fi or YA through that lens is also valuable, and science/nature. It's a tiny space so I have to be really picky, but everything I can stock that I don't have to buy new that helps with the mission is valuable.

3. LOCAL AUTHORS AND POETS donate books! Sign them! 

4. I need some basic stuff like a few brightly colored velvet chairs, a changing table with shelves underneath, a rug that looks like green grass (kids area), a Square system with register and cash box, and an outdoor table/chair set that jives with Quack's. Maybe you have exactly what I need? Stranger things have happened.

5. Tell me your top ten books - what do you want to see in the store?

6. Finally - come in when we open in Fall 2021! That's the most important thing.

 

 

About Thais Perkins

 

I'm Thais (she/her), a writer, musician, artist, and community activist from Austin, TX. Growing up in the Deep South (Louisiana), bookstores were a refuge and taught me how to dream about the wider world. I want to create the kind of space a young person can feel warm and welcome in, the kind of place I sought out when I had nowhere to turn.

Over the past year or so, I've dedicated myself to running a pandemic school for my two children while ensuring my wife could continue to focus while working from home and holding us all together.  Since Reverie became a possibility in the last months, I've been taking crash courses in bookselling, joined the American Association of Booksellers, and have been talking to bookstore owners across the US to prepare for this venture. 

 

 

 

Header Photo by Renee Fisher on Unsplash
