story:
About This Project

This project will fund an anthology titled THERE IS NO DEATH, THERE ARE NO DEAD containing approximately 12 short stories from some of today’s biggest names in dark fantasy and horror fiction. The book will be edited by Aaron J. French and Jess Landry, and published by Crystal Lake Publishing in August 2021.

 

The Spirits Of The Dead Exist And They Want To Communicate

First appearing in the late 1800s, spiritualism became a religious movement that swept the world. Under the assumption that the dead live on in the afterlife, spiritualists believed that contact with the dearly departed was not only possible, but something those who crossed over longed for. Contact was usually made through a medium, a person who claimed to have the ability to speak with the dead.

In a time of uncertainty, women in the movement were given a voice. Most notably, the Fox sisters became the faces of spiritualism—young, innocent, and cunning. As the popularity of the religion grew (along with the skepticism), the sisters and others like them swindled believers out of their hard-earned money, ultimately causing spiritualism to come crashing down around all those who claimed to have psychic abilities. However, there are still some who follow the movement to this day, driven by their belief that they can, in fact, communicate with the dead.

Featuring a mix of stories set in modern and olden times, THERE IS NO DEATH, THERE ARE NO DEAD tackles all aspects of the spiritualist movement: from the true believers to the nay-sayers, the hoaxes to hauntings, the real mediums to the scam artists. Edited by Aaron J. French and Jess Landry, and published by Crystal Lake Publishing in 2021. Authors include:

Lisa Morton

Kathe Koja

Helen Marshall

Lee Murray

Gwendolyn Kiste

Gemma Files

SP Miskowski

Seanan McGuire

Laird Barron

David Demchuk

Nadia Bulkin

Chesya Burke

And more to be announced…

To Our Backers

In order to fund this project, our goal is to raise $5,000. Backers of this project will be generating the base funds needed to produce this anthology, including payment for the contributing authors, payment for the cover artist, and production costs for producing the anthology. The reward levels are therefore calculated with respect to the cost of the final product when it goes on sale to the general public. In this sense, most backers of the project will be “preordering” the anthology, though often with an added advantage, which will help fund the paperback edition of the book. However, certain backers who choose a higher level of reward will help support the project at the paperback level as well as receive more substantial incentives, like additional books from Crystal Lake Publishing or editing services from Aaron J. French, Jess Landry, Crystal Lake Publishing owner Joe Mynhardt, and anthology contributor Lee Murray.

We promise to curate only the most powerful and original fiction for this project, only stories that truly capture the theme of spiritualism and communication with the dead. The publisher, Crystal Lake Publishing, is one of the top producers of speculative fiction, with many years of solid experience under their belt. The cover art will be provided by the very talented Jana Heidersdorf, whose dark vision and spectral style beautifully matches the tone of the project.  We are confident that together we can produce a book that is totally unique as well as spookily satisfying.

But we need your help. We can’t make this project a reality without your support. Please consider backing our INDIEGOGO campaign and help spread the word. With your support, we can make this book a success. Thank you!
 

Editors

Aaron J. French has a long track-record as a successful editor, with many years of experience working with NY Times bestselling authors and well-known figures in the film and art worlds. He is best known for editing several popular anthologies that include The Gods of H.P. Lovecraft, The Demons of King Solomon, Songs of the Satyrs, and the Monk Punk & Shadow of the Unknown Omnibus. 

In addition to his editing skills, Aaron brings to the project his scholarly background in the study of esotericism and magic and his many connections with both academic and practitioners in this field. As a current doctoral student in The Study of Religion, Aaron collaborates on research projects and articles dealing with the topic of the occult in history, spiritualism, and alternative religious movements. This experience will bolster the project’s realness and authenticity. In other words, this anthology will not only be a top-notch collection of unique speculative fiction, but also a serious meditation on the existence of spirits and the potential for still-living human beings to connect with them.  

From the day she was born, Bram Stoker Award-winner Jess Landry has always been attracted to the darker things in life. Her fondest childhood memories include getting nightmares from the Goosebumps books, watching The Hilarious House of Frightenstein, and reiterating to her parents that there was absolutely nothing wrong with her mental state.

Since then, Jess’s fiction has appeared in many anthologies, including Tales of the Lost, Twice-Told: A Collection of Doubles, Monsters of Any Kind, Where Nightmares Come From, Lost Highways: Dark Fictions from the Road, and Fantastic Tales of Terror, among others. Her debut collection, The Mother Wound, is set for release in early 2021 from Independent Legions Publishing. Jess has been an editor for over seven years, editing everything from short stories to Bram Stoker Award-winning novels and collections.

Also working as a screenwriter, Jess’s debut feature, My Only Sunshine, a coming-of-age horror film, has been called “a sharp and precise slow-burn horror story” by the Black List and is currently in development. My Only Sunshine was also accepted into Whistler Film Festival’s prestigious Screenwriters Lab for the 2020 season. Jess has written several other screenplays, including A Secret to Keep, Breast Cancer Bucket List, Deadly Mom Retreat, and The Therapy Nightmares, all for MarVista Entertainment and Lifetime. She’s currently in the writers room for Family First, a sitcom being developed by Eagle Vision and APTN, and has several other projects in various stages of development.

She is a member of the Winnipeg Film Group and OnScreen Manitoba, and currently sits on the Board of Trustees of the Horror Writers Association.
 

Cover Art

For the cover art, we’ll be using a piece by the enormously talented Jana Heidersdorf. However, if we reach our stretch goal, we will be commissioning a custom piece from her.

 

Jana Heidersdorf is an illustrator of the feral and fantastical located in Berlin. In surreal, moody mixed media compositions her work explores everything lurking in the dark and unseen, may it be creatures, feelings or fairytales. When she's not drawing you can find her dabbling in the dark arts of writing and photography or stalking the local bird population. Her clients include Cemetery Dance Publications, Amazon Studios ("LORE"), ImagineFX, Titan Comics, DC/Vertigo, Fabulous App, Erthe & Axen Records, and Bottleneck Gallery.

 

Interior Art

We are so lucky to have so many talented people on board with this project, and not just as authors. Sofia Ajram will be providing interior illustrations to accompany every story. Sofia Ajram is a multidisciplinary artist based in Montreal. She earned a BA in Gender, Sexuality, Feminist, and Social Justice Studies and East Asian Studies from McGill University. She is a moderator for the Horror and HorrorLit forums on Reddit and has given lectures on contemporary horror films at Monstrum Montreal. She is a supporting member of the Horror Writers Association, and Ethical Metalsmiths. Find her on Twitter @sofiaajram.

Bonus! We are also commissioning an original necklace designed around the theme of the book, which backers at the $350 level will receive (the necklace itself is valued at $550). The piece is hand-crafted by Sofia's company, Sofia Zakia, a fine jewelry brand based out of Montréal that weaves the charm and elegance of outer space and mythology through the quiet intimacy of jewelry. Each piece from Zakia is a love letter to its inspiration and reflects a gracefully expressive story or symbol of our universe and history.
 

Stretch Goals

  • If we raise $7,000, we will be commissioning custom cover art from Jana Heidersdorf.
  • If we raise $10,000, we will have an open call for submissions, paying pro rates.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with the production of any book, there are many logistical challenges and deadlines involved in its successful appearance on the market. This can include unexpected delays in the delivery of stories from authors, or in the editing and the printing processes, etc. However, we are confident that with the editors’ years of professional experience in dealing with such issues, as well as the stellar track-record of the publisher, such issues (should they arise) will not be a problem. We promise to make every effort to have the book in the hands of backers by the scheduled release date of August 27, 2021. Due to the current situation of the global pandemic, there is always a slight chance certain complications could arise in response to this, or perhaps a confirmed author may have an emergency and need to drop out of the anthology. In the unlikely event this should occur, their slot would be filled with another high-level popular author we decide would best fit the opening. We feel very confident there will not be a delay or that a confirmed author will not deliver, but sometimes these things do happen. We therefore ask for your confidence and trust in our sense as editors and professionals to make the best decisions should this occur.

 

Contributors

Gwendolyn Kiste

Gwendolyn Kiste is the Bram Stoker Award-winning author of The Rust Maidens, from Trepidatio Publishing; And Her Smile Will Untether the Universe, from JournalStone; the dark fantasy novella, Pretty Marys All in a Row, from Broken Eye Books; and the occult horror novelette, The Invention of Ghosts, from Nightscape Press. Her short fiction and nonfiction have appeared in Nightmare Magazine, Vastarien, Tor's Nightfire, Black Static, Daily Science Fiction, Unnerving, Interzone, and LampLight, among others. Originally from Ohio, she now resides on an abandoned horse farm outside of Pittsburgh with her husband, two cats, and not nearly enough ghosts. Find her online at gwendolynkiste.com.

Lee Murray

Lee Murray is a multi-award-winning writer and editor of science fiction, fantasy, and horror (Sir Julius Vogel, Australian Shadows) and a three-time Bram Stoker Award® nominee. Her works include the Taine McKenna military thrillers, and supernatural crime-noir series The Path of Ra co-written with Dan Rabarts, debut collection Grotesque: Monster Stories, and several books for children. She is the editor of sixteen anthologies, the most recent being Black Cranes: Tales of Unquiet Women (with Geneve Flynn), and the AHWA’s Midnight Echo #15. She is co-founder of Young New Zealand Writers and of the Wright-Murray Residency for Speculative Fiction Writers, and is HWA Mentor of the Year for 2019 and an Honorary Literary Fellow of the New Zealand Society of Authors. Lee lives over the hill from Hobbiton in New Zealand’s sunny Bay of Plenty where she dreams up stories from her office overlooking a cow paddock. Read more at www.leemurray.info @leemurraywriter

S.P. Miskowski

S.P. Miskowski has received two National Endowment for the Arts Fellowships, a Swarthout Award, This Is Horror Novel of the Year and a Charles Dexter Award. She been a finalist for a Shirley Jackson Award three times and a finalist for a Bram Stoker Award twice. Her books are available from Omnium Gatherum and JournalStone/Trepidatio. Her stories have been published in Supernatural Tales, Black Static, Identity Theory, Strange Aeons and Eyedolon Magazine, and in numerous anthologies including The Best Horror of the Year Volume Ten, Haunted Nights, The Madness of Dr. Caligari, Nox Pareidolia, October Dreams 2 and Darker Companions: Celebrating 50 Years of Ramsey Campbell.

Lisa Morton

Lisa Morton is a screenwriter, author of non-fiction books, and prose writer whose work was described by the American Library Association’s Readers’ Advisory Guide to Horror as “consistently dark, unsettling, and frightening.” She is a six-time winner of the Bram Stoker Award®, the author of four novels and over 150 short stories, and a world-class Halloween expert. Her recent releases include Weird Women: Classic Supernatural Fiction from Groundbreaking Female Writers 1852-1923 (co-edited with Leslie S. Klinger) and Calling the Spirits: A History of Seances; her latest short stories appeared in Best American Mystery Stories 2020, Final Cuts: New Tales of Hollywood Horror and Other Spectacles, and In League with Sherlock Holmes. Forthcoming in 2021 is the collection Night Terrors & Other Tales. Lisa lives in Los Angeles and online at www.lisamorton.com.

Gemma Files

Formerly a film critic, journalist, screenwriter and teacher, Gemma Files has been an award-winning horror author since 1999. She has published two collections of short work, two chap-books of speculative poetry, a Weird Western trilogy, a story-cycle and a stand-alone novel (Experimental Film, which won the 2016 Shirley Jackson Award for Best Novel and the 2016 Sunburst award for Best Adult Novel). She has two new story collections from Trepidatio (Spectral Evidence and Drawn Up From Deep Places), one upcoming from Cemetery Dance (Dark Is Better), and a new poetry collection from Aqueduct Press (Invocabulary).

David Demchuk

David Demchuk has been writing for print, stage, digital and other media for 40 years. His debut novel The Bone Mother was longlisted for the Scotiabank Giller Prize, shortlisted for the Amazon.ca First Novel Award and the Shirley Jackson Award among others, and received the Sunburst Award for excellence in Canadian speculative fiction. His new novel RED X will be published by Strange Light in Fall 2021. Born and raised in Winnipeg, he lives in Toronto.

 

 

Nadia Bulkin

Nadia Bulkin writes stories, thirteen of which appear in her debut collection, She Said Destroy (Word Horde, 2017). Her short stories have been included in editions of The Year's Best Weird Fiction, The Year's Best Horror, and The Year's Best Dark Fantasy & Horror. She has been nominated for the Shirley Jackson Award five times. She grew up in Jakarta, Indonesia with her Javanese father and American mother, before relocating to Lincoln, Nebraska. She has a B.A. in Political Science, an M.A. in International Affairs, and lives in Washington, D.C. 

With more to come!
story_txt:
About This Project
This project will fund an anthology titled THERE IS NO DEATH, THERE ARE NO DEAD containing approximately 12 short stories from some of today’s biggest names in dark fantasy and horror fiction. The book will be edited by Aaron J. French and Jess Landry, and published by Crystal Lake Publishing in August 2021.
 

The Spirits Of The Dead Exist And They Want To Communicate
First appearing in the late 1800s, spiritualism became a religious movement that swept the world. Under the assumption that the dead live on in the afterlife, spiritualists believed that contact with the dearly departed was not only possible, but something those who crossed over longed for. Contact was usually made through a medium, a person who claimed to have the ability to speak with the dead.
In a time of uncertainty, women in the movement were given a voice. Most notably, the Fox sisters became the faces of spiritualism—young, innocent, and cunning. As the popularity of the religion grew (along with the skepticism), the sisters and others like them swindled believers out of their hard-earned money, ultimately causing spiritualism to come crashing down around all those who claimed to have psychic abilities. However, there are still some who follow the movement to this day, driven by their belief that they can, in fact, communicate with the dead.
Featuring a mix of stories set in modern and olden times, THERE IS NO DEATH, THERE ARE NO DEAD tackles all aspects of the spiritualist movement: from the true believers to the nay-sayers, the hoaxes to hauntings, the real mediums to the scam artists. Edited by Aaron J. French and Jess Landry, and published by Crystal Lake Publishing in 2021. Authors include:
Lisa Morton
Kathe Koja
Helen Marshall
Lee Murray
Gwendolyn Kiste
Gemma Files
SP Miskowski
Seanan McGuire
Laird Barron
David Demchuk
Nadia Bulkin
Chesya Burke
And more to be announced…

To Our Backers
In order to fund this project, our goal is to raise $5,000. Backers of this project will be generating the base funds needed to produce this anthology, including payment for the contributing authors, payment for the cover artist, and production costs for producing the anthology. The reward levels are therefore calculated with respect to the cost of the final product when it goes on sale to the general public. In this sense, most backers of the project will be “preordering” the anthology, though often with an added advantage, which will help fund the paperback edition of the book. However, certain backers who choose a higher level of reward will help support the project at the paperback level as well as receive more substantial incentives, like additional books from Crystal Lake Publishing or editing services from Aaron J. French, Jess Landry, Crystal Lake Publishing owner Joe Mynhardt, and anthology contributor Lee Murray.
We promise to curate only the most powerful and original fiction for this project, only stories that truly capture the theme of spiritualism and communication with the dead. The publisher, Crystal Lake Publishing, is one of the top producers of speculative fiction, with many years of solid experience under their belt. The cover art will be provided by the very talented Jana Heidersdorf, whose dark vision and spectral style beautifully matches the tone of the project.  We are confident that together we can produce a book that is totally unique as well as spookily satisfying.
But we need your help. We can’t make this project a reality without your support. Please consider backing our INDIEGOGO campaign and help spread the word. With your support, we can make this book a success. Thank you! 

Editors

Aaron J. French has a long track-record as a successful editor, with many years of experience working with NY Times bestselling authors and well-known figures in the film and art worlds. He is best known for editing several popular anthologies that include The Gods of H.P. Lovecraft, The Demons of King Solomon, Songs of the Satyrs, and the Monk Punk & Shadow of the Unknown Omnibus. 
In addition to his editing skills, Aaron brings to the project his scholarly background in the study of esotericism and magic and his many connections with both academic and practitioners in this field. As a current doctoral student in The Study of Religion, Aaron collaborates on research projects and articles dealing with the topic of the occult in history, spiritualism, and alternative religious movements. This experience will bolster the project’s realness and authenticity. In other words, this anthology will not only be a top-notch collection of unique speculative fiction, but also a serious meditation on the existence of spirits and the potential for still-living human beings to connect with them.  

From the day she was born, Bram Stoker Award-winner Jess Landry has always been attracted to the darker things in life. Her fondest childhood memories include getting nightmares from the Goosebumps books, watching The Hilarious House of Frightenstein, and reiterating to her parents that there was absolutely nothing wrong with her mental state.
Since then, Jess’s fiction has appeared in many anthologies, including Tales of the Lost, Twice-Told: A Collection of Doubles, Monsters of Any Kind, Where Nightmares Come From, Lost Highways: Dark Fictions from the Road, and Fantastic Tales of Terror, among others. Her debut collection, The Mother Wound, is set for release in early 2021 from Independent Legions Publishing. Jess has been an editor for over seven years, editing everything from short stories to Bram Stoker Award-winning novels and collections.
Also working as a screenwriter, Jess’s debut feature, My Only Sunshine, a coming-of-age horror film, has been called “a sharp and precise slow-burn horror story” by the Black List and is currently in development. My Only Sunshine was also accepted into Whistler Film Festival’s prestigious Screenwriters Lab for the 2020 season. Jess has written several other screenplays, including A Secret to Keep, Breast Cancer Bucket List, Deadly Mom Retreat, and The Therapy Nightmares, all for MarVista Entertainment and Lifetime. She’s currently in the writers room for Family First, a sitcom being developed by Eagle Vision and APTN, and has several other projects in various stages of development.
She is a member of the Winnipeg Film Group and OnScreen Manitoba, and currently sits on the Board of Trustees of the Horror Writers Association. 


Cover Art
For the cover art, we’ll be using a piece by the enormously talented Jana Heidersdorf. However, if we reach our stretch goal, we will be commissioning a custom piece from her.

 
Jana Heidersdorf is an illustrator of the feral and fantastical located in Berlin. In surreal, moody mixed media compositions her work explores everything lurking in the dark and unseen, may it be creatures, feelings or fairytales. When she's not drawing you can find her dabbling in the dark arts of writing and photography or stalking the local bird population. Her clients include Cemetery Dance Publications, Amazon Studios ("LORE"), ImagineFX, Titan Comics, DC/Vertigo, Fabulous App, Erthe & Axen Records, and Bottleneck Gallery.
 
Interior Art
We are so lucky to have so many talented people on board with this project, and not just as authors. Sofia Ajram will be providing interior illustrations to accompany every story. Sofia Ajram is a multidisciplinary artist based in Montreal. She earned a BA in Gender, Sexuality, Feminist, and Social Justice Studies and East Asian Studies from McGill University. She is a moderator for the Horror and HorrorLit forums on Reddit and has given lectures on contemporary horror films at Monstrum Montreal. She is a supporting member of the Horror Writers Association, and Ethical Metalsmiths. Find her on Twitter @sofiaajram.
Bonus! We are also commissioning an original necklace designed around the theme of the book, which backers at the $350 level will receive (the necklace itself is valued at $550). The piece is hand-crafted by Sofia's company, Sofia Zakia, a fine jewelry brand based out of Montréal that weaves the charm and elegance of outer space and mythology through the quiet intimacy of jewelry. Each piece from Zakia is a love letter to its inspiration and reflects a gracefully expressive story or symbol of our universe and history. 
Stretch Goals

If we raise $7,000, we will be commissioning custom cover art from Jana Heidersdorf.
If we raise $10,000, we will have an open call for submissions, paying pro rates.

 
Risks & Challenges
As with the production of any book, there are many logistical challenges and deadlines involved in its successful appearance on the market. This can include unexpected delays in the delivery of stories from authors, or in the editing and the printing processes, etc. However, we are confident that with the editors’ years of professional experience in dealing with such issues, as well as the stellar track-record of the publisher, such issues (should they arise) will not be a problem. In the unlikely event this should occur, their slot would be filled with another high-level popular author we decide would best fit the opening. We feel very confident there will not be a delay or that a confirmed author will not deliver, but sometimes these things do happen. We therefore ask for your confidence and trust in our sense as editors and professionals to make the best decisions should this occur.

story:
Story of My Book

First Serve Yourself: How Young Leaders Around the World Achieve Dramatic Success offers practical and simple ways to help you become better - much better - in any area of your life.

All the principles are backed by science and supported by real-life examples that give the reader a clear path forward. Unlike self-help books that “tell you” what to do, First Serve Yourself offers a treasure trove of best practices and will empower you to coach yourself to the right answers.

My name is Vik Kapoor and I am the author of First Serve Yourself: How Young Leaders Around the World Achieve Dramatic Success. I wrote this book because we are in unprecedented times, with multiple major existential crises, and for some of us these moments will define the next decade or more of our lives. When no one but you has the next right answer, that’s when self-coaching is truly powerful. As you coach yourself, you are then able to inspire and support those around you at this critical juncture.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover proven tools and techniques that can personally work for you to grow and thrive as an incredible leader and person.  I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the power of self-coaching in personal improvement. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you achieve success on your own terms.

In this book, you'll learn about brain chemistry and daily structure. You'll hear stories such as...

  • How to shift your mindset in 5 seconds or less
  • What a mirror can do for our self-confidence
  • The relationship between journaling and good health
  • Why a Virtual Assistant calls me every day to ask me 20 questions

You will love this book if you:

1. like to work on yourself and are curious about new tools and methods

2. prefer to piece things together yourself rather than being handed a clean formula

3. have the time and energy to put things you read into practice

The Book

First Serve Yourself is a nonfiction book that speaks to young leaders who want to acquire new tools and skills to be their best selves. Coaching is a competitive advantage in life, and so is self-coaching.

The book is written in 3 parts:

Part 1 Setting the Stage for Self-Discovery. In this part we look at skepticism, emotion, and biases so you can clear the air and prep for the next two parts.

Part 2 Piecing it Together: Self Care. In this part we look at motivation, our “internal relationships” with money, time, and health, and finally we put together a loose life plan and a self-care plan so you have some structure around your priorities if you want it.

Part 3 Digging In: Self-Coaching Mastery. In the final part of the book we look at instruments and practices that can deepen your self-coaching. In this section I unpack how a mirror, journal, or voice recorder can help, and the power of both meditation and your creative imagination. I conclude the book with a reminder that we can serve others better when we first serve ourselves.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish Spring 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And more!

About the Author

Vikram (“Vik”) Kapoor is a highly sought-after speaker and facilitator, who weaves together cutting-edge science and practical wisdom to empower those who seek support around goal-setting, leading with values, collaborating in the workplace, bouncing back from setbacks, and galvanizing teams behind a common purpose. He is the founder and President of Extra-M Coaching and Consulting, which helps extraordinary millennials go farther in life.

Vik received his JD from Georgetown University Law Center and was a Regents Scholar at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). He also holds professional certificates in Organizational Coaching from George Mason University and Trauma Recovery from Harvard Medical School. Vik is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) recognized by the International Coach Federation (ICF) and is currently working towards Master Coaching Certification (MCC), the highest credential in professional coaching.

Vik is a passionate advocate for young leaders. He understands how life and career paths can be confusing and difficult to navigate without the necessary tools that help you succeed. By weaving together his personal stories and those of other leaders and mentors, he shows young leaders how it is possible to achieve dramatic success. Vik coaches entrepreneurs, new managers, executives and change makers so that they can better understand themselves and what they really want out of life. By looking inside ourselves, as Vik has done, we can find the courage and clarity to go farther in life than we ever thought possible.

In his spare time nowadays, Vik likes to play with his Virtual Reality headset and take long walks on his rooftop terrace. He hopes to get back to ultimate frisbee next year.

You can learn more about Vik Kapoor and Extra-M Coaching at www.extra-m.com, or connect with him for more information at info@extra-m.com and www.linkedin.com/in/vikapoor/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FirstServeYourself and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

 

Warm regards,

Vik

By looking inside ourselves, as Vik has done, we can find the courage and clarity to go farther in life than we ever thought possible.In his spare time nowadays, Vik likes to play with his Virtual Reality headset and take long walks on his rooftop terrace. He hopes to get back to ultimate frisbee next year.You can learn more about Vik Kapoor and Extra-M Coaching at www.extra-m.com, or connect with him for more information at info@extra-m.com and www.linkedin.com/in/vikapoor/Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FirstServeYourself and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support! Warm regards,Vik

story:
Story of My Book

Claim Your Worth Now is a non-fiction book with a memoir & self-help spin that provides weekly inspiration (similar to devotionals) to motivate readers to walk confidently into their self-worth. It also provides reflections and weekly to-dos that help readers accomplish their goals with intention.

My name is Toddchelle Young (pronouns: she/her/hers) and I am the author of Claim Your Worth Now. I wrote this book because I needed weekly inspiration to affirm my strengths and to lift my spirits to propel me forward towards my dreams. In a matter of weeks, I was able to discover keys to doors I didn’t know existed while opening ones that took a lifetime.

In reading this book, my hope is that you will discover intentional inspiration and understand why today's happiest and most successful people use the power of intention and purpose to drive their lives forward. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for conquering my dreams. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find the strength and energy within yourself to accomplish every goal you set out to achieve.

In this book:

  • You will receive weekly advice and lessons from doctors, entrepreneurs, professionals in public service, and more!
  • You will hear about Dr. Tererai Trent, Oprah’s all-time favorite guest. Her journey to overcome generational poverty to completing her PhD is incredible. Her stories make you want to reflect on your own path.
  • You will learn how I’ve navigated hardships by leaving my family to fulfill my educational goals, raising my brother while working full-time, and realizing my self-worth through academic failures and professional successes. Together, these experiences changed my approach to actualizing my dreams forever.

 

You will love this book if you need that extra “-umph”, or you know exactly what you want to accomplish but it is difficult to remain inspired, to get motivated, and to commit to moving yourself forward.


Claim Your Worth Now is a nonfiction book that speaks to working professionals, students, and anyone looking to get out of their own way in order to embrace intentional inspiration to conquer their dreams.
 

The Book - Claim Your Worth Now

The book is written in 3 parts...

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Weeks 1 through 17. You will be guided to confront your past, diving into circumstances to help you understand how and why you arrived to where you are today. By reaching into your past, you will find the pieces of the puzzle that are holding you backfrom current and future successes. 

Part 2 contains Weeks 18-35. You will focus in on the present, understanding your current habits, attitudes, and behaviors that may influence your motivation to move further than where you are. By intentionally embracing what inspires you today, you will directly impact the direction of your life. 

Part 3 contains Weeks 36 through 52 + Conclusion. You will find the inspiration you will need to achieve your goals. You will also learn about the realities of what it takes to create the future you desire. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. 

My goal is 200 copies!


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

And much more!

 

About the Author

Toddchelle Young is a graduate of Georgetown University with a bachelor’s degree in Sociology and certificates in Population Health and Strategic Management, as well as a graduate of Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health with a masters of public health degree in Sociomedical Sciences and a certificate in Social Determinants of Health. By day, Toddchelle serves as Director of Research at the Hub for Equity & Innovation in Higher Education at Georgetown University. After spending over a decade as a researcher, data analyst, and strategist—in clinical, governmental, non-governmental, and consulting spaces—she will be continuing her professional journey in the field of medicine.

In trying to strike a balance among working full-time, finishing classes toward applying to medical school, parenting her youngest brother (of whom has lived with her full-time since age 10), and enjoying her 20s as best as possible, #ClaimYourWorthWednesday and #ClaimYourWorthNow became a public self-affirmation movement to hold her accountable to accomplishing her goals. Her defined goals were straightforward—being the best sister/parent as possible, traveling the world, serving communities, and getting into medical school. Every Wednesday, Toddchelle used Instagram to visualize her affirmations as a constant reminder not to give up on her dreams when the journey became difficult. She wrote this book to inspire others to keep moving forward towards their goals and dreams, using weekly to-dos and motivational messages to stay focused.

Outside of writing, Toddchelle loves to spend time with her partner, Ademar, and her brother Clarence, traveling the world when possible (13 countries and counting), mentoring students, and braiding hair. She also loves brunching with friends and tasting wine (LOVES a good red blend) from all regions of the world.

For more information, you can connect with Toddchelle Young at toddchelleyoung@gmail.com, on Instagram, Facebook, or LinkedIn.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ClaimYourWorthNowBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

- Toddchelle

story:
Story of My Book

The Entrepreneurial Learning Journey – and Back Again

Have you ever wondered why the entrepreneurial classroom seems so different from a more traditional classroom? Perhaps you are an educator, or you are one of the students who signed up for an entrepreneurial class. Whatever your situation, if you are driven by a constant curiosity about entrepreneurship in the classroom, then this book is for you.

My name is Birgitte Wraae, and I wrote this book because I am driven by a curiosity to find what makes entrepreneurship so special to teach. Students are leaving our classroom feeling more changed and more aware of their own skills and competencies than ever before — and no doubt, that is special.

This book explores the world of entrepreneurship education, more specifically the journey we are asking our students to take. I call it a hero’s journey because the students enter the classroom expecting more of the same, but instead, they get a call to action – to explore and return with something that creates value for someone.

My hope is to instill in you the same passion for entrepreneurship that I have. I want you to see this book as a guide to understand the possibilities that entrepreneurship offers and use them on your own learning journey, whatever that may be.

In this book you will be taken on the entrepreneurial learning journey. It is an inspirational book based on my own experiences and conversations with experienced entrepreneurship educators around the world, you will learn about:

The importance of setting the scene and getting to know your students

Insights from experienced educators on the why, the how and the what of teaching entrepreneurship

The challenges students are facing

The role of the entrepreneurship educator

Personal reflections from students

What’s next for students returning to their own world


The Entrepreneurial Learning Journey – and Back Again is a nonfiction book. You will love this book if you love to teach, no matter the subject you are teaching, and are a curious educator on your own learning path. You will also enjoy it if you are a student entrepreneur wanting to understand the process, or if you are working within education and want to understand the possibilities that entrepreneurship offers.

 

The Book - The Entrepreneurial Learning Journey - and Back Again

The book is written in six parts.

Part 1 contains the first two chapters where I explore the purpose of entrepreneurship education and the personal development that is a part of the purpose.

Part 2 contains chapters 3-5, where we meet the students in the known world of education. It discusses the importance of getting to know the students and the concept of entrepreneurial learning.

Part 3 contains chapters 6-9 that zooms into the unknown world of entrepreneurship. I start with introducing the general understanding of entrepreneurship and move on to discuss which entrepreneurial competencies are needed, and how to foster a growth mindset. It is also here the students meet the abyss in the form of the emotional roller coaster.

Part 4 contains chapters 10-11, and focuses on the role of the entrepreneurship educator. Being an educator means taking on different roles to assist the students in reaching their goals.

Part 5 contains chapters 12-14 and forms a discussion around how we assess the students when they have reached the goal set for the course. The entrepreneurial learning journey also includes a change in the students’ mindset and their identity. How do we measure that?

Part 6 closes the journey with chapters 15-17 that discuss overall themes with entrepreneurship education including the dark sides as well as the future of the field.

All parts include personal reflections from students who have participated in an entrepreneurial course or programme.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

International Preorders

Unfortunately, international shipping will only be possible when the book becomes available on Amazon in December 2021/January of 2022. If you would still like to contribute to the campaign and receive a signed copy, please send me a message and we will work the international shipping out.

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

 

About the Author

Birgitte Wraae holds a Ph.D. in entrepreneurship education. She is working as an Associate Professor in Entrepreneurship at UCL University College Denmark, in Denmark. Her research interests are in entrepreneurship, especially entrepreneurship education: the role of the entrepreneurship educator, identity formation, emancipation, and reflection. She excels in doing research in connection with the entrepreneurial learning space. Her research has been published in a range of journals.

It is her firm belief that everyone would benefit from participating in the entrepreneurial learning journey. Her book opens the door into how an experienced entrepreneurship educator views that journey.

She is the co-developer and founder of Teachers Games, a method that puts entrepreneurial learning approaches into practice for both students and educators to become more entrepreneurial.

For more information, you can connect with Birgitte via email, LinkedIn or Twitter.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #EntrepreneurialLearningJourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
LinkedIn - @BirgitteWraae / @newdegreepress
Twitter -@BirgitteWraae / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Birgitte :-)

story:
Story of My Book

Intentional HR: A Revolution in Strategic Thinking is about strategic thinking in HR. Far too often business leaders have viewed HR as a strictly administrative function and some HR professionals inadvertently contribute to this perception. This book explores the critical importance of HR as a strategic function, why HR isn’t always given a “seat at the table”, and how HR professionals can become better strategic thinkers and business leaders.

My name is Mallory Herrin and I am the author of Intentional HR: A Revolution in Strategic Thinking. I wrote this book because I have heard from many HR professionals, throughout my career, that they are frustrated with not having a “seat at the table” and they aren’t viewed as a strategic business partner - and I’ve been there myself.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how vital HR strategy is to a business and I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for HR. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become a better strategic thinker and partner in business.

In this book, you'll learn about the strategic role of HR and how to overcome the misconception that HR is just a tactical role. You'll hear stories such as...

How HR leaders improved their strategic thinking abilities and earned their “seat at the table” through simple methods including embracing a different mind set, reading the news, and more!

How one entrepreneur, with a heart for service, combined HR strategy and corporate social responsibility initiatives to attract and retain top talent AND benefit his community.

Why employee centricity is becoming more critical to business success than ever before and why it will continue to be as the war for talent intensifies in the future.

You will love this book if you want to become a better strategic thinker, if you are an HR professional struggling to be valued as a business partner, or if you simply want to have a better understanding of HR functions.

Intentional HR: A Revolution in Strategic Thinking is a nonfiction book that speaks to HR professionals and business leaders outside of HR who want to look at HR and strategic thinking in a new way.

The Book - Intentional HR: A Revolution in Strategic Thinking

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1 - 3. This section answers the question “is HR strategic?” as readers learn the history of HR, the HR function’s strategic role in business, and why HR isn’t always perceived as a strategic function. Readers will learn why HR strategies are important to a business from day one, identify common skill gaps preventing HR professionals from being a strategic partner, and how they may be perpetuating the idea that HR is just administrative.

Part 2 contains chapters 4 - 6. This section dives into why HR is more critical today than ever before and how HR professionals must partner with business leaders for future success. Readers will learn the importance of employee centricity, the benefits of humanizing the workforce, and what workers really want. This section also explores the workforce impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and the war for talent ahead.

Part 3 contains chapters 7 - 9. This section is all about flipping the perception of HR as administrative on its head and becoming a strategic business leader. Readers will learn about re-framing their mindset, honing their focus, and overcoming skills gaps to become better strategic business leaders in the HR role.

What We Need & What You Get

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

About the Author

Mallory Herrin, SPHR, SHRM-CP, CPLC is the founder and Principal HR Consultant of HerrinHR, a full service Human Resources Consultancy located in Dallas, TX. She wrote this book because she has a passion for HR and helping other HR professionals to take their work to the next level.

Throughout her career, Mallory has often seen HR professionals relegated to paper processing and compliance related activities and knows how detrimental this becomes to an HR professional’s growth, and the companies they work for. She’s also seen the positive impact to the businesses she’s worked with as a consultant when HR is valued as a strategic function. She wanted to write this book to explore why this isn’t the case in every organization and how to overcome the misconception of HR as purely tactical.

Mallory isn’t just an HR professional, she’s also a wife, mother to two children, and a dog mom. She volunteers for several organizations, including Goodwill Industries of Dallas, Dallas CASA, DallasHR, Kinetic-Her, and more. In her almost non-existent spare time she enjoys local live music, seeing friends, and taking naps.

For more information, you can connect with Mallory Herrin at mallory@herrinhr.com and on LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link for just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #IntentionalHR and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: 

Instagram - @mallory.herrin/ @newdegreepress
Facebook - @mallory herrin / @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @HerrinMallory/ @NewDegreePress

And don't forget to find me and tag me on LinkedIn too!

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mallory Herrin

story:
Final Update: We did it!

Thank you to all my campaign backers and everyone who supported my book, The Next Gold Rush: How Cryptocurrency Will Change Everything. Even though the Indiegogo Campaign is officially completed, I'll accept pre-orders until my book launches in August.

Reach out to me on Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and/or Gmail if you're interested.

---



Story of My Book

The Next Gold Rush: How Cryptocurrency Will Change Everything is about the power of blockchain technology and its potential to impact every part of society. Cryptocurrency is the next evolution of the internet and my book will help you understand the power of this financial revolution.

---

My name is Ethan Turer and I am the author of The Next Gold Rush. I wrote this book because of my idea for a new cryptocurrency that can transform how people interact with one another. I want to inspire my readers about the future of cryptocurrency while educating them with interesting stories and research.

I hope that by reading my book you will discover what cryptocurrency is and how it will transform the world. In this book, I strive to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for cryptocurrency and the blockchain technology that powers it. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you begin your journey into the crypto space.

In this book, you will learn about the rise of Bitcoin and Ethereum and other stories of crypto change-makers. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Satoshi Nakamoto is an alias for a person (or group of people) whose identity we have yet to figure out. This alias is responsible for the Bitcoin whitepaper and its subsequent release in 2009. Bitcoin is the world’s first cryptocurrency and it was made possible because of a mysterious alias named Satoshi Nakamoto. In some ways, Satoshi's elusivity is the perfect symbol for a decentralized technology that needs no central authority or figure.
     
  • J.R. Willett is the inventor of the Initial Coin Offering (ICO). In my book, I outline my interview with him and explain why he felt compelled to make his idea a reality when no one else would. J.R. is also credited with being the creator of the stable coin which allows some cryptocurrency prices to remain “stable” while others experience volatility.
     
  • Taylor Swift’s tremendous success in the music industry, even without a record label, showcases the need of cryptocurrency for influencers that challenge the status quo. I discuss the idea of having your own personal coin in my book. If Taylor Swift had her own currency, then fans could invest in her coin and reap the benefits of her continued success.

 

If you are curious about this “new internet money” and why it’s increased in price to almost $60,000, you will love this book! Or maybe you know about Bitcoin but you want to be inspired about the next evolution of cryptocurrency!
 

The Book - The Next Gold Rush

The book is written in three parts for three types of people:

Part 1 is for the Crypto-Curious who don’t know anything about cryptocurrency but are interested in learning more. It contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-3. This part lays the foundation for understanding cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. It also compares historical and current events to the changes happening today.

Part 2 is for the Crypto-Conscious who know about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies but want to learn how it will be relevant to their lives. It contains Chapters 4-7 which covers topics like politics, entrepreneurship, social media, and more. This part focuses on the real-world applications of cryptocurrency in everyday life.

Part 3 is for the Crypto-Capitalists who are looking for more ways to invest their time, money and resources into cryptocurrency. It contains Chapters 8-11 and Conclusion. This part explains the risks and the fundamentals of investing in cryptocurrency. Then it outlines a roadmap for readers to continue their crypto journeys with their new knowledge.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this at the end of the summer.
     
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
     

About the Author

Ethan Turer is an author, podcast host, and entrepreneur who follows his passions and curiosities. He believes in the value of people and the power that cryptocurrency can bring to their lives.

In 2018, Ethan had an idea for a new cryptocurrency that could potentially change the world for the better. He was compelled to write this book to explain his idea and also make cryptocurrency more accessible for everyone.

During his free time Ethan enjoys going on hikes and exploring new restaurants. He is a father to his pet tortoise, Bernie La Tortuga aka BLT. Ethan loves to travel and met one of his favorite Game of Thrones actors while in the UK. Ethan had to shamelessly beg Kit Harrington for a selfie, but it was worth it... at least until Season 8 came out.

For more information, you can connect with Ethan Turer at ethanturer.com and on social media at: Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this promo of my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NextGoldRush and tag @ethan.turer.author as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
    Short link: https://igg.me/at/nextgoldrush
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
     

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ethan Turer

story:
The new "Not Just a Princess" book collection is all about empowering children to dream big. Learn about careers and encourage girls in particular to look at STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) subjects in a different light.

The "Not Just a Princess" series are the perfect bedtime books for your children. These beautifully written and wonderfully illustrated books are all about inspiring creativity.

We follow Princess Jade in her adventures with het robotic sidekick Hou Hou as she learns and grows into becoming a great leader, all under the watchful eye of her father, the kindly King.

 

 

 

 

"Princess culture has pros and cons for children's development.

On the one hand the world of princesses is one of rich imagination and magical thought while on the other it can perpetuate an ideology of princesses being passive as they await rescue where the focus is all too often on how they look rather than what they do. Any books, programs or other play stimulus that challenges this and portrays princesses as agents of action with exciting and interesting storylines is to be embraced and welcomed and is good for our children's development.

 

 

The Not Just a Princess series is based on challenging the Princess stereotype and puts the Princess front and centre of their own story. " - Joanna

For further info about Joanna Fortune and her work, please visit - www.solamh.com

 

 

 

 

This new collection consists of 3 books that are designed from 3-8 years old.

Each book contains 32 pages of wonderfully illustrated images that are printed on high quality paper.

Princess Jade is a creative young girl who is eager to learn everything that she can about the world around her. Despite her royal status, she sees herself as more than JUST a Princess.

She invents robots, vehicles and tools that allow her to help those around her as she learns valuable lessons. Brave, ambitious and headstrong, she is constantly finding herself in difficult situations. Watch her as she disappears into her secret underground lab where she stores her creations and launches into action!

 

 

Hou hou is Jade's robotic monkey who was built by her own hand. Jade, an only child, created a companion with whom shecould explore the world and have adventures with.

Hou hou is careful and cautious so he's the perfect balance to Jade and her exuberant behaviour. Enjoy his quirky sense of humour as he tries to guide Princess Jade in their escapades!

The "Dumb Dad" is too often a character in children’s literature and cartoons. In the "Not Just A Princess" book collection our dad character, the kindly King, is the antithesis of this terrible cliché. The King is compassionate, warm- hearted and intelligent. In each book he highlights issues within the kingdom with his digital scroll and encourages his daughter Jade to spring into action and help save the day!

 

Nora is an awe inspiring athlete in the Special Olympics. She has worked hard all her life and is not only an amazing athlete but also an incredible lifeguard. Watch Nora as she works with Jade and Hou Hou to save the Special Olympics!

 

Mimi is a world renowned archaeologist. She has spent gears learning about ancient history, studying relics and working on archeological digs. Mimi has found an ancient treasure but not everything is as it seems. Watch Mimi as she works with Jade and Hou Hou to solve the mystery!

 

 

Writing a book is a long process and needs MUCH tought and preparation. Much more than we EVER thought possible... but it REALLY is a labour of love.

 
 
Gavin Leonard and his daughter Jade started on this journey when Jade was born.

He read "The Princess and the Pea" and other similar stories to his daughter and moaned about female representation in stories to his wife. Shannon. She challenged him to write his own... little did she think that he would!

When Jade was born. Gavin noticed everyone would tell her that she was a "Princess" and could be a Model, a Singer or a Dancer when she grew up. But nobody mentioned she could be an Astronaut, a Nuclear Physicist or even the President!

So Gavin wanted to change the narrative around his daughter and started to think about a wag to inspire her and also document the time they spent together. He hopes these books will also inspire other kids to dream big and become whatever they want to be.

"I love that Princess Jade has a helicopter. meets cool people and has a robot! I love the books and want mg dad to write more and more"- Jade

Richard was really impressed with the idea behind the original books and felt Gavin's passion to take these to the next level. He was delighted to join the team as Creative Director and Story Consultant and use his many years of experience in pre-school animation to bring a team together to help revamp both the stories and artwork so they could stand out in such a competitive environment.

"The creative process was so enjoyable and incredibly rewarding. I hope all the kids will have as much fun reading these books as we had making them" – Richard

 

Ire and Otto met Gavin after the original book series was published.

They loved the concept of the idea of "Not Just a Princess" but wanted to discuss the artwork and how they would reimagine the character, the look and the style of the books.

After meeting with Jade, the pair were inspired to produce some AMAZING new imagery that fell in love with, and so began the journey of taking this new book collection to the next level.

" I love the reason for their journey and to see Jade come to life in the book was very satisfying" – Ire

 

In 2019, Andy and Roisin from Rad Ecom spoke with Gavin after his successful Kickstarter campaign for the original book series of "Not Just a Princess".

They wanted to work together to launch an online store for the sale of these books.

They built a shopify store, built out ad campaigns and have helped Gavin to bring the original books to market. Now they are working together again and using their talents to build the awareness of new and improved "Not Just a Princess" books.

"Book sales online are hard, but Gavin has a great project that we really want to see succeed" – Andy

 

 

Down Syndrome Ireland offers support and services to people with Down syndrome and their families throughout Ireland. The charity works with people across all the life stages. from new born to adult.

Every year. we need to raise over 80% of our costs to enable us to continue providing essential services. With minimum State funding, we rely heavily on fundraising and the generosity of the general public.

The proceeds from the sale of this wonderful book will go directly towards the work of Down Syndrome Ireland. and we are truly grateful to everyone involved.

For further info about Down Syndrome Ireland. please visit - www.downsgndrome.ie #ShareTheJourney

Special Olympics Ireland is a sports organisation for people with an intellectual disability. Since 1979 we have provided gear-round sports training, development and competition opportunities for children and adults at local. National and International levels. Through our network of community based clubs, thousands of children and adults enjoy significant physical, mental, emotional and social benefits that being part of our network provides. In more recent gears we’ve expanded our remit to provide health and personal development opportunities and early intervention programmes. By purchasing this book, you are part of our movement changing not only the lives of our athletes but their families and communities too. Thank you!

 

To find out more about our work. please visit - www.specialolympics.ie or find us on social media at Special Olympics Ireland.
story_txt:
The new "Not Just a Princess" book collection is all about empowering children to dream big. Learn about careers and encourage girls in particular to look at STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) subjects in a different light.The "Not Just a Princess" series are the perfect bedtime books for your children. These beautifully written and wonderfully illustrated books are all about inspiring creativity.We follow Princess Jade in her adventures with het robotic sidekick Hou Hou as she learns and grows into becoming a great leader, all under the watchful eye of her father, the kindly King.    "Princess culture has pros and cons for children's development.On the one hand the world of princesses is one of rich imagination and magical thought while on the other it can perpetuate an ideology of princesses being passive as they await rescue where the focus is all too often on how they look rather than what they do. Any books, programs or other play stimulus that challenges this and portrays princesses as agents of action with exciting and interesting storylines is to be embraced and welcomed and is good for our children's development.  The Not Just a Princess series is based on challenging the Princess stereotype and puts the Princess front and centre of their own story. " - JoannaFor further info about Joanna Fortune and her work, please visit - www.solamh.com    This new collection consists of 3 books that are designed from 3-8 years old.Each book contains 32 pages of wonderfully illustrated images that are printed on high quality paper.Princess Jade is a creative young girl who is eager to learn everything that she can about the world around her. Despite her royal status, she sees herself as more than JUST a Princess.She invents robots, vehicles and tools that allow her to help those around her as she learns valuable lessons. Brave, ambitious and headstrong, she is constantly finding herself in difficult situations. Watch her as she disappears into her secret underground lab where she stores her creations and launches into action!  Hou hou is Jade's robotic monkey who was built by her own hand. Jade, an only child, created a companion with whom shecould explore the world and have adventures with.Hou hou is careful and cautious so he's the perfect balance to Jade and her exuberant behaviour. Enjoy his quirky sense of humour as he tries to guide Princess Jade in their escapades!The "Dumb Dad" is too often a character in children’s literature and cartoons. In the "Not Just A Princess" book collection our dad character, the kindly King, is the antithesis of this terrible cliché. The King is compassionate, warm- hearted and intelligent. In each book he highlights issues within the kingdom with his digital scroll and encourages his daughter Jade to spring into action and help save the day! Nora is an awe inspiring athlete in the Special Olympics. She has worked hard all her life and is not only an amazing athlete but also an incredible lifeguard. Watch Nora as she works with Jade and Hou Hou to save the Special Olympics! Mimi is a world renowned archaeologist. She has spent gears learning about ancient history, studying relics and working on archeological digs. Mimi has found an ancient treasure but not everything is as it seems. Watch Mimi as she works with Jade and Hou Hou to solve the mystery!  Writing a book is a long process and needs MUCH tought and preparation.
