Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media. Thank you so much for all of your love and support!To purchase my last book, plus a 12 hour commentary go to https://rafiandklee.com/shop/books/ You Are Amazing!!! -Rafi www.rafiandklee.com www.therogueartist.com

story:
What is Sparks of Rebellion?

Sparks of Rebellion is an unorthodox take on high fantasy reminiscent of John Hughes movies. It features a dysfunctional group of teenagers working out their emotional trauma and uniting against an oppressive monarchy.

My name is Toby Cerezo, and I am the author of Sparks of Rebellion. I wrote this book because I wanted to create something that people could read to give themselves hope, especially while facing that truly fearsome beast known as adulthood.

I hope that this book helps to restore people’s faith in the collective potential of the world, as well as their own potential. In a world that reinforces how terrible everything is for the sake of ratings, it’s easy to forget that there will always be a way to make everyone’s lives better. It’s also easy to forget that anybody could find that way, whether they be young or old, straight or LGBTQ+, indigenous or an immigrant, religious or atheistic, etcetera.

In Sparks of Rebellion, the world of Threigsinn was shaped by thoughts and abandoned by fallible gods that were ashamed of their folly. The protagonist, Arvin White, is a cynical and self-doubting prodigy who is visited by a royal emissary with an invitation to a masquerade ball with his only friend, Chepha Vulcana. Along the way, they meet Rakim Evergreen and Alice Livingston, who recruit them in a plot to stop Duke Ferdinand Marioneta from taking the human throne and using genocide to gain public favor. After a mysterious goddess tries(and fails) to establish a good relationship with Arvin, four days of encountering long-repressed trauma and his newfound teenage angst threaten to rend his resolve and sanity to shreds. Can Arvin and his friends combine their efforts to steal reports from the duke at his own party? In most circles, it's considered poor etiquette to steal from guests, but some sacrifices must be made for the greater good.

This book features a lovably awful cast akin to that of The Breakfast Club, self-aware and self-deprecating humor, and classic tropes flipped on their heads. It also contains vivid descriptions of anxiety and PTSD, so if you aren’t a fan of that kind of content, then this isn’t for you.

Technically; according to my publisher, New Degree Press; this is the part where I tell you the discussions that I want Sparks of Rebellion to provoke. But despite all of the things I mentioned above, I believe that books should be open for readers to interpret. I don’t want anyone taking tests about the symbolism of Arvin's boots, but seeing how so many people have interpreted so many different projects in so many different ways makes my heart swell. I think it’s best to promote respectful disagreements and debates, especially when so many people are so quick to anger behind a screen.

In the end, no matter what you may think of me or my life story, I hope that Sparks of Rebellion lets you experience a full range of emotions that will leave you anticipating my next release. Unrealistic? Perhaps. That’s why I said “hope.” There’d be no point in hoping for something that simply falls at your feet. Maybe that’s what I think the greatest takeaway from Sparks of Rebellion is. While it is important that people have the chance to feel comfortable when escaping to another world, I feel that it is also necessary for people to set goals for themselves that aren't guaranteed to be met. After all, heroes can conquer more than monsters. One’s own inner demons feel like a good place to start.

What I Need & What You'll Get

New Degree Press is working with me to publish Sparks of Rebellion. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover my book's publishing costs. The money raised here will go towards... 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, e-book formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and e-book. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I'm also offering some neat rewards for people who pre-order my book here:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You'll be invited to my launch party, should we be able to organize one!

 

At higher perks, you'll get access to even more rewards!

  • "Dusty Keg Patrons" will receive all of the rewards mentioned above.
  • "Squeaky Wheel Foodies" will receive two signed copies of Sparks of Rebellion, as well as all of the rewards mentioned above!
  • "Nuish Nobles" will receive five signed copies of Sparks of Rebellion, as well as all of the rewards mentioned above!
  • "Hidden Fragments" will receive ten signed copies of Sparks of Rebellion and an Author Book Talk! Nearly anything you can think of - attending a party, speaking to a book club, or even guest starring in a video or stream! Fragments will also receive all of the rewards mentioned above!
  • "Divine Champions" will receive twenty-five signed copies of Sparks of Rebellion and all of the rewards mentioned above!

 

About the Author

Toby Cerezo is a junior in high school. He’s been writing Sparks of Rebellion since he was a freshman, and he has stories that he started back in seventh grade gathering dust in his Google Drive.

Toby wrote Sparks of Rebellion while he was going through a creative and mental slump. As seems to be the case with most people his age, middle school left Toby feeling drained and hopeless. It was only because of the friends that he made along the way that he could deal with his own emotional baggage, and he wants to help others feel that same way.

When he’s not writing, Toby blitzes through his schoolwork, plays games with his friends(mainly VALORANT and D&D), and watches streamers like Arcadum and QuarterJade on Twitch. His friends have been generally supportive of his efforts, if not a little tired of the constant updates regarding the publishing process.

For more, you can contact Toby at twarc034@gmail.com, look at his art at @crabs4dayz on Instagram, and learn weirdly personal information at @my_gentle_puck on TikTok. You can also find playlists for Arvin, Chepha, Rakim, Alice and more from Toby Cerezo on Spotify.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is mailing the finished book to you guys. Much like several other problems I've faced in the past, I have totally avoided this issue by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies in each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book depends on who I publish with. I'll be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We'll keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when Sparks of Rebellion will publish. You'll know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship; I'm on a first-name basis with a lot of sleep paralysis demons. Oh, and, like, we'll email you, I guess.

Other Ways You Can Help

Being an unemployed teenager whose bills are being paid by his parents, I fully understand if you can't financially back Sparks of Rebellion.  Luckily, if you're still inclined to support the start of the Fragments series, I have a short list of other things you can do!

For one, you can signal boost my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and LinkedIn with your friends, family, moots, and network. Please use #SparksOfRebellion and tag me and my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can put your posts on blast.

You can also share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page!

Lastly, you can share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it with a DM or a text on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Best wishes,
Toby Cerezo

story:
Story of My Book

Pajama, inc: Leading from home is a non-fiction book that speaks to those who are interested in leadership, planning to set-up a remote or virtual team, part of a remote team, struggling with remote work, or are digital nomads.

My name is Claryl Truz, and I am the author of Pajama, inc: Leading from home. The year, 2020, has changed people's lives. A big change in my own life was landing a job as a Business Analyst that turned into a promotion, which gave me the chance to become a virtual leader, leading twenty remote team members. Knowing that I did not have experience in leading a remote team, I searched for ways to help me build my team. 

I wrote this book because I've found that others who are new in remote work are also having the same issues as I am, i.e., building and strengthening connections when the typical serendipitous meet in the hallway moments no longer exist. This book is the results of my findings.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to build a culture within your virtual team and learn how to alleviate some of your pain points. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for leading this change in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you build and lead a virtual team, enhancing safe spaces in the work environment that is empowering and connected.

You'll learn how to promote an environment of inclusion and build and lead a remote team. You'll see that fostering a climate of inclusivity may be as easy as having people in the office open their PC and view the meeting through their screens. 

In the early years of Trello, few of their workers were remote. Trello had a town hall meeting every month to see the CEO, present their demos, meet new members, and ask questions. In their New York headquarters, the New Yorkers would meet in an office while the remote people would be on the screen, and they would have their town hall that way. They found out that that was not the right way to do it and quickly realized that it made the remote people feel like they were missing out on something and did not feel like they were included. The solution they came up with was to have the New Yorkers be on their computer as well. That way, they were all together doing the same thing and having the same access to the same resource.

You’ll also learn how to improve on clarity remotely. Dr. Monica Riordan, who has PhD in experimental psychology from the University of Memphis, introduced an emoji study. Her primary research area is exploring the way people are able to communicate emotions in computer-mediated environments. In the absence of facial features in a virtual environment, emojis place a certain role in virtual messaging. Emojis are often used to convey emotions that are harder to express with words and are complementary and not a substitute for text-based messages. 

If you are interested in the future of remote work, are part of the zoomer generation who wants to take a leap into leadership or you want to improve how to connect with your team members in a virtual environment, Pajama, inc: Leading from home is for you.

 

The Book - Pajama, inc: Leading from Home

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part (1) How We Got Here: Introduction + Chapters 1-6.
We explore the history of remote/virtual work and what catalyzed the expansion of the shift from a co-located workspace (in-office) to a non-colocated workspace (remote work). We also tackle the characteristics and principles of a leader who encourages team engagement and connectivity.

Part (2) Components that help establish your virtual team: Chapters 7-9.
Here we dig into specific components and tools that you can use to help enhance communication and culture building. How to build this team as well as enable, empower, and sustain it.

Part (3) Nugget of information about the future of leadership: Chapters 10. 
In the final section we'll reveal the promising future of virtual work.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [August, 2021].
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this [Summer 2021].


When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Claryl Truz is a supervisor leading a team of twenty. She earned a Bachelor's in Biology from the University of Dallas.
She wrote this book because she wanted to serve her team better. This book opened the door that allowed her to speak with virtual leaders with a long-standing experience with a non-colocated team and workspace. 

Outside of writing, Claryl enjoys time with her family, reading, listening to motivational speakers, and running. She is also a lifelong learner with relentless curiosity to better understand the world.

For more information, you can connect with Claryl at mtruz@udallas.edu as well as on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #innovation #leadership #authors #mindset #remotework #pajamainc and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Claryl Truz

story:
About the Book

When you know the ending of your story, how would you write the journey of your life?

In a fictional world not unlike ours, where people worship many gods and the elements tell us secrets, a young boy grapples with growing up when he is among the last generation of people to live.

During the sunset of his seventh birthday, Dante’s greatest challenge is coming to terms with the passage of Time and the inevitable changes this golden boy must face. No wisdom from the Great Spirits of the World – the Sun, Wind, Sea, and Gaia – could have ever prepared Dante for what the Fates have in store: humanity is infertile. Deemed “Aphrodite’s Curse,” this mysterious plague upends the framework of society with social upheaval, economic crises, technological advances, ecological revelations, and biological ultimatums.

Set in the seaside town of Pax, this story centers around Dante’s family and that of a neighbor, an inquisitive and thoughtful girl named Rose, to explore how relationships evolve and adapt in the backdrop of a prolonged Armageddon.

My name is Saba Nia and I am the author of Carpe Diem. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore human nature and how people interact with their environment, communities, and themselves when the longstanding conventions of life are challenged.

My desire is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to exert agency in your own life. I want you to view this book as an opportunity to grapple with the beautiful impermanence of our own stories that we must always strive to embrace. I hope that you enjoy joining Dante on his journey to “seize the day.”
 

About the Audience

Channeling the spirit of epic poetry and inspired by beloved stories like The Little Prince and The Alchemist, Carpe Diem is a commentary on how people come to grips with their mortality. Written in lyrical prose and infused with poetry, this story incorporates a slow-burn, philosophical approach to the end of the world to weave together a fable about the golden child who resists being an active agent in his life.

While grounded in character relationships and personal growth, Carpe Diem is an ode to the sci-fi and dystopian novels that sparked my love of literature. This story challenges readers to think critically about the consequences of an infertility pandemic. Who would society blame? Would people abandon all decorum and decency or would they want to end on a good note? What does it mean to be alive if, by biological terms, you are no longer a species? Would people abuse one another and the environment or would they atone for their mistakes? How would people resist aging? How would they use technology? What would be the role of artificial intelligence and machines? How would countries fight for resources? What would the economy look like when industries are no longer needed? Finally, how do we approach life when there is no reason to care about trophies or awards, no incentive to show off for posterity, no harm in sharing and taking risks instead of saving and waiting?

This book is for the scientists, artists, and dreamers, the lovers of epic poetry and mythology, readers ready to decipher and analyze minute sensory details, name choices, and plot points, and yet also those who enjoy complex character development. This book is written in a lyrical manner with its inclusion of poetry, but it is grounded in a deep respect for science fiction and dystopian novels. Yet, the book is equally made for the lovers of both Eastern and Western mythologies, indigenous communities, and classical folklore. You will love this book if you enjoy coming of age stories and exploring human relationships, but also desire a gripping plot.

Carpe Diem speaks to young adults and seasoned readers who want to grapple with exploring human nature in a new way. What would you do if you were the last generation to live? What are the limitations that prevent people from renouncing passivity and how do they overcome them? How do you create meaning in your life knowing it too will end?

Ultimately, I hope that Carpe Diem inspires reflection and generates more introspection and curiosity. I look forward to engaging with you and other readers who resonate with this story and hearing about yours.
 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in January 2022
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Standard Tiers:
  • Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published.
  • Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition.
  • Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
Community Tiers:
  • Silver Tier: Hit $6,500 and the book gets published.
  • Gold Tier: Hit $8,500 and a portion of the remaining campaign proceeds will go to Lutheran Social Services of the National Capital Area (LSSNCA) to provide refugee and migrant resettlement, workforce development, physical and cultural integration, and family and children services. I have worked personally with LSSNCA as President of Georgetown’s chapter of No Lost Generation, a nationwide student-led refugee advocacy network.

 

About the Author

Saba Nia is pre-medical student majoring in Psychology and minoring in Creative Writing and Biology at Georgetown University. Passionate about the intersection of several fields, in addition to writing creative prose and poetry, Saba advocates for the mental health of migrants, volunteers to promote educational equity, researches psychology and the medical uses of expressive writing, studies both environmental and biological sciences, and enjoys learning about different cultures and languages, especially from the Middle East.

Saba wrote Carpe Diem because she wanted to tell a story that reflects her passions, her favorite genres, styles of writing, and inspirations, and all the dynamic people she’s met. A novel for all, Carpe Diem includes characters of different ethnicity, age, socioeconomic status, sexual orientation, gender, and ability, neuroatypical individuals, indigenous people, and people coping with mental health issues.

Saba is still learning not only how to become a better writer and scholar but also a more active agent in her own life. It took seven years for an idea to become a published book, but Saba is proud of all the wisdom she has gained that has inspired her to make this story possible.

For more information, you can connect with Saba Nia at sabaniawriting@gmail.com and @saba_nia_writing on Instagram, @_SabaNia_ on Twitter, and Saba Nia on Facebook and LinkedIn.


 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
  • Identify the perk that interests you.
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount as the intended perk (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).
  • Use this form  to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.
  • If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to reach out. It would be a pleasure to help!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help a young author's book journey or support the portion of proceeds that will go towards migrant resettlement and integration, feel free to make a contribution of any donation size you are comfortable with.
I will also reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #carpediembook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!


Tags:

  • Instagram – @saba_nia_writing / @newdegreepress
  • Facebook – Saba Nia / @NewDegreePress
  • Twitter – @_SabaNia_ / @NewDegreePress


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Carpe Diem,
Saba Nia

story:
In July of 2017, I started my first IndieGoGo Campaign to raise contributions for my second book in the RJ the Mouse series. I didn't know what to expect, the journey for me was a step into the unknown, and when I took that first step I never expected to receive the outpouring of support that I received! 

Working together was amazing and with the help of my very talented team and your support, we were able to deliver and release The Adventures of RJ the Mouse: The Forgotten Voice!

Take a little peek below of the final illustrations and characters from the previous campaign!

 
 
 
 
 
 

Some Friendly Words to Share the Campaign!

Twitter: Support this awesome book and Author @RobertSilk85 today! Help his IndieGoGo campaign! #ANewJourneyANewAdventure! https://igg.me/at/RJMouseLonelyKing

Facebook: Support this awesome book and Author Robby Silk's campaign! #ANewJourneyANewAdventure! https://igg.me/at/RJMouseLonelyKing

 

Please Connect With Me Via

Facebook - Robby Silk Fan Page

Twitter - @RobertSilk85

Author Page - Robbysilk.com

 

Check out the First Books in the Series

The Adventures of RJ the Mouse: The Lost Castle

The Adventures of RJ the Mouse: The Forgotten Voice

story:
Laura Funk has been a Spiritual Director and Retreat Facilitator for over ten years. She went on a personal retreat in 2019 and was inspired to write a book of guided meditations. She has been using guided meditations with groups and individuals for a very long time with wonderfully positive feedback.

As Laura was working on this, another group of writings came knocking on the door. She has enjoyed imagining the lives of people from the Bible for many years. One Christmas she wrote monologues for each of her family members. She had great fun imagining their personalities in the story, weaving them in with what she knew about the Biblical characters. She has also been commissioned to write monologues for retreats, and for an academic journal to be published in the fall of 2021.

And so, these two groups of writings came together under the title of “People and Places of Sacred Interior Spaces.” The idea of interior spaces speaks both to the imagination as well as that beautiful space inside each of us where we encounter the Divine whisperings of the Spirit. Each piece in this carefully crafted book can lead you through your own sacred interior space to inspire you to grow and develop more deeply into the person you are made to be.

Many of us have a great deal of stress in our lives. Learning to meditate in a way that clears our minds and releases all thoughts can be a long, difficult process. Using guided meditations gives freedom to your imagination and lets you access inner peace in your first experience, melting away stress and fatigue and invigorating you to enjoy life more fully.

 

What’s in the Book?


The “people” section of the book contains 16 beautifully and creatively written pieces about various people from the gospel stories and one that is based on recent research into the early church. You’ll meet Zechariah and Symeon, Anna’s apprentice and Maryanne the innkeeper, the woman at the well and Martha and Mary.

The “places” section contains 34 guided meditations designed to bring you inner peace and joy, help you work through areas of difficulty in your life, and grow more deeply into the knowledge and experience of Divine love. You’ll explore the contents of your metaphorical backpack, journey up a mountain with Jesus, watch the sunrise, walk through nature, encounter the great cloud of witnesses who love you…

 

What other people are saying about the book

“It was a pleasure to read. I can imagine this book would be a valuable resource for churches, counselors, and spiritual directors. It would definitely be a treasure for individuals to own and utilize as a way to explore and go deeper in their spiritual journey.”

  • editor’s evaluation of the manuscript, Friesen Press

 

“You have done some lovely pieces and working with these stories you certainly have an agile and delightful imagination. As a spiritual director, you have experience in conversation with your people, helping make pathways to prayer and experience with the presence of God.”

  • Eleanor Kreider, is a Mennonite scholar and missionary educator, prolific author and editor of many books on Liturgy and Worship

 

“The meditations are easy to read but not simplistic.  Explanations are clear.  Fresh insights and new perspectives on the biblical story make them appealing.  Well-known and lesser-known biblical characters come to life.  The pace is gentle.  You leave open-ended spaces for Spirit and the imagination.  Though there are teaching gems inserted into the meditations, they are gracefully included and don't feel didactic…. I appreciated the strong emphasis on women characters and women's experiences.”

  • Marlene Kropf, DMin, Associate Professor Emerita in Spiritual Formation and Worship and author of Preparing Sunday Dinner: A collaborative approach to worship and preaching

 

“I absolutely love the midrashic monologues. They made scriptural time, place and story very real to me and drew me in as a person to the scenes and settings. They were very meaningful. My favorite was “Not Mary” because it really spoke to me about the times we don’t respond and the opportunities we may be missing because we have too little trust and can’t bring ourselves to take a risk. Love that phrase: ‘I didn’t trust myself to know what I knew.’

 I found it very soothing somehow that (you) used completely natural situations that we can all identify with and which we all experience to bring us in touch with our deeper selves, even when sometimes they were things that we might find difficult to confront. Taking very practical things, like a backpack, and using them as a metaphor to go deeper was also very helpful. I also appreciated your ability to say without preaching how we are so interconnected with one another, with creation, etc., and doing it a way that the reader is invited to explore those possibilities rather than being told.

Something that really stood out to me is that I couldn’t tell what religious tradition you came from. I think that’s a tremendous strength because I think it makes the book appeal to a wider audience; it’s simply for all those of us who want to go deeper, to connect with creation and the creator, whatever that may mean.”

  • Sr. Karen Rose, Director of Mission Advancement, St. Joseph’s Monastery, Minnesota

 

Perks!

In addition to getting either an e-copy or paperback copy of the book, you can choose from other options, like the “backer bundle” or the “bonus backer bundle” that include:

~ a journal to write your thoughts about the guided meditations or your own dialogues with the Biblical people you’ll meet in the book,

~ audio recordings of some of the meditations led by the author,

~ advance pdfs of some of the content as exclusive previews including one written specifically for the pandemic

~ a door hanger to gently inform people not to disturb you while you are using the meditations

Other perks include

~ a private audience with the author for you personally or your group: Laura is a trained spiritual director and skilled in many tools to help you grow spiritually. She is also an experienced retreat and seminar leader.

~ You can also sign up to attend or host a retreat that will use the guided meditations to lead you deeper into inner peace and joy

~ The author will write a custom piece on a topic or person of your choosing. You can have your very own, personally written piece, not included in the book.

Check out the sidebar for more details!

 

Where does the money go?

 

How will your contribution help this project? Check out this great pie chart!

As you can see, about half the funds will go towards publishing fees. Self-publishing is different from other paths in that the author hires a team who help to produce and promote the book. Another large part is the actual printing of the book. The remaining funds will go towards fulfillment and shipping costs, as well as Indiegogo fees for this campaign. If we exceed our goals, extra funds will go towards having a professional cover done, extra proofreading, and making the book available to those who can’t afford to purchase it.

Special Bonus

When we hit our target, everyone who supports this campaign will be entered in a draw for some great prizes. So please share this campaign and encourage your friends to sign up!

What else can I do?

Your amplification of this campaign can go huge and helpful distances. Please share a link to this campaign and send a personal message from you about why you support the production of this book.

Share this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/people-place...

Visit the author at her website to learn more about her ministry, Butterfly Journeys, and to order the book once the campaign is over: https://butterflyjourneys.ca

I think that’s a tremendous strength because I think it makes the book appeal to a wider audience; it’s simply for all those of us who want to go deeper, to connect with creation and the creator, whatever that may mean.”Sr. Karen Rose, Director of Mission Advancement, St. Joseph’s Monastery, Minnesota Perks!In addition to getting either an e-copy or paperback copy of the book, you can choose from other options, like the “backer bundle” or the “bonus backer bundle” that include:~ a journal to write your thoughts about the guided meditations or your own dialogues with the Biblical people you’ll meet in the book,~ audio recordings of some of the meditations led by the author,~ advance pdfs of some of the content as exclusive previews including one written specifically for the pandemic~ a door hanger to gently inform people not to disturb you while you are using the meditationsOther perks include~ a private audience with the author for you personally or your group: Laura is a trained spiritual director and skilled in many tools to help you grow spiritually. She is also an experienced retreat and seminar leader.~ You can also sign up to attend or host a retreat that will use the guided meditations to lead you deeper into inner peace and joy~ The author will write a custom piece on a topic or person of your choosing. You can have your very own, personally written piece, not included in the book.Check out the sidebar for more details! Where does the money go? How will your contribution help this project? Check out this great pie chart!As you can see, about half the funds will go towards publishing fees. Self-publishing is different from other paths in that the author hires a team who help to produce and promote the book. Another large part is the actual printing of the book. The remaining funds will go towards fulfillment and shipping costs, as well as Indiegogo fees for this campaign. If we exceed our goals, extra funds will go towards having a professional cover done, extra proofreading, and making the book available to those who can’t afford to purchase it.Special BonusWhen we hit our target, everyone who supports this campaign will be entered in a draw for some great prizes. So please share this campaign and encourage your friends to sign up!What else can I do?Your amplification of this campaign can go huge and helpful distances. Please share a link to this campaign and send a personal message from you about why you support the production of this book.Share this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/people-place...Visit the author at her website to learn more about her ministry, Butterfly Journeys, and to order the book once the campaign is over: https://butterflyjourneys.ca

story:
*** VELKOMMEN TIL ***

Har du set videoen, hvor jeg introducerer det vigtigste? :)

 

*** BAGSIDETEKST ***

Romanen 'Lysere dage' er fortællingen om en introvert maler, der pakker sit knuste hjerte og ikke så meget andet og flygter i eksil på landet. Hun er træt af omgivelsernes pres for, at hun skal komme sig, komme videre, komme op på en eller anden ny hest. Hun vil have lov til at være i sorg. I et kedeligt sommerhus er hun så endelig alene med smerten, som glider ned med en ordentlig spand gin og YouTube-videoer med soldater, der overrasker deres familier ved at komme hjem på uventet orlov. Her er det helt i orden, at alle græder igennem.

Dette er en historie om at snuble og komme op igen med hjælp fra en interesseret landsby.

 

 

*** HVORFOR STØTTE? ***

En crowdfunding er at bede om en form for forhåndsanerkendelse. Jeg er afhængig af andres velvilje, nysgerrighed og tro på mig og/eller mine ord for at få min drøm opfyldt og have midlerne til at udgive 'Lysere dage'.

 

  • Måske læser du med på min blog (Ennybesked.dk) og vil gerne se, hvad jeg har at byde på i romanform
  • Måske læser du uddragene på denne side og bliver simpelthen nødt til at vide mere
  • Måske støtter du mig i dag, fordi du selv har fået en håndsrækning, da du havde brug for det
  • Når du støtter denne crowdfunding, giver du en meget håndgribelig opbakning på et tidspunkt i projektets proces, hvor man ellers er meget alene. At have nogen der tror på én, er ubetaleligt.
  • Måske synes du bare, jeg er vildt flink og vil gerne hjælpe

 

Hvad end din bevæggrunde er for at hjælpe en forfatterdrøm til virkelighed:

Fra maven og hjertet tak. Jeg kan ikke gøre det her uden dig.

Nedenfor kan du læse info om og uddrag fra bogen, lidt biografiske oplysninger om mig, og hvordan du kan hjælpe på andre måder end med gylden mønt. Har du spørgsmål eller vil du gerne i kontakt med mig, finder du kontaktoplysninger i FAQ.

 

 

*** UDDRAG ***

Vinden flår i trækronerne, og skyer pisker over himlen. Det er svært at få vejret på sommerhusets to-, eller hvis jeg er heldig, tregearede SCO. Hver gang jeg tvinger pedalerne ned, messer jeg: "ikke ... mere, ikke ... mere, ikke ... mere."

Købmandsdamen løfter begge buskede øjenbryn af mine varer på båndet.

– Chokolade, chokolade, chips OG lakrids? siger hun i takt til scannerens bippen.

– Og så skal jeg bede om tres orange Kings og to flasker gin.

Jeg lyder trodsig. Hun får mig til at føle mig som et barn. Det er skide irriterende. Hun er tavs, mens jeg pakker mine varer ned i rygsækken. Jeg overbeviser mig selv om, at hun da heldigvis er totalt ligeglad med, hvad jeg køber. Jeg begynder at trække vejret lidt lettere. Det er bare mig, der obsesser. For en sikkerheds skyld nikker jeg alligevel farvel til hende med øjnene et godt stykke over hendes krøllede hoved og vender mig mod døren med mit læs.

– Du har ikke brug for chokolade min pige. Du har brug for at blive rusket ordentligt igennem, gjalder hun efter mig, mens jeg snubler ud af butikken.

Jeg tager altid så meget fejl.

 

 

*** FAKTA OM LYSERE DAGE ***

  • Bogen udkommer i hæftet format (et blødt format, mere holdbart end en paperback)
  • Omtrent 120 sider lang og trykt på kvalitetspapir
  • Første oplag er på 300 eksemplarer, med mindre denne crowdfunding går amok. I så fald bliver størrelsen på 1. oplag opjusteret 
  • E-bogen laves i formaterne EPUB og PDF
  • Omslaget udformes af grafisk designer Gitte Thrane 
  • Forsideillustration: Brooke Shaden©
  • Illustration / doodle i romanen: Gitte Gade

 

*** HVILKE OMKOSTNINGER DÆKKER CROWDFUNDINGEN? ***

  • Redaktørarbejde
  • Korrekturlæsning
  • Grafisk arbejde & omslag (ikke noget grafisk hjemmefuskeri)
  • Tryk
  • Emballage og porto
  • Gebyr til Indiegogo, hvis platform gør denne crowdfunding mulig

 

 

*** LIDT OM FORFATTEREN ***

Mit navn er Christina Andersen Reyn. Jeg er 49 år gammel. Bibliotekar af uddannelse, iværksætter og drømmer af sind. Jeg er mor til to - begge i en spændende alder (knap 13 og 15). 

Min første erindring om at ville være forfatter stammer fra jeg var 12. Forfatterjobbet lød fantastisk. Tænk at det helt lovligt kunne være ens job at leve i fantasien, selv bestemme alting (også hvordan historien ender) og kun arbejde sammen med folk, man selv havde valgt.

Alt det mit 12-årige jeg tænkte, gælder stadig. 

Siden har jeg fundet ud af, at jeg gerne vil røre andre. Ikke sådan håndgribeligt vel, ikke så mange i hvert fald, men jeg vil gerne give andre noget at tænke på eller en følelse i maven og rigtig gerne et grin.

Det tog mig meget lang tid at turde skrive en bog. Sådan med begyndelse, forholdsvis fyldig midte og noget, der lignede en slutning. Jeg turde først, da jeg tvang tankerne væk fra eventuelle læsere og deres  mulige reaktioner på mine ord. Jeg turde, da jeg besluttede, at nu skrev jeg en bog kun for mig. Men så virkede det også.

Men for mig findes en bog først rigtigt, når jeg kan mærke papiret i mine hænder. 

Jeg ser den gerne i dine også.

 

Tak for din tid og støtte,

Christina Andersen Reyn

 

*** UDDRAG ***

Jeg drømmer, vi står over for hinanden og kaster med en bold. I starten griber vi hver gang, men så taber jeg bolden. Jeg samler den op igen. Det gør ikke noget, vi leger bare. Så taber du den også, og jeg begynder at blive nervøs. Det er meget vigtigt, at vi ikke taber bolden mere. Men det gør vi. Det er som om, jeg mister troen på, at vi kan finde ud af denne leg, dig og mig. Er bange nu. Du begynder at kigge væk, du kaster skødesløst og virker uinteresseret. Jeg bliver mere og mere sammenbidt og insisterende. Det er helt afgørende, at vi bliver ved med at kaste. Hvis vi ikke snart begynder at gribe den bold langt oftere, så falder himlen. Jeg ser ned og opdager, at bolden er et hjerte.

 

 

*** ANDRE MÅDER DU KAN HJÆLPE PÅ ***

Det er ikke alle, der har råd til at bidrage økonomisk, så her er et par andre måder at hjælpe på:

Del denne kampagne på dine sociale medier, eller fortæl en ven der måske kunne være interesseret, om den.

Følg / like / del mig på Instagram (@christina_andersen_reyn), Facebook eller på bloggen Ennybesked.dk for tekster i lidt længere format.

story:
Short Summary

Do you have any children or young people in your life who matter to you? Do you also feel like the world is heading in a crazy direction but don't know what to do to change it? 

My name is Alok Appadurai and I have been on a 15-year journey to change the world. When I look down at my young child asleep in his bed, I know I have to make the world a better place for him and future generations to grow up in! I must! So I began writing an inspiring book called GOOD ELEPHANT as a roadmap for anyone anywhere in the world to JOIN ME in changing the world for the better! 

I dedicate every ounce of my being towards this end as co-founder of Fed By Threads which has fed almost 500,000 meals & A Beautiful Body Project with Jade Beall which has touched 1.8 million lives, mostly women. But that isn't enough! 


Why believe in me? I work 6.5 days/week to change the world. I spend virtually every waking moment dedicated to producing positive impacts on people's lives. I don't drink, I don't smoke, I live in a humble home, and put everything on the line all the time for what I believe in. 

The book is based on anecdotes from my own life in the trenches of trying to change the world, some funny, some sad; from 20 years of human experiences traveling to 30 countries, fatherhood, being a social entrepreneur, coming from a mixed-race household, losing my mother to cancer, my years teaching 4th grade, failures, humor, a deep belief in empathy, and a track record of completely turning my own life around in order to increase my positive impacts on people's lives and the planet over the last decade. 

This is not a theoretical abstract on change: this is the book I wish I had been able to read in my 20's when I was asking questions about how I could change my life to make a difference in the world. This is literally my roadmap for how we get our world back on track. I can't do it alone: it will take millions of people making millions of positive changes, but to blindly hope for that without giving people a plan for WHAT to do is ridiculous. I know this sounds completely unbelievable, but through my own journey to change my own life, I passionately believe each of us is a direct participant for the better or the worse in what happens in the world. So join me and let's change the world together. 

You can research me here to make sure I am legit: 


  • Watch my TEDxTalk on Emotional Capitalism (click above)
  • www.AlokAppadurai.com
  • www.FedByThreads.com
  • www.ABeautifulBodyProject.org
  • www.GoodElephant.co

What I Need & What You Get

I need your help to fund this book and make this book project go viral as part of our collective push to mobilize the Give Generation. I live very humbly and can't fund this book on my own but with your help, you can propel it into the hands of many people and create ripple effects that can spread far and wide. 
In exchange, I am offering inspiring perks like hugs from me (come on, you know you might need one sometime), the ebook, the paperback book, a Good Elephant organic American-made t-shirt made by Fed By Threads, getting listed as a donor in the book, private sessions with me about how to change your life, public speaking engagements, but most importantly, you will know that you didn't sit on the sidelines when you were given an opportunity to help someone who dedicates every ounce of their being to changing the world. 

The Impact

Every day people ask me how I changed my life and what can they do to be part of movements for change. The first thing I tell them is that it is FUN! Throughout history, major change has occurred when enough people start questioning what is "normal" and I believe we are at another one of those moments. We are direct participants who can reverse climate change, end sweatshop labor, rebuild our food supply, protect animals, save the rain forests WITHOUT it feeling like a daunting impossible task! How exciting is that?! Millions of highly-doable actions by millions of people will change the world. I firmly believe this. The choice is up to you if you will be one of those millions or not. But you can't sit on the sidelines and complain about things getting worse in the world if you yourself won't act! So join me! 

Risks & Challenges

I have already written half the book and will publish as many copies as I possibly can with whatever funds I am able to raise. There is a risk that nothing will change, that no one will care, but I think that risk is low considering the impact that the projects I am involved with already are having. I guess I could also fall ill which may prevent me from being able to finish but at the current time, I am in the best health of my life. This book is going to happen if I have anything to say about it! 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help me in so many way!!!! 

  • POST THIS VIDEO, ask the people you know to post it too, and share my passion for changing the world with anyone you think is a positive change maker looking to make a difference! 
  • Contact any newspapers, TV stations, or journalists you know and tell them about how I am trying to save the world. If you believe in me and my compassion, let them know that. 
  • Add a comment on this campaign (that helps drive this campaign higher in the rankings
  • Send an email out to your friends and family about what I am doing. 
  • Have the courage to be amazing! 
  • Step into a belief that you matter. Put your chin up and realize how powerful you are to make a difference. Shine the light on yourself! 
If you are still reading this far, all I can say is thank you! You are amazing! Come get a hug! Changing the world for the better or for the worse will happen based on whether people like you and me act in unison. Are you ready? I am. -Alok Appadurai

story:
Welcome to the Florida Writers Project

For the past 10 years, Wordier Than Thou has connected Florida writers and readers in fun, offbeat ways, whether it's through immersive theater projects or drag and burlesque shows or themed storytelling events. 

Now, we want to publish the work of Florida authors. We're raising funds for our first publishing project, Tennessee Murder Ballad, the debut novel of Heather Jones.

The COVID-19 pandemic pushed back our publication timeline for Tennessee Murder Ballad, but we're back on track and plan to release it this summer. Pre-order your copy today!

About Tennessee Murder Ballad

In April 1848, preacher Paul Crane rides into a lonesome Appalachian town and kills Ellen Bridges, a widow whose music he believes to be witchcraft, by throwing her into a well. A group of children, including her grandson, Carter, push him in after her to avenge her murder. As the preacher disappears into the darkness, he curses the children, the town, and the mountains where they live.

Eight of the children grow up to survive the American Civil War only to re-encounter the preacher’s curse. But the music and love of Ellen Bridges have also survived in the mountains. During four days in April 1866, as the moon waxes full, a sinister circus appears on Ellen’s former property, and a fire rages down the mountain, each of the remaining children, now adults, meets their destiny of redemption, or death.

What Readers Are Saying

“If Zora Neale Hurston, Stephen Crane, Toni Morrison, and Annie Proulx started an a cappella group specializing in haunting love songs in five-part harmony—the fifth part being the ghost note—and you were lucky enough to listen, you might be able to imagine some of the power of Heather Jones’s novel Tennessee Murder Ballad.”

           —Jill Kelly Koren, author of Though the Word is a Lie

“Layering folklore and magical realism against the bleak, poverty-stricken backdrop of rural Appalachia post-Civil War, Heather Jones writes with a talent and historical perspective that is astounding.”

                    —Kimberly Lojewski, author of Worm Fiddling Nocturne in the Key of a Broken Heart

“…a multi-voiced, Faulknerian investigation of one horrible day in Sinking Springs…Jones’ style is as direct and earthy as the ballads she references, making Tennessee Murder Ballad an easy read in one way, a spooky and challenging one in another. Magical, Freudian Southern Gothic at its finest!”

                                                       —David Brendan Hopes, author of The Falls of the Wyona

About the Author

Heather Jones is a playwright, educator, and poet based in St. Petersburg, Florida.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to pre-order your copy of Tennessee Murder Ballad or want to help us spread the word, please share this fundraiser with your book-loving friends!

Also, follow Wordier Than Thou and the Florida Writers Project on Facebook

story:
Story of My Book

The Hard Parts of Life is a book about the crystals that living things make to survive: things like phytoliths, shells, and bones. I have compiled interviews with experts about how these crystals––called biominerals––form and what we can learn from them, from understanding past environments and what life might look like on other planets to revolutionizing materials and medicine.

My name is Robert Ulrich and I am the author of The Hard Parts of Life. I wrote this book because I want to share what biominerals are and what we can learn from them. The stories that biominerals tell teach us about past worlds, and the processes that create biominerals model how to make strong materials in sustainable ways.

 

For me, this book also marks the beginning of a new writing practice: a foray into creative science writing. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a newfound fascination and appreciation for nature and life. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for biominerals and the science that happens at the interface of multiple disciplines. There is so much that goes into the making of a tooth, a pearl, a bone, and the research around them, and by studying them has profound impact. In this book, we learn: How does the chemistry of a shell tell us about ocean conditions? What can a fossil tooth tell us about the evolution of dinosaurs? How does studying pearl help us create organs? Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you think about how seemingly disparate things might be connected and what we can learn from nature, which has been making these materials for billions of years.

In this book, you'll learn about personal stories of scientists, how they came into science, and the science they do. You'll hear stories such as...

Dr. Hannah Carroll’s and Dr. Dan Ibarra’s, who tell us about why biominerals and knowing about the past is important for informing climate predictions.

Dr. Joby Hollis’s, who tells about how understanding biominerals—and how organic material gets trapped inside them—can aide us in the search for extraterrestrial life.

Dr. Ronke Olabisi’s, who teaches us about how bones form and how studying pearl can inform regenerative medicine.

You will love this book if you are interested in science, want to know more about some of the people who do it, and curious about the worlds both inside and around you. 

The Hard Parts of Life is a nonfiction book that speaks to people who are curious about the natural world and scientists, current and future, who want to look at how nature and what we can learn from it.

 

The Book - The Hard Parts of Life

The book is written into three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. Here, we start with learning what life’s hard parts - biominerals - are and what we know about when biomineralization, the process of forming biominerals, evolved.

Part 2 contains chapters 2 and 3. This is where we talk about how biominerals are a window to the past. From Dr. Raquel Bryant, Alex Villa, and Kalani Heinz, we learn about what biominerals can tell us about the environments and climates. From Jade Knighton, we learn about what biominerals can tell us about past life.

Part 3 contains chapters 4 through 9. In the last part of the book, we learn about the many implications— implications that touch our everyday lives— that biomineral research affords us. Biominerals hold the keys to the future of climate prediction, the search for extraterrestrial life, and medicine.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May of 2022.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be recognized in the Acknowledgements section.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $6,550 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $7,550 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $9,550 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Rob is an award-winning scientist––holding fellowships with the National Science Foundation and the Center for Diverse Leadership in Science––currently pursuing their Ph.D. at the University of California, Los Angeles. Their research looks at how living things make crystalline materials using geochemistry. They have published peer-reviewed research papers, Op-Eds, and [now!] a book as well as spoken at the California and New York Academies of Sciences and appeared on popular science podcasts such as 'Ologies' and 'Talk Nerdy'

Rob wrote this book because they love the science they do. They research an incredibly important part of life at a fundamental level, and the research itself spans multiple scientific disciplines—pulling from biology, chemistry, geology, and materials science-- and has applications that transcend them and that will impact our daily lives. Rob hopes that this book makes curious people more curious, and that readers are fascinated by the science and the people behind it.

Even though the topic is close to their Ph.D. research, Rob knows they still have much to learn, and writing this book made that ever more clear. With new knowledge comes new questions, and this book is a manifestation of Rob’s own curiosity and their want to share it. While Rob has experience in writing and publishing research articles, this book marks the beginning of their exploration into creative science writing and a new writing process for them. They learned a lot putting this book together, and Rob hopes to write more books in the future.

For more information, visit Rob's website at https://www.robertnulrich.com/. You can also connect with Robert Ulrich at hello@robertnulrich.com and @robertnulrich on all social media platforms (Instagram | Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn).
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
Use this form (https://forms.gle/VdzLxxzXJEU5YPbN6) to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:
At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 


Please use #TheHardParts and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!


Tag: #TheHardParts
Instragram - @RobertNUlrich / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @RobertNUlrich / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @RobertNUlrich / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rob
