story:
We reached 100% of the initial goal to fund the paperback & e-book in just one week, plus $8,500 for the Audiobook.  Let's get to $10K to support Girls Write Now. 

I will be donating 50% of any funds above the $8,500 mark to Girls Write Now, which mentors underserved young women and gender-expansive youth to find their voices through the power of writing and community.​ Girls Write Now has been distinguished three times by the White House as one of the nation’s top after school programs, Serving a culturally and educationally diverse community of girls and gender non-conforming youth (mentees) — 90% of color, 90% high need, 75% immigrant or first generation, and 25% LGBTQ+/gender non-conforming.

 

The Dream of Strapless 

In 2020, I burned it all down to write poetry. I left a 22-year-long career in high-tech. Burning it down means I can still feel the heat from the flames, and hear the crackle of the fire. It is all very much still alive. It’s uncomfortable peeling off the day-job identity among other layers. But I'm learning to sit with it and ask myself the hard questions.  I would love to share what that's like in my new book of poetry.  

Hi, my name is Neelam Patel and I believe in a world where vulnerability is regarded with the same respect as logic, so we all can show up as whole, and really connect instead of constantly missing each other in plain sight.  In my new book Strapless, I’ll explore the intersection between vulnerability, shame, and self acceptance. I found there’s no jolting force to empowerment; it’s a retreat. It was the acceptance of all the colors of my feelings that led me into myself. 

My collection of poetry is not about the before and after of a hero's journey. I remained curious about the messy middle. I’m learning that’s where the light is. It’s not at the end of the tunnel. It’s right here, in the messy, complicated middle.

I became tired of the simple Instagram-scrubbed stories that went from “I used to be so ashamed of X” to “Now that I’m a grown adult, I'm empowered..”  Those statements caused some level of shame,- or, in clearer terms: the feeling of "I should already be healed and in a different emotional place than I am". And that's pretty heavy, because it's shame about the shame, which traps us inside of ourselves.  So, the questions I ask in this book are: Isn't the middle-ground where we are all actually living in, empowered or otherwise?  And if so, then how do I make room for all of that?  

My hope for this collection is that others will feel less alone in their own honest feelings and take the steps to share them with a trusted friend — it is in the sharing that we release their power and we stop hiding our parts so we can create bonds that really hold us together in this wide world.  

You will enjoy this book if you want to go into the deep world of the Heroine’s Journey where she dives into herself, and where she lives in order to experience living, and takes sheer delight in it. 

This book is raw and vulnerable, like the feeling when you wear something strapless - you're living on the edge of being completely exposed. 

Chasing the Dream

I think chasing dreams is sexy;  even if the process, as exposed in this book, is definitely not.  So I'm cheering all those buried dreams!  The truth is, they're never really buried - they're always kind of there, right?  I’m living proof that it’s never too late to make your dreams come true! 

I hope you too, find those old dreams and polish them off; even if it takes 17 years!  Actually, the number of years doesn't matter because time can't be measured linearly,  Instead, by diving into the messy middle, we are expanding our emotional capacity to make more space to move into those dreams.  That is a more nuanced process than a chronological timeline.  

So why did I want to do all this? I want to live like I write in my poem: ”I want to be just a little bit dangerous,“ ”I want to paint my fingernails in my real desire,” and “walk like I just picked an apple off a tree I grew myself and ate it whole — red skin seed and all.”
 

Bringing the Dream into the Real World

My manuscript was Green-Lit to publish by New Degree Press earlier this year (!).

In order to own the rights to my own work, I am raising funds myself in multiple pre-order tiers. Funding will go towards:

  • My Reliable Editors: I have had weekly editor meetings and will continue as needed through Winter 2021 when I publish.
  • A Beautiful Cover Design: The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • A Well-Organized Layout Design: For very readable interiors of the book and ebook.
  • Rigorous Copyediting: to polish my book with detailed grammar and spelling checks.
  • Making a Hoopla for my Book’s Birthday!: Launch and promo for Winter 2021
Here are the exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish 
  • Invitation to join my Author Community: exclusive behind-the-scene peeks into the publishing process, and poetic inspirations as I drive to publish Winter 2021. 
  • I'll be honored to have your name appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).  Your support carries a deep value beyond the book in physical form.  You are helping me create a world that can hold more vulnerability, so having your support is a true honor.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early reflections while I am in edit-mode.  
  • You will have input into selecting my final book title and cover (current are placeholders!)

And much more!

What and Who you are backing

1. WHAT: The copyright to my poetry. I think we all learned from Taylor Swift's current nightmare of having to re-record all her work. By publishing through New Degree Press, and still raising the funding myself through this campaign, I get to retain all the rights to all my poems even after publishing under their name. 

2. WHO: I believe in a world that is safer for vulnerability so we can show up as whole and really connect, and I will do my part through poetry.  You are backing a poet who has a track record for on-time delivery.  Besides the countless consulting projects I've delivered on-time in high-paced tech companies, I've submitted winning grant proposals for my creative work, and self-produced four theater shows with sold-out audiences in Washington DC. 

My solo show resulted in a Washington Post review calling my work "Powerful Poetry,"  In fact, the reviewer went on to say "Patel is an optimistic rebel."


I am also an Entrepreneur, who provides one-of-a-kind poems for special occasions when you know a bouquet from the local florist just won't cut it, and you need something that changes the quality of a moment, and last forever.   You can check out that work here: https://www.tailoredpoetry.com/my-book

 

Campaign Goals


Tier 1: $5,500 Paperback, E-Book
Tier 2: $8,500 Audiobook
Tier 3: $10,000- $30,000 A portion of proceeds will be donated to GIrls Write Now

Girls Write Now mentors underserved young women and gender-expansive youth to find their voices through the power of writing and community.​ Girls Write Now has been distinguished three times by the White House as one of the nation’s top after school programs, Serving a culturally and educationally diverse community of girls and gender non-conforming youth (mentees) — 90% of color, 90% high need, 75% immigrant or first generation, and 25% LGBTQ+/gender non-conforming.

Risks & Challenges

You might guess the biggest risk for a writer, is never getting to the finish line.  Since I've had to meet poetry timelines in the past many times - for my shows' rehearsal and performance schedule, and for my customers in my business - that is not a risk for me. 

The biggest challenge is delivering the finished book to the backer (you), because I haven't mailed books out to people before,  I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. 

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. And, I'll be keeping you updated in the spirit of open and constant communications.  You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other options to support me, if funding my project is not available to you.

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: Don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #StraplessTheBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: #StraplessTheBook
Instragram - @dancewithneelam / @NewDegreepress
Facebook -@dancewithneelam / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @dancewithneelam / @NewDegreePress

Resume Summary: I graduated from Theatre Lab Honors Conservatory, and before that, Rutgers University with a BS in Computer Science.  Worked at Microsoft Corporation in Redmond WA for my first job, launching Expedia's UK site, and have since worked in that in-between area of customer success and product that lives between tech and marketing.  My poetry has been published in multiple places (31 Arlington Poets, Unrequited: An Anthology of Love Poems about Inanimate Objects, Gargoyle Press #52, Outside-In Magazine, Bourgeon Magazine). I served as a featured Poet at Barnes & Noble and performed at Nuyorican Poets Cafe, and performed in many theater productions in Washington DC, playing lead in several, as well as multiple solo shows I self-produced.  

 

Thank you


Thank you for being a part of this Great Big Dream Rescue, 

Thank you for helping me make the world a place where vulnerability is valued, so we can experience life from a kinder place, and with more peace. 

And thank you for spending time with me here on this page. 

Let's go!!!!
Neelam Patel
story_txt:
We reached 100% of the initial goal to fund the paperback & e-book in just one week, plus $8,500 for the Audiobook.  Let's get to $10K to support Girls Write Now. 
I will be donating 50% of any funds above the $8,500 mark to Girls Write Now, which mentors underserved young women and gender-expansive youth to find their voices through the power of writing and community.​ Girls Write Now has been distinguished three times by the White House as one of the nation’s top after school programs, Serving a culturally and educationally diverse community of girls and gender non-conforming youth (mentees) — 90% of color, 90% high need, 75% immigrant or first generation, and 25% LGBTQ+/gender non-conforming.
 
The Dream of Strapless 
In 2020, I burned it all down to write poetry. I left a 22-year-long career in high-tech. Burning it down means I can still feel the heat from the flames, and hear the crackle of the fire. It is all very much still alive. It’s uncomfortable peeling off the day-job identity among other layers. But I'm learning to sit with it and ask myself the hard questions.  I would love to share what that's like in my new book of poetry.  Hi, my name is Neelam Patel and I believe in a world where vulnerability is regarded with the same respect as logic, so we all can show up as whole, and really connect instead of constantly missing each other in plain sight.  In my new book Strapless, I’ll explore the intersection between vulnerability, shame, and self acceptance. I found there’s no jolting force to empowerment; it’s a retreat. It was the acceptance of all the colors of my feelings that led me into myself. 
My collection of poetry is not about the before and after of a hero's journey. I remained curious about the messy middle. I’m learning that’s where the light is. It’s not at the end of the tunnel. It’s right here, in the messy, complicated middle.I became tired of the simple Instagram-scrubbed stories that went from “I used to be so ashamed of X” to “Now that I’m a grown adult, I'm empowered..”  Those statements caused some level of shame,- or, in clearer terms: the feeling of "I should already be healed and in a different emotional place than I am". And that's pretty heavy, because it's shame about the shame, which traps us inside of ourselves.  So, the questions I ask in this book are: Isn't the middle-ground where we are all actually living in, empowered or otherwise?  And if so, then how do I make room for all of that?  
My hope for this collection is that others will feel less alone in their own honest feelings and take the steps to share them with a trusted friend — it is in the sharing that we release their power and we stop hiding our parts so we can create bonds that really hold us together in this wide world.  
You will enjoy this book if you want to go into the deep world of the Heroine’s Journey where she dives into herself, and where she lives in order to experience living, and takes sheer delight in it. 
This book is raw and vulnerable, like the feeling when you wear something strapless - you're living on the edge of being completely exposed. 
Chasing the Dream
I think chasing dreams is sexy;  even if the process, as exposed in this book, is definitely not.  So I'm cheering all those buried dreams!  The truth is, they're never really buried - they're always kind of there, right?  I’m living proof that it’s never too late to make your dreams come true! 
I hope you too, find those old dreams and polish them off; even if it takes 17 years!  Actually, the number of years doesn't matter because time can't be measured linearly,  Instead, by diving into the messy middle, we are expanding our emotional capacity to make more space to move into those dreams.  That is a more nuanced process than a chronological timeline.  So why did I want to do all this? I want to live like I write in my poem: ”I want to be just a little bit dangerous,“ ”I want to paint my fingernails in my real desire,” and “walk like I just picked an apple off a tree I grew myself and ate it whole — red skin seed and all.” 

Bringing the Dream into the Real World
My manuscript was Green-Lit to publish by New Degree Press earlier this year (!).
In order to own the rights to my own work, I am raising funds myself in multiple pre-order tiers. Funding will go towards:


My Reliable Editors: I have had weekly editor meetings and will continue as needed through Winter 2021 when I publish.

A Beautiful Cover Design: The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

A Well-Organized Layout Design: For very readable interiors of the book and ebook.

Rigorous Copyediting: to polish my book with detailed grammar and spelling checks.

Making a Hoopla for my Book’s Birthday!: Launch and promo for Winter 2021
Here are the exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish 
Invitation to join my Author Community: exclusive behind-the-scene peeks into the publishing process, and poetic inspirations as I drive to publish Winter 2021. 
I'll be honored to have your name appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).  Your support carries a deep value beyond the book in physical form.  You are helping me create a world that can hold more vulnerability, so having your support is a true honor.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early reflections while I am in edit-mode.  
You will have input into selecting my final book title and cover (current are placeholders!)

And much more!

What and Who you are backing
1. WHAT: The copyright to my poetry. I think we all learned from Taylor Swift's current nightmare of having to re-record all her work. By publishing through New Degree Press, and still raising the funding myself through this campaign, I get to retain all the rights to all my poems even after publishing under their name. 
2. WHO: I believe in a world that is safer for vulnerability so we can show up as whole and really connect, and I will do my part through poetry.  You are backing a poet who has a track record for on-time delivery.  Besides the countless consulting projects I've delivered on-time in high-paced tech companies, I've submitted winning grant proposals for my creative work, and self-produced four theater shows with sold-out audiences in Washington DC. 
My solo show resulted in a Washington Post review calling my work "Powerful Poetry,"  In fact, the reviewer went on to say "Patel is an optimistic rebel."

I am also an Entrepreneur, who provides one-of-a-kind poems for special occasions when you know a bouquet from the local florist just won't cut it, and you need something that changes the quality of a moment, and last forever.   You can check out that work here: https://www.tailoredpoetry.com/my-book
 
Campaign Goals
Tier 1: $5,500 Paperback, E-BookTier 2: $8,500 AudiobookTier 3: $10,000- $30,000 A portion of proceeds will be donated to GIrls Write Now
Girls Write Now mentors underserved young women and gender-expansive youth to find their voices through the power of writing and community.​ Girls Write Now has been distinguished three times by the White House as one of the nation’s top after school programs, Serving a culturally and educationally diverse community of girls and gender non-conforming youth (mentees) — 90% of color, 90% high need, 75% immigrant or first generation, and 25% LGBTQ+/gender non-conforming.

Risks & Challenges
You might guess the biggest risk for a writer, is never getting to the finish line.  Since I've had to meet poetry timelines in the past many times - for my shows' rehearsal and performance schedule, and for my customers in my business - that is not a risk for me. 
The biggest challenge is delivering the finished book to the backer (you), because I haven't mailed books out to people before,  I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. And, I'll be keeping you updated in the spirit of open and constant communications.  You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are other options to support me, if funding my project is not available to you.I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: Don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 
Please use #StraplessTheBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!Tag: #StraplessTheBookInstragram - @dancewithneelam / @NewDegreepressFacebook -@dancewithneelam / @NewDegreePress Twitter - @dancewithneelam / @NewDegreePressResume Summary: I graduated from Theatre Lab Honors Conservatory, and before that, Rutgers University with a BS in Computer Science.  Worked at Microsoft Corporation in Redmond WA for my first job, launching Expedia's UK site, and have since worked in that in-between area of customer success and product that lives between tech and marketing.  My poetry has been published in multiple places (31 Arlington Poets, Unrequited: An Anthology of Love Poems about Inanimate Objects, Gargoyle Press #52, Outside-In Magazine, Bourgeon Magazine). I served as a featured Poet at Barnes & Noble and performed at Nuyorican Poets Cafe, and performed in many theater productions in Washington DC, playing lead in several, as well as multiple solo shows I self-produced.   Thank youThank you for being a part of this Great Big Dream Rescue, Thank you for helping me make the world a place where vulnerability is valued, so we can experience life from a kinder place, and with more peace. And thank you for spending time with me here on this page. Let's go!!!!Neelam Patel

story:
Story of My Book

Contrary to Conception explores the real stories of people using contraception. Fearful myths and clouded understanding surround contraception from its historical beginnings to its biological processes. This book is aimed to unveil the inner workings of the various methods to help readers understand healthy motivations and scenarios associated with choosing and experiencing contraception.

---

My name is Madee Pasimio, DDS, and I am the author of Contrary to Conception. I wrote this book because no one talks about how they chose their contraceptive method, yet the typical family unit in America has two parents and two children...something is going on here! In school, we are required to take mandatory sexual education classes, yet these classes generally leave our students feeling awkward and ashamed. Throughout this journey, I have come across numerous accounts of people afraid of inopportune pregnancies who had to learn about contraception by either asking their friends what they use or consulting random internet articles. If we don’t have a family member, friend, or healthcare professional to rely on, how can we feel confident about the decision we are making? If we experience changes in our bodies, how do we know if our experience is normal?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will learn how the different contraceptive methods work by reading the stories of people using different contraceptive methods. You’ll learn how these drugs and devices look and feel for people like you.

With this book, I want to invite those with a uterus to take ownership of your health, get the most out of your contraceptive choice, and thrive in your particular lifestyle. For those without a uterus, I want to show you how important this agenda is in educational and political spheres, while letting you in on the secret life of uteruses.

Ultimately, I hope to instill in all of you the same passionate vision I have for a world full of healthy bodies and healthy relationships.

In this book, you'll hear stories such as...

  • How, before the pill, women were told by their doctors to sleep on the roof in order to prevent pregnancy.
  • How a worried teen without resources struggled to gain access to birth control.
  • How male partners can share in some of the burden.

You will love this book if you have questions about your current contraception experience, are unsure how to help another (a patient, child, or friend) in their contraception decision, or just have an interest in how the reproductive rights landscape emerged.

Contrary to Conception is a nonfiction book that speaks to those taking contraception and those questioning how to help others in their decision in a new way.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

About the Author

Madee Pasimio, DDS, is a practicing dentist in the San Francisco Bay Area. As with patient care in the dental field, decisions must be evidence-based and patients must be fully informed to help them achieve a lifetime of oral health. Too often, health is compartmentalized without considering overall health and patient expectations. Madee is passionate about serving patients through exceptional clinical treatments, determining the root cause behind problems, and forming healthy relationships through understanding and clear communication. She wrote this book to help her loved ones use contraception as a tool for experiencing a healthy, safe, and full life. She loves learning how to make unique alcoholic quaran-tinis, recreating her favorite dishes for friends and family, getting climbing beta, participating in book clubs, wondering if baby Yoda is going to do anything substantial, and volunteering with local community partners in San Francisco.



For more information, you can connect with Madee at
contra2ception@gmail.com, Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #contra2ception and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instragram - @madeep27 / @contrary2conception / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @madeep27 / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Madee

story:
Project Summary

Playing with My "Self" is not just a book, but a full research project which seeks to explore a more full and detailed study of cosplay as a cultural phenomenon. This research project intends to discuss cosplay both inside and outside of the fan convention setting through social scientific methods. The goal is to garner a better understanding of the playful performance of identity which comes along with the embodiment of stories.

 

The Research Itself

Cosplayers I know personally, and elsewhere, have noted that the process through which they choose the next character as a process of finding characters who have attributes they wish they had themselves. They see connections to fiction, and through the embodiment of narrative and character they can embody an identity that is both theirs and someone else’s.

The research will be primarily guided by an interest in the way the cosplayer’s identity plays a role in the act of cosplay itself. I’m interested in how the cosplay process unfolds, from the choices made in the character, to the way the emulation is sought. I’m interested in what it feels like to be in the attire, and how the cosplayer embodies popular culture during their act of dressing.

The research will follow social scientific methods, primarily focused on both questionnaires and detailed in-depth individual interviews. The results will be published in both the full book at the end, as well as journal articles published in academic journals.

I intend to explore how cosplay is an act of embodiment. In the act of dressing in costume as a character from fiction, the participant actively engages in a playful preformative act of identity transformation.

I have always been interested in storytelling, and the complicated ways stories are told and engaged with in the world. Stories are not just read. They are interacted with, played with, and embodied. Cosplay demonstrates just how complicated the engagement with stories can be, and how these stories can impact our understanding of self and the world around us.

 

The Impact

There are very few, if any, detailed explorations into the world of cosplay which take the community as serious and important to our contemporary social world.

I have had successful research projects giving importance and dignity to popular culture subgroups, including my PhD at Durham University. With the project, I intend to step away a bit from the academic world to give the cosplay community a greater role and contribution within the project itself.

My contributions will not be completely outside the academic world, however, and I hope the project can extend into more formal academic outputs to give greater attention to the world of cosplay to new arenas.

 

About Me

My name is Vivian Asimos, and I’m a researcher in the study of popular culture. I obtained my PhD from Durham University, where I studied online storytelling. My research has always explored elements in popular culture and explore them to demonstrate their greater importance to our current social world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding I’m asking for breaks down as such:

  • Self-publishing cost: £4500
  • Rest is Research Costs

The duration of the project is set for two years: one year for the time it takes to do the research, and the second for writing and publishing.

Research costs are to be used throughout the two years to cover the cost of the research itself, including books, public transport to libraries, costs associated with fieldwork, time taken, and other forms of supplies.

In return for your financial support, you do get something in return.

For £1, you get early access to research updates.
For £5, you get a sample chapter before release
For £10, you get your name in the acknowledgements
For £15, you get a complimentary copy of the final product, the book
For £20, you get a signed and personalised copy of the book

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may really want to help out, but don’t have the finances at the moment to do so. I completely understand, and there are other ways for you to help the project exist. Share this campaign with friends and family, talk about it with people. Showing the support love and support doesn’t cost anything, and I appreciate every piece of support shown.

story:
Where do you find beauty in larp?

How to create larp in the intersection of politics and emergent play?

How to design for player desires and make larp while avoiding burnout?

Engines of Desire is a collection of 31 articles and essays about larp by Juhana Pettersson. Many of the texts have been published before and there are nine new articles as well as a foreword by the game researcher Dr. Jaakko Stenros. The book’s graphic design is by Anne Serup Grove. Jukka Särkijärvi has also contributed.

The book is 460 pages, hardcover, illustrated and in full color.

The book’s essays span twenty years of Nordic larp. The perspective is that of a larp designer, a player, a member of the Nordic community of play. The book is an exploration into the ideas and dynamics of larp during a time of intense artistic development in the community.

Larp is an ephemeral artform by its very nature, making the historical record formed by articles and photos especially important. Pettersson's over twenty years of experience with Nordic larp spans an intensely creative time of change and growth in the community, mapped through the essays as they grapple with different subjects.

Thanks to the books published each year along with the Knutepunkt conference, the Nordic community of larp design has documented its own ideas for over two decades. Pettersson has written for most of these books and these essays form the backbone of this collection as well.

The writing in Engines of Desire is always grounded in concrete play or organizing experience. The essays grapple with issues arising from things that happen in play, the problems of real larpmaking, and the essential emergent nature of the medium. They're written from the position of participating in the community of Nordic larp and also touch upon issues such as the personal sacrifices of making larp in terms of mental health.

What People Are Saying

Engines of Desire reads like a summation of the first part of a remarkable career in participatory art. Every page vibrates with new ideas, lessons learned, and painful experience. It is absolutely packed with gems for the artist, enthusiast, and voyeur. Highly recommended!

- The roleplaying game designer Jason Morningstar (Fiasco, Night Witches)

The timely publication of Pettersson's Engines of Desire is a gift to help in the greater understanding of the many facets of roleplaying both within gaming communities and also as a way to think about our mediated experiences and our roles in the creation of narrative in our daily lives. From Q-anon to deep-fakes, we are becoming all too aware that fact is supplanted by our desire to make our imagination real by giving it form and mass untethered to neither facts nor reality. 

- Matthew Day Jackson, Artist

The Author

Juhana Pettersson (born in 1980) is a Finnish larp designer, novelist and game writer. Larps he has created or worked on include Luminescence, Halat hisar, End of the Line, Parliament of Shadows and Enlightenment in Blood.

He has worked with Goethe-Institut and Serlachius Museums and has received support from The Finnish Cultural Foundation, The Kone Foundation and The Arts Promotion Centre Finland. His work has been featured in Helsingin Sanomat, Der Spiegel, The Guardian, Libération and many other media.

He has written or edited twelve books and made larp in nine countries, including the U.S. and Russia. He has also worked as a journalist and a television producer.

Sections

The book's essays are divided into the following subsections: Art, Politics, Design, Aesthetics and Beyond Larp. Each essay looks at their subjects from different angles, often mirroring developments in Nordic larp discourse. Many were written in response to a specific discourse or the experience of organizing a larp with unique, new characteristics. The goal is always to make personal larp experience understandable and usable to a reader who doesn't share the same experiences.

Essays include:

ART: The Art of Experience, arguing that immediate experience is at the core essence of larp.

POLITICS: Larp for Change, about larp as a tool for political change.

DESIGN: Basics of Efficient Larp Production, laying out a model for getting the best larp with the minimum amount of organizer stress.

AESTHETICS: The Joy of Kidnapping, about why kidnapping is so much fun.

BEYOND LARP: Torturing Androids in Westworld, about the participation design of the titular theme park of the tv show.

Editions

There are four different editions of the book available. All are identical in actual content.

The digital edition. This is the PDF version of the book.

The standard print edition. This is the print edition of the book, hardcover.

The signature edition. This is the print edition of the book with a white cover onto which I have scrawled my signature.

The superfancy edition. This is a clothbound print edition of the book.

All print perks also include the digital edition.

Larp Design

The perk Engines of Larp Design allows you to get Engines of Desire in both print and PDF as well as a print copy of the 2019 Knutebook Larp Design. A massive tome of knowledge, Larp Design is the best and most comprehensive book published on the subject of how to design larp. You can read about it here.

Spreads

The Schedule

The book is very close to the finishing line. The layout has been completed and we're hunting for final mistakes. Because of this, we plan to go to print within a week or two of the end of the campaign.

Since the PDF version should be ready at that point, we'll send it to backers in advance of the shipping of the printed book.

Risks

The book is essentially finished and a contract with a local printer has been made. This is a safe deal. However, in these pandemic times there are always uncertainties, especially when it comes to international shipping. This can lead to longer shipping times across the Atlantic and to the U.K.

story:
‘For every Sailor afloat, every soldier at the Front’

 

Princess Mary’s Christmas Gift, 1914

I am an historian and author interested in the experience of the British army in the world wars. Trench warfare has always fascinated me, and much meaning can be drawn from the objects, letters and other artefacts of the war.

 

Most of previous books have told the story of the British soldier at war from this perspective, illustrated by the words of the participants, and the objects that they handled, used and collected. And this approach holds true for the offer made to you here.

 

And this book, truly and for the first time ever, tells the full story of Princess Mary’s Christmas Gift, 1914.

 

It is a rich story, a complex story, and one that touched the lives of at least 2.6 million people from across Britain and its then Empire.  And is a story that very much resonates today.

 

It is a story that deserves to be told; and you can help me tell it.

 

The Background

 

In autumn 1914, hundreds of thousands of men were engaged in a death struggle in Flanders in an attempt to break through and end a conflict that threatened to last for months, even years. Facing the might of the German armies that had steam-rollered through Belgium were the French and their allies from Britain and India – with millions more from across the Dominions of Canada, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa waiting to join the fight.

 

At sea, the Royal Navy, the strength of the British nation, ploughed through heavy seas to defend its shores and to engage in some of the fiercest naval battles of the war.

 

On land, this was the birth of trench warfare; the beginning of the Western Front and of No-Man’s Land; the first creation of the mud-scenes we have come to associate with the Great War. As winter approached, soldiers from India and Britain struggled in mud-filled trenches, while professional military nurses worked to save the lives of the wounded.

 

These were dark days. And acting as a beacon of light there was HRH Princess Mary, only daughter of King George V. She would grow an idea that would mean so much to those at war.

 

She would provide a Christmas Gift for ‘every sailor afloat, every soldier at the front’. And it was a gift that was given to all, regardless of ‘race, gender or creed’.

 

Set against the backdrop of the Christmas Truce of 1914, this is her story, the story of the Gift, and the story of the men and women who received it.

 

What you will  get

 

Type ‘Princess Mary’s Christmas Gift’ into Google and you will see any number of sites, blogs and posts that refer to the Gift. But truly none of these get to the root of the Gift, what it contained, and how it was received.

 

This is the first time in over a hundred years that the full story of Princess Mary’s Gift has been told, based on two-years of extensive archive research.

 

Lavishly illustrated in full colour over 352 pages and using original artefacts, archive records, letters and newspaper reports, For Every Sailor Afloat, Every Soldier at the Front’ gives you the facts and tells you the full story.

 

The book provides:

  • For the first time, the words and impressions of Princess Mary herself;
  • The full story of the Gift Fund as it unfolded in 1914, based on its archives and an extensive survey of newspaper archives from across Britain, Canada, Australia and New Zealand;
  • The background to the Gift and the context of other such gifts, from the Crimea War to the First World War;
  • The background to the design and manufacture of the gift box;
  • Full details of the contents of the Gift, and its many variants, including the Gifts made to Indian soldiers, based on archive research;
  • Full colour illustrations of ephemera and photographs of surviving examples that will act as a guide to anyone with an interest in the Gift and its meaning.

 

Risks & Challenges

The team behind the book have lots of experience in producing coffee table books to the highest standards and ensuring they are delivered in an efficient and timely manner so we do not forsee any challenges or risks in this area.

The biggest challenge will be in raising enough funds to make the project happen, so any help you can give us in spreading the word would be much appreciated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the campaign page with your family, friends and network.  

You can easily share the pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share the book with five friends, family members or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

story:
Story of My Book

Gratitude: A Work in Progress is about the stories and my learnings I obtained during my journey of writing 365 thank you notes in a year. Based on my experience, and many other gratitude practitioners' stories, I devised a five phase framework for developing and deploying gratitude in a personal, educational, and business context.

My name is, Austen Brower, and I am the author of Gratitude: A Work in Progress. I wrote this book because of all the conflict, fear, and anger that has surfaced in the past few years. Specifically with COVID-19 and the election cycle taking a toll on our collective wellbeing. I felt it paramount to put something positive in the world. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover consistently applying gratitude is simple, yet, results in a profound impact. 

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for gratitude. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you apply consistent gratitude in your personal, educational, or business environment by adopting the 5 phases of a gratitude ecosystem.

As you read this book, I hope that you will learn about the state of gratitude, my five phase gratitude ecosystem framework, and deploying gratitude in your life. You'll hear stories such as:

  • A conversation with Dr. Amit Kumar and how his research quantified the paradox of giving gratitude. People know it is really good to send thank you letters, but find it difficult to do.
  • How a bike theft became a supreme example of gratitude's power.
  • How Chris Murchison applies gratitude within his company to boost morale, productivity, and community.

You will love this book if you are interested in reframing your life through gratitude, applying gratitude in an organizational setting, or enjoy reading uplifting stories.

Gratitude: A Work In Progress is a nonfiction book that speaks to everyday people interested in fostering appreciation and who want to look at gratitude and its benefits in a new way.
 

The Book - Gratitude: A Work In Progress

THIS BOOK IS DIVIDED INTO 3 PARTS: 

Part 1 Contains the introduction + chapters 2-4. Readers will learn how gratitude can bridge the gap of political ideals, find a brief overview of the gratitude industry, and delve into the pertinent scientific discoveries. Conversations with receivers of my thank you notes, a Hallmark Master Writers, and PhDs can be found in this section.

Part 2 Contains chapters 5-8. These chapters delve into my five-phase framework for developing a gratitude ecosystem. Stories from my 365 thank you note project and conversations with other gratitude practitioners will give the reader a structure for deploying genuine gratitude simply and successfully in their lives.

Part 3 Contains chapters 9-11. The final section of the book employs the five framework concept to an education and business setting. Stories of organization and classroom changes are woven through this section to show the reader how to deploy gratitude in these contexts.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021

  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Austen Brower is an MBA student at Georgetown University. Having an eye for entrepreneurship, he is heavily involved in Washington D.C.'s entrepreneurial community as an InSITE Fellow, Co-President of the Entrepreneurship & Venture Capital Club, Coffee Podcaster, and founding member of 1 Million Cups DC.

He often quips that he, “wrote the book by accident.” Having started a 365 day thank you note journey in January 2020, what became a good way to reflect became a key way he coped with the vulgar election cycle and global pandemic. Being passionate about people and adding positivity into the world, he hopes the book will inspire others to share much needed gratitude with their communities.

Exercising, including running, biking, and working out throughout Washington D.C. are activities he loves to do. As a retired barista and coffee podcaster, exploring specialty coffee shops in any city followed by trying local beers are at the top of his list. Austen lives in downtown D.C. with his girlfriend, Christina, and new puppy, Sully.

For more information, you can connect with Austen Brower at arb328@georgetown.edu and at LinkedIn. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GratitudeAWorkInProgress and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
A. Brower

story:
Discovering the beauty of Czechia

How do Czechs experience beauty and how does it affect them?

With an intriguing survey that already has been used in seven countries all over the world, we now hope to ask a nationally representative sample of inhabitants of the Czech Republic:
How do you feel about beauty?

  • Project Beauty is a social enterprise I founded in 2008. It aims to raise awareness about this wonderful but also often complicated phenomenon called 'beauty'.
     
  • The Project Beauty survey questions function as a tool to inspire participants to reflect on what beauty means to them personally. 

  • If there is one phenomenon that will always intrigue us, it is beauty. It’s puzzling nature has inspired philosophers, musicians, poets and painters and still puzzles us today.
    Beauty is a pervasive element of today’s  society. The word is used by nature lovers, artists, priests, politicians, hairdressers and nail salons. The way beauty is perceived and used defines a culture. So how does the Czech Republic look at beauty?
     

  • Already curious about the questions that make up the Project Beauty survey: 
    have a look here at the English version of the questionnaire. 
     

  • We hope to be able to bring Project Beauty to the Czech Republic by conducting a survey based on a national representative sample.
     

  • Based on the outcomes a creative multimedia book and a set of posters will be composed, reflecting the views of Czechs on beauty.
     

  • Because beauty is a deeply cultural experience the complete project (survey & books) will be in the Czech language.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To be able to conduct a Czech version of Project Beauty we need to:

  • Acquire/buy a national CZ representative sample of around 1.000 completed questionnaires,
  • Conduct fieldwork,
  • Analyse the collected data,
  • Create a creative multimedia book that summarises the findings,
  • Present the outcomes to the general public/media in the Czech Republic by means of a modest pr campaign, 
     

The Impact

With our survey Project Beauty challenges you to discover what the word ‘Beauty’ means to you. 

The world is full of distractions and temptations. Sometimes it’s useful to sit down and take a moment to contemplate what is really important in our lives.

The Project Beauty survey has proven to be very helpful in doing this. The questions we ask with Project Beauty have been described as 'inspiring', 'intriguing' or even 'mindblowing'.

Over 10.000 people so far have answered these questions.

Discovering the beauty of Czechia
How do Czechs experience beauty and how does it affect them?With an intriguing survey that already has been used in seven countries all over the world, we now hope to ask a nationally representative sample of inhabitants of the Czech Republic:How do you feel about beauty?

Project Beauty is a social enterprise I founded in 2008. It aims to raise awareness about this wonderful but also often complicated phenomenon called 'beauty'. 
The Project Beauty survey questions function as a tool to inspire participants to reflect on what beauty means to them personally. 



If there is one phenomenon that will always intrigue us, it is beauty. story:
The Story of Andy Wong: Cultural Whisperer

How will a Chinese-American girl, a Palestinian-American boy, and a Midwestern girl get along as they navigate their different cultures? Andy Wong is inspired by her Aunt Carol, a world traveler, who frequently works with people from different cultures. Andy wants everyone to focus on our common humanity and to be open to our differences. She meets an unexpected challenge when Carina Maki moves in next door. Follow the antics of Andy, Bassem Taha, and Carina as they learn about different cultures and foods and realize it’s fun to explore our similarities.

My name is Carol Yee and I am the author of Andy Wong: Cultural Whisperer. I am writing this book because I want to explore some of the themes of my first book Welcome Back to Abuja Once Again: How I Became a Citizen of the World and engage a young readers audience. Welcome Back to Abuja Once Again is a travel memoir designed to encourage people to overcome their fears and become more comfortable exploring our world.

I want my new book to encourage young people to become curious about the world around us and to be tolerant of those who are different. With all of the racial issues and discussions that arose in 2020, I think it is important for young people to be exposed to these issues before their thinking hardens into an “us versus them” mentality. My hope is that Andy Wong: Cultural Whisperer provides a way for parents and their children to see how fun it is to learn about other cultures and to embrace our differences.

In this book Andy Wong and Bassem Taha, who have known each other almost all their lives, live in the San Francisco Bay Area. Carina Maki, from the Upper Peninsula of Michigan, moves in next door to Andy. They will attend the 4th grade together this fall. Andy wants to introduce Carina to her own culture, Bassem’s culture, and the multiculturalism of the Bay Area. Together they explore new cultures, but also encounter challenges brought about by Carina’s experiences and the bullies they face at school.

How should children react to those who are different? Should they make assumptions based on what’s on the surface, or should they focus on the kind of person someone is rather than what is on the outside?

Accompany the ABCs as they discover new things, try foods from different countries, and learn about themselves in the process.

You will love this book if you want to learn about other cultures, help children be open to those who are different, or develop cultural sensitivity skills.

Andy Wong: Cultural Whisperer speaks to children, their parents, and their teachers, who grapple with multiculturalism, and the sometimes racist reactions to it, and seek to embrace curiosity about our world in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Andy Wong: Cultural Whisperer inspires reflection and dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can we encourage children to be curious about other cultures?
  • What things can we do in our own communities to learn about other cultures?
  • How can we connect with other communities around the globe to build bridges and foster our common humanity?

 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Carol Yee is Chief Operating Officer of KANAVA International. She is a recognized operations specialist with over 25 years of international development experience with expertise in assessing and building organizational capacity, and developing pragmatic systems, policies, and procedures based on best practices adapted to local conditions, constrained resources, and needs of the client.

Carol shared her love for learning about new cultures, meeting new people, and trying new foods in her first book, Welcome Back to Abuja Once Again: How I Became a Citizen of the World, published in December 2020. Carol is a traveling introvert, but that doesn’t stop her from getting out into the world. She loves to prepare ahead of time, making it part of her journey.

Carol wants to share her passions for travel and food and encourage young readers to become curious about things near and far, looking beyond our differences. She focuses on the opportunities you can find in your own community to learn about the world by interacting with your neighbors, eating at ethnic restaurants, participating in cultural events, or visiting museums. Her first trip to Disneyland and love for the ride, It’s a Small World, planted the seed to become an avid global traveler.

For more information you can connect with Carol at cyee@caroljyee.com and on Facebook and LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 paperback, 2 paperbacks, or more
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

 The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and U.S. shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #CulturalWhisperer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Carol

story:
I am Deidre Mirand, an educator devoted to providing lessons in life and literature to today's youth. I have taught English Language Arts and writing for over 17 years. Though I have been a teacher and worked with children for over half of my life, I began questioning my purpose. I hit my rock bottom in November 2020. On a road to self discovery, I was diagnosed with MIT Family Translocation Renal Cell Carcinoma, a form of kidney cancer. This propelled me into finding my purpose in providing hope, help and healing to those who doubt their God given purpose on this earth. It has always been a dream of mine to write and publish a book. My love for writing encouraged me to share my story with the world. It is important for me to get the message out that crippling fear can be overcome and there is a divine path for us all. I have written my book, November to Now, and would like to get it published. I have signed a contract with a company, New Life Clarity Publishing, however the expense of publishing has caused a halt in the project. You contributing to my publishing will be life changing for me, and greatly appreciated.

The publishing package with NLCP is $3250.  At this time I have paid $1000 down. This package  includes the following:

ISBN Assignment

Cover Art and Design 

Formatting

Final Edit

Speaking opportunity on the Heart Talks Stage 

Featured on our website with a link to purchase the book 

Weekly accountability sessions

Distribution to Amazon, Apple Book, Barnes & Noble, Nook and Kindle, KOBO (globally) 

Guaranteed Best Selling Status 

Strategic consulting to complete your project as well as many other resources to support the journey

I will continue to work towards paying it down, however your contribution can make this dream come true a lot sooner. I would like to raise $2000 more to complete this project.

 

  • If you cant contribute, please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Excerpt:

I used to think that cancer was my biggest fear, until I realized my fear turned into cancer.

I was in so much pain. My chest was hurting, heart broken, emotionally exhausted and alone. I was frustrated and out of control. The previous months had been the hardest of my life. It seemed like everything had come crashing down. Every relationship I had was being tested, my work was unfulfilling and I was unable to control my empathy. Anxiety, insomnia, depression: you name it, I claimed it. I had hit rock bottom, but hadn't I been here before? Several times before, but this time felt different. I was ready for change. I had always questioned my why and I prayed earnestly for my purpose to be revealed. His answer came in an unexpected manner.

As I walked through the dark valleys in the shadows of pain, heartbreak, and hurt, God walked with me. I began this journey, unaware of where it would lead me. I soon realized I had to take care of myself; physically, mentally and spiritually. Slowly, with guidance from my life coach, meditation and practicing self love, I began to heal. I began discovering, creating, loving myself, nourishing relationships. I was writing again, reflecting, rejuvenating, releasing, resting. I learned  to let go. Letting go can be hard. When you deal with anxiety you can let a myriad of questions torment you. When we focus on what is right in front of us, the reality of the present moment, you tend to remain calm. I would soon see the benefit of this mindset shift.

I was healing emotionally, and spiritually, however I began to experience some unfamiliar physical pain, which led me to visit a chiropractor. He issued a body x-ray and determined I had two pinched nerves. Subsequently, the chiropractor urged me to take my x-ray to my primary doctor because he saw something unfavorable. How divine was it that this chiropractor spent 30 years as a radiologist and knew what he saw in my x-rays? I went to the doctor, shared my x-rays which revealed concern of a cancerous mass in my abdomen and pelvis. A CT Scan was needed to rule that out. When the results came back it revealed the mass was consistent with kidney cancer. I remember when I got the news, things went blank. Between hyperventilating, screaming, dragging myself on the floor and vomiting, you would have thought I was a cartoon character! The one thing that I have always feared was cancer. This is when I gained a strength that I never knew I had. I put faith over fear and was transformed that day! I had to get a biopsy and eventually remove the mass on my kidney. There was a small pelvic lesion that could possibly be where the cancer had spread. A recommendation for an MRI and a visit with the oncologist were my next steps.

I now know God had been preparing me for this journey all along. As each day passed I continued working on managing my emotions and communicating my needs. Surprisingly, what I had not experienced yet was fear. No matter what the doctors told me I knew our sickness does not end in death because healing is in heaven. No spirit of fear shall prosper.

The morning of my bone biopsy, I fretted about the pain. “My peace I leave with you, peace I give unto you Deidre.” All I had to do was just listen to God's word and obey. I began to cry and pant lying in the frigid hospital bed, dreading the procedure. The nurse questioned my tears. “There’s a mass on my kidney and I need this bone biopsy to be sure nothing is spreading.” I sobbed. He assumed the diagnosis had me upset. I quickly cut him off , “I'm not upset about my diagnosis. It’s the big needle you're about to put in my bone!” I was afraid of the pain that I hadn't even experienced and God said,“My peace I give unto you.” I relished on that thought for a moment. Before I knew it, I was settled, but not soon enough. The nurse looked at me, “I'm going to give you a little something for anxiety.” A chill pill. “I leave you with my peace.” After receiving the calming Ativan and a brief discussion about the position I was to lay in… Nothing. I remember nothing. No pain! “My peace.” I woke up in recovery! Did they even do the biopsy? “The peace I give is a gift the world cannot give.” When He said it, I listened! The entire time, I was at peace. When the biopsy results came in, I was ready! As soon as I got the notification I told Adonica and she began to cry. I said, “What are you crying for? Let's pray.” Immediately I began, “Thank You Lord. No matter what the results are, I have peace, grace and mercy on my side.” Turns out there were rare atypical cells on my bone that's not cancerous and needs no further testing. Next came the partial nephrectomy, or kidney removal in layman's terms.

story:
Story of My Book

Misfit is a book about heart-touching stories and events, controversial traditions, social values, and unpopular opinions and choices. The book explores interesting topics such as love, money, traditions, family, immigrant life, etc., and reflects on things that are not going in the right direction. It touches on self-exploration (re-visiting some low points and disheartening opinions, asking if it is ‘true’, loving yourself) and feminism (difference of perspective based on gender, the role of women, how it has evolved, where it seems to be going), but is not just about that; the segmentation of chapters is far deeper in meaning and enriched with reasons. 

My name is Shruti Mishra and I am the author of Misfit. I wrote this book in search of answers to my questions that were shut down with a controversial or ‘it has always been like that’ tag. I, myself, have either been labeled or made to feel different in many aspects of my life. Living in that question-filled world gave me the nudge to start the journey, and completing it gave me the answers I sought, a sense of purpose in speaking up about the issues, and a fulfilling journey.  

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own voice, seek interest in learning about various aspects of human life, and find deep love and understanding for fellow misfits. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for love, inclusion, compassion, progression, and humanity. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you feel supported (if you feel like a misfit) or understand the world of misfits (if you are an ally).

In this book, you'll read stories, check the facts, and self-reflect on answers to questions such as: 
  • Not everything is always a choice. Is it? 
  • Why do we find it hard to accept most people as they are? 
  • How much should one inherit from the past? 
  • How much do we speculate about others? Is it true or right? 
  • What are the true reasons behind feeling like a misfit? 
  • Have I ever done this to someone else? 

You will love this book if you love to connect with others on a deeper level, feel passionate about social progressions in the right direction, and have ever felt like a misfit yourself.

Misfit is a nonfiction book that speaks to youngsters, women, immigrants, and social activists who want to look at society, traditions, and the world in a new way.
 

The Book - Misfit 

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. This part of the book will allow you to dig deeper into yourself and understand how various aspects of your life are shaped by others. You will get to know me, the author, through some of my stories and perhaps reflect with me on similar or shared instances of life. This section will help show the difference between just a person and a human with emotions, desires, dreams, ambitions, and knowledge. 

Part 2 contains chapters 6-9. This section of the book is dedicated to learning about the intersection of individuals and society. You will recognize and acknowledge how the idea of others shape us and our view of everything, how our surrounding instills irrational and binding fears in our minds, and how we mostly get wrapped up in other’s choices.

Part 3 contains chapters 10-13 + conclusion. These last few chapters will give a holistic view of some of the most controversial and talked out topics/themes of modern times and how they relate to making individuals or demographics feel out of place. If you have questions such as, “have things always been the same?”, “how indulging is the technological world?”, “is home really where the heart is?”, and “how crazy is the monetary impact on us?”, then reading this section might feel like nirvana for your brain. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Shruti Mishra is a recent college grad who is pursuing her passion for consumer insights and behavioral science at MOD. Shruti, an international student from Nepal, is gregarious, innately curious, determined, and futurist thinking. 

She started her journey of writing her first book, Misfit, in a search to find answers to questions that were shut down with a controversial tag and ended up creating a book that serves more purpose than originally intended. Misfit can be a shelter, a shoulder, a guidebook, a self-help book, a conversation starter, and more than anything, an eye-opening read. Shruti is curious about changing human perceptions and increasing social compassion among people by adding her perspective to these topics through her book. 

Being as outspoken and extroverted as she is, Shruti loves making new friends and spending quality time with friends and family. You’ll not find anyone who is as fond of dogs (especially puppies) and babies as she is. Aside from these, she enjoys traveling, dancing, watching movies/TV shows (anything mind-boggling is great!), experimenting with food, and lastly, researching the heck out of anything interesting. 

If you want to connect, chat about her, and learn more about her, you can connect with Shruti at mishrashruti032@gmail.com and on Instagram (@mishra.shru & @misfits_power), Facebook, and LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

If you are outside the US, please send me a private message/email and I will guide you through the international preorders process. Also, thank you for your support! 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please follow my book page (@misfits_power), use #misfits_power, and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Shruti Mishra

Story of My Book
Misfit is a book about heart-touching stories and events, controversial traditions, social values, and unpopular opinions and choices. The book explores interesting topics such as love, money, traditions, family, immigrant life, etc., and reflects on things that are not going in the right direction. It touches on self-exploration (re-visiting some low points and disheartening opinions, asking if it is ‘true’, loving yourself) and feminism (difference of perspective based on gender, the role of women, how it has evolved, where it seems to be going), but is not just about that; the segmentation of chapters is far deeper in meaning and enriched with reasons. My name is Shruti Mishra and I am the author of Misfit. I wrote this book in search of answers to my questions that were shut down with a controversial or ‘it has always been like that’ tag. I, myself, have either been labeled or made to feel different in many aspects of my life.
