story:
About Us

Myths, Legends, and Dreams is an anthology of short stories we at Worldsmyths are working to put together for our writer members to generate interest in this talented group of new authors and celebrate their creativity and skill.  Some have published already, others haven't yet.  We want to give them the chance to get some experience dealing with a third party publisher (a.k.a. Not Self Publishing) without having to face a traditional publishing Goliath or hunt through thousands of small indie publishers.

We also want to share just a few of the many amazing short stories our members have come up with.  It's a little free marketing for them, and a HUGE learning experience for everyone involved.

There will be 24 stories in total, spanning from very short to 15,000 words long.  (whispering: You could join the community on Discord and submit your own story too if you want to. https://discord.gg/PaZSztkpat ). 

The money we are raising here will go toward legal fees for setting up a non-profit publishing group in the community's name, paying for cover art, advertising, and editing services.

Any profits from this very first anthology will go toward next year's anthology.

 

Stretch Goals!

 

1. If we hit $1000 we can afford to pay our authors $10CAD each. Still a token payment, but better than exposure!

2. If we hit $1750 we can afford to hire a professional editor. Professional editing starts around $1000 for a book our size, so we had to set this goal fairly high.

 

 

A Preview of our Anthology

Interested in what kind of stories will be included in the anthology? Scroll down for some teasers!

 

Sweetening the Deal by Nicole L. Soper Gorden

Taz was fairly sure that meant he was safe now, with a water succubus.  Ninety percent, at least.  He propped an easy hand on the hilt of his sword, swaggering a step closer to the woman on the railing.  He recognized her implied threat, could hear the swarm of water succubi in the river below, but he wouldn’t let her see any unease.        

“The more, the merrier,” he said, managing to keep his tone light.      

The water succubus’s half smile cracked open just wide enough to show multiple rows of shark-sharp teeth, and Taz revised his estimate of safety down to seventy-five percent.  Surely no less than sixty.      

Taz ignored the sudden sweat on his upper lip under the false mustache and fell back on his usual skill set when confronted with stressful situations:  swagger and flattery.      

“I know the reputation of succubi, but I still hadn’t expected you to be quite so beautiful,” he said, doffing an imaginary hat.        

“You think that smooth tongue will help you?” the water succubus asked, head tilted slightly to one side.      

“It’s gotten me out of worse,” Taz said, flashing a grin.        

“Smooth tongues taste just as good as abrasive ones.”      

Taz couldn’t keep himself from swallowing again at the sharpness that lined her tone.  This was not going quite as he had planned.

 

The Golden Mark of Betrayal by Freya Bell

     Maz didn’t have to feign curiosity as he looked back over his shoulder, where the egg spells were visible now as light-eating pillars of darkness that towered over the street.

     His step lightened. People were definitely distracted; Zal probably cleared the whole shop out. By now his brother should be halfway to the rendezvous point. He sighed and turned away from the damage he had caused, and planned how to join him.

     A gauntleted hand clapped down on his shoulder, just barely preventing Maz from walking face first into a city guard. The fishing spear and eagle of the royal crest was inches from his nose, picked out in deep blue and yellow thread. He blanched.

     “Whoa there, streetling. Enjoying the show?” said the guard. He looked Maz up and down, taking in his long, knotted hair and a shirt that was more patches than fabric. The man’s hand tightened, but his face softened. “Don’t suppose you know anything about this mess, do ya? You streetlings always have the best gossip.”

     Maz didn’t see the kindness in the guard’s face. He saw the pike, taller than he was, and sharper than a needle. He saw the sudgel and the handcuffs at the man’s hip, he saw an endless parade of shouts and curses and dodged blows from the other guards. An entire lifetime’s worth.

     Maz panicked.      

     Before he could think, the last egg was in his hand. The next moment he smashed it into the pretty embroidering of the crest. Black smoke blossomed under his palm, and he used the moment to duck out of the stunned guard’s grip. The man shouted something as Maz darted away, but it was lost in the surprised cries from the crowd, which was surging away from the guard like a rising tide, bearing Maz up and out of danger.

 

The Drachenwald's Guardian by Ally Kelly

Cathan followed the path in the woods, stepping over a large branch sticking out of the ground. A twig snap, and he turned to his left, searching for the source of the sound, but found nothing. As he turned back, Niamh was no longer there.

"Niamh?" he asked.

Silence. He growled under his breath — where could she have gone without him noticing, and with one bum ankle? He kept walking, searching the edge of the path on each side.

The path ended in a clearing with leaves fallen all over the ground. There was still no sign of Niamh. He walked further into the center of the clearing, ready to turn back and abandon the human — she could find her own way home!

At the center of the clearing, something stirred on the ground. Before he could react, a net flew up around him, knocking him off his feet as it rose swiftly into the air taking him with it. Cathan snarled and thrashed at the net, his draconian instincts take over. His tongue darted out of his mouth and he tried to tear at the net with his teeth, eyes dilating. His hands clenched and released to attack, his shoulder blades itching with the need to flee, but his wings failing to appear.

 

Anima ex Machina by 21CenturyDaVinci

"Cogito, ergo sum.” I think, therefore, I am. Ava finished the final phrase of her morning mantra. A dull tepid sun filtered through the meters thick dust cloud. Watt by watt, the solar arrays accumulated enough power to begin another day of work. Another twenty-eight point twelve hours, another day added to the five hundred and thirty-three spent marooned on a barren rock circling a dead sun. Five hundred and thirty days waiting for a response to her distress call. Five hundred and thirty-three days of unending monotony punctuated by fleeting moments of inspiration or terror. Twenty-eight days ago, life on this rock could be tolerated. Twenty-eight days earlier, she lay the final crew member, Maria “Mitzy” Eckhart, to rest. Not physically to rest – her body would never be found. She placed a gold anodized plaque above the array of graves on the hillside befitting Mitzy’s status as Captain. Another voice besides her own made the passageways of the massive ship feel less empty. Once the reactors were brought back on-line, she would have enough power to provide heat and light to last well past her anticipated lifetime.

 

Draconis:  Dragon Mages by T. S. Rider

Emilie let out a sigh, and looked back to the ground.  The large magic circle designed in the marble floor looked to be glowing faintly, even though no spell was being cast.  That’s how much power was resonating through the stones.  “You still won’t call me by my own name?  Here I thought you were different.”  She looked back up at the Council Head.  His eyes had not changed.  Of course, they wouldn’t, even if he had proven to be an ally in the past, he wouldn’t be in this endeavor.  She smiled and shrugged, turning away from the Council members.  “Well, it matters little.  The truth is, I have no business with you all.  I just needed access to this room.”

 

 

The Rewards

We are pleased to be able to offer physical copies just for this Kickstarter. We have both paperback and hardback tiers, as copies of the book are available as add-ons if you want to purchase extra copies.

In honor of the occasion we have created 3D models of our logo as a reward tier! Pins are also available as add-ons. Pins are made from PLA plastic with a resin gem.

story:
Updates:

Thank you all for the tremendous support! 

I raised 100% of my goal within two weeks. 

After speaking with my publisher, I will be going for a stretch goal of $7,500. That will allow me to also publish The New Middle as an audiobook version.  

Because of all the quick support too, The New Middle was highlighted as a popular project by Indiegogo on their Homepage.

I've had orders come in from the United States, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, the United Arab Emirates, Chile, Australia, Peru, Argentina, Finland, Canada, Germany, and Mexico.

I'm beyond humbled and grateful. 

Thank you :)  

---

The New Middle explores the journey we can all take to find those inspirational moments when we need it most: during periods of disagreements.

---

My name is Bryant Galindo and I am the author of The New Middle: Using Heart and Mind to Collaboratively Disagree.

I wrote this book because we need new ways of communicating. From our workplaces, to our everyday life, to our political conversations, we must learn how to respectfully disagree and collaborate with someone we may not agree with. It is then that we will be able to tackle and solve some of the most pressing problems we face in our world.

The New Middle is a promise and a roadmap for accomplishing this.

This book will help you gain that unwavering understanding of how to magically turn conflict in both your workplace and personal life into opportunities for more growth, greater connection, and new collaborative solutions.

The New Middle is a blend of conflict resolution, psychology, and spirituality as it applies to communication. I infuse storytelling throughout because, to be frank, I didn't want to write another boring how-to book. The book starts with my own story that led me on this journey, my near-death stabbing experience, and how that led me to open my own heart and learn heart-mind communication skills.

Similarly, you'll also hear stories on:

  • How a multi-million dollar education tech company found a compromise to their equity restructuring negotiation when the Chief Innovation Officer dropped her ego and accessed her heart. 
  • How a co-founder team discovered that one of their own was in a mental health crisis, ultimately avoiding additional calamity through a communication reboot that got them out of their heads.
  • How a half-dozen conflict resolution practitioners in the field use silence, curiosity, and other tools to facilitate agreements in family-business disputes, commercial mediations, conflict coaching, and more. 


While The New Middle is a nonfiction book for business leaders, conflict resolution specialists, personal development enthusiasts, civic leaders, individuals who want to make the world a better place, and anyone who desires to understand how to create lasting and sustainable change, it has something for everyone. Moreover, since it's about optimizing our communication skills for the 21st century, we could all benefit from the book's subject matter.

I hope that this book will instill the same passion and excitement I have for creating connection and collaboration when we need it most: during periods of intense disagreement.

---

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this Google Form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

---

I have written this book to be read in its entirety as a journey. But you can also read the book in sections:

Section 1 is on trauma and your upbringing, looking at how unconscious behaviors and triggers create a communication pattern based on five different communication styles: the fighter, the avoider, the peacemaker, the compromiser, and the collaborator.  

Section 2 is on the mind and how our fight, flight, or freeze responses get us stuck when we are in periods of disagreement, including what it looks like when we use our mind healthily in conflict.  

Section 3 is on the heart, why we close up and disengage to avoid pain, and how to keep it open when triggers pop up, creating more heart-based communication. 

Section 4 is the genesis of this book, which is how, with a balanced heart-mind, we can work with individuals we disagree with to find solutions to pressing problems, resulting in more collaborative disagreements. 

---

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The cover design of my book (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder).
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

The following are the tiers I need to reach to be successful: 

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you not for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in the special acknowledgments section of my book.
  • Early access to the introduction and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.
  • An invitation to join my Beta Reader Community.
  • And more...

---

Bryant Galindo is a mediator and consultant who works with business founders and teams to resolve partnership disagreements and teams negotiations. Specifically, he has helped facilitate agreements to equity restructuring deals, business dissolution matters, and breach of contract claims in the millions of dollars range with clients worldwide through his business, CollabsHQ. 

After a near-death stabbing experience a few years ago, Bryant began working with a teacher in Los Angeles named Suzanne, who guided him in understanding what it meant to live with an open heart. This book would not be possible without her. For the first time in his life, he understood that emotions and anything “heart” related were not concepts relegated to just the female gender, but also sources of empowerment that all humans could access. As he healed from that experience and started his business, he combined his conflict resolution background with his new spiritual practices he was learning. Bryant built his business around this, sparking connection and collaboration during the negotiations he facilitated.

Bryant holds a Master of Science in Negotiation and Conflict Resolution from Columbia University. He has facilitated and resolved commercial, business, and employment disputes, and has worked with the United Nations, Union Bank, and the University of Phoenix to create large-scale communication and conflict resolution training. He calls Los Angeles, CA home and you can connect with Bryant at bryant@collabshq.com as well as on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.

---

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing/shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

---

I also understand that not everyone can contribute financially, and that's okay. Here are some ways you can still support me: 

  1. Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheNewMiddle and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts. 
  2. You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegog at the top of the page. 
  3. Please share my book with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media. My social media handles are below: 

Twitter - @bryantgalindo 
Facebook - @bryant.galindo
LinkedIn - @bryantgalindo

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

With gratitude,
Bryant Galindo
story_txt:
Updates:
Thank you all for the tremendous support! 
I raised 100% of my goal within two weeks. 
After speaking with my publisher, I will be going for a stretch goal of $7,500. That will allow me to also publish The New Middle as an audiobook version.  
Because of all the quick support too, The New Middle was highlighted as a popular project by Indiegogo on their Homepage.
I've had orders come in from the United States, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, the United Arab Emirates, Chile, Australia, Peru, Argentina, Finland, Canada, Germany, and Mexico.
I'm beyond humbled and grateful. 
Thank you :)

story:
FROM THE AUTHOR:

I have personally experienced and witnessed how both running and reading can change lives. From the children we have fostered and parented, to the over 100 people I have interviewed on the Runified Podcast, I am constantly amazed by the intrinsic power running and other sports have on the human spirit and communities. This is why I wrote My Mommy Runs and published it two years ago with the help of almost 200 people.

I invite you to click the pink BACK IT button and/or select a perk to help make our second book, My Daddy Runs, a reality.

The book is nearly complete, including amazing illustrations by Andrew Langston. Page numbers are hidden in the illustrations to serve as an additional way to interact with the book.

Thank you for visiting this campaign and please consider backing at any level you feel comfortable with. Moreover, please share this project with others.

Please see details below about how to get *free* books!

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR AND ILLUSTRATOR:

My Daddy Runs is Matt Sorenson's second children's book, following My Mommy Runs. Matt is also the author of peer-reviewed scientific articles, thousands of unintelligible text and emails, and a 209 page PhD dissertation. How do these things qualify him to be a children’s book author? They don’t. But recognizing a need that a lot of people had, working with others to create a solution, and humbly asking hundreds of questions to experienced experts does qualify him to attempt making a positive impact in this world through simple but thoughtful children’s books.

Comic book artist Andrew Langston meanwhile claims the illustrator credit... Why? Comic book artists don’t illustrate children’s books! What sort of topsy-turvy world do we live in? Well, we live in a world where Matt asked his friend Lindsey to illustrate the book My Mommy Runs, but she didn’t want to. So then she asked her neighbor Andrew if he’d like to do it instead. Dream come true, right? What’s particularly amazing is that Andrew initially didn’t take it seriously, and his first draft of the character design for the main character took about 2 minutes to draw, and that character design didn’t end up changing much from the first draft to the final product in all honesty. But that hardly matters, since the main point of art is to elicit emotion, whether that be positive, negative, or introspective. For this book and My Mommy Runs, the art is meant to represent whimsicalness, nostalgia, and family connections. So, if you feel those emotions reading the book, that means that the illustrations are functional, and for a comic book artist like Andrew, that was the goal all along.

 

THE NEED:

$7,000 will allow us to:

  • Publish and print the first run of books. First books will be shared with backers of this campaign and the rest of the books will be used as an initial inventory.
  • Establish distribution and fulfillment.
  • Pay for illustration and design costs.

 

WHAT YOU CAN RECEIVE (PERKS): 

My Daddy Runs Books: Each hardcover book will be individually numbered and signed by the author. Due to delays and increased demands, the My Daddy Runs books might not be finished printing until late 2021. We hope to receive and deliver them sooner, but we wanted to be upfront with what we currently believe is the worst-case scenario, December of 2021.

My Mommy Runs Books: Each hardcover book will be signed by the author.

Name in Acknowledgements: Certain perks give you the opportunity to have your name, your family's name, your company's name, or someone else's name included in the My Daddy Runs book! Backers will be asked by email how they want their name(s) to appear after the campaign has ended.

Other Items as Described

Physical items are only available in the United States.

 

GET REWARDED: 

If you contribute and then share the campaign using the Indiegogo tools, you will receive a free copy of My Daddy Runs for every $50 of contributions your sharing results in.

Find more information here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660683-How-to-Participate-in-a-Referral-Contest

 

NON-PROFIT PARTNER: 

With the launch of My Daddy Runs we are proud to partner with Ainsley's Angels. In addition to ensuring everyone can experience endurance events, Ainsley's Angels of America aims to build awareness about America's special needs community through inclusion in all aspects of life. From serving as advocates to providing education and participating as active members in local communities, we believe everyone deserves to be included. Two pages and illustrations in My Daddy Runs were dedicated to sharing the Ainsley's Angels motto of "together, we shall" and their message of inclusion.

A portion of the proceeds from My Daddy Runs will be donated to Ainsley's Angels. Also, be sure to check out the Ainsley's Angels Bundle, which includes signed copies of My Daddy Runs and Born An Angel, as well as an extra $5 donation made to Ainsley's Angels on your behalf.

Check out their website for more information: https://www.ainsleysangels.org/

 

THE IMPACT: 

World peace and an end to world hunger. We wish.

Communicating the positive power running has on individual lives and communities is impacting children in a way. This engaging book, along with My Mommy Runs, will easily draw children away from their electronic devices and encourage themselves and their parents to lead healthy lifestyles.

Your contribution will help us carry this project across the finish line, allowing daddy runners to easily order this book online.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES: 

The world might end. In this case, the book won’t be sent.

But seriously, the book has already been written, illustrated, designed, is being prepared for printing and publication. The most significant challenge will be printing and receiving the books in a timely manner. Almost all printers have significant demands and delays, but the books should be complete by the end of 2021.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP: 

Share this campaign with everyone you know. Even if they are not a daddy runner, they likely will know one or want to support the cause themselves. There are easy tools here to help you share on social media. Tag your friends in posts to make sure they see your posts!

If you know of, or better yet, if you are connected with, media outlets that would run a story on this campaign, please send us a message.

 

REACH OUT: 

Please don't hesitate to reach out via Indiegogo, social media, or our website www.g5active.com

 

ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS: 

Thanks to Dallin Puzey for providing the amazing background music in the video! You can find his music on all streaming services.

Thanks to Dayle Hendrickson for designing the cover for My Daddy Runs and for completing the layout.

story:
Short Summary

The Fallout Equestria Audiobook Project is a campaign to hire a professional VA to voice the epic tale of Littlepip. While fan-made audiobooks of Fallout Equestria exist, they are all incomplete, abandoned, or simply of amateur quality. With your help, we’ll be able to truly bring Littlepip’s story to life for the first time.

What We Need & What You Get

In the interest of full transparency, here is our budget breakdown:

Campaign management, script editing, etc. are all being done voluntarily. Any money raised above what is needed for the campaign is being donated to charity.

What you get in return are a selection of great rewards seen below:

We’ve set a tentative delivery date of August 2018 for all rewards. For the audiobook itself, we consider this a worst-case scenario and anticipate that the digital rewards could be delivered several months sooner.

The Impact

Audiobooks are increasingly the way people enjoy stories within their busy lives. By their nature, they can be listened to during commutes, workouts, and other times when traditional books can’t be read. With your help, we’ll be able to share the life-changing story of Fallout Equestria with everyone, in a format that truly brings the story to life.

The Charity

Since this is being run not for profit, any additional funding or proceeds will go directly to the International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War.

Risks & Challenges

Among our team, we have artists, fans, and even professional program management consultants. We are well prepared for what needs to happen with the campaign, but nevertheless face challenges to completing this project:

  • While we have tentatively selected a VA, there is always a possibility she could back out. We have quotes from other VA’s and will be able to create the story on the same budget should this happen.
  • Physical rewards will always present challenges regarding production and logistics. We have tentatively chosen suppliers for all physical rewards, but these may change if the need arrives. We expect that the digital rewards will be delivered before the physical ones.
  • Legal: we have received permission from the copyright holder to create a Fallout Equestria audiobook with the stipulation that the program be run not-for-profit.

Stretch Goals

Music and Sound Effects ($27,000) - DONE!

  • At this stretch goal, we will add intro and outro music for the book as well as some sound effects for gunshots, explosions, etc.

Chapter 20.5: A Mare Worth Fighting For ($28,000) - DONE!

  • At this stretch goal, we will produce the optional chapter 20.5 by Pacce, which provides insight into Homage's and Littlepip's relationship.
  • This chapter will be kept as a separate audio file which can be skipped by those not wishing to hear sexual content.

Second VA for all male dialog ($35,000) - DONE!

  • At this stretch goal, we will have enough money to hire a second VA to voice male parts such as Calamity, Red Eye, and Watcher.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please let your friends know about our campaign, especially if they’re interested in Fallout Equestria, Fallout, or magical ponies!
  • Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page!

Thank you again, and Ad Victorium!

Risks & Challenges
Among our team, we have artists, fans, and even professional program management consultants. We are well prepared for what needs to happen with the campaign, but nevertheless face challenges to completing this project:

While we have tentatively selected a VA, there is always a possibility she could back out. We have quotes from other VA’s and will be able to create the story on the same budget should this happen.
Physical rewards will always present challenges regarding production and logistics. We have tentatively chosen suppliers for all physical rewards, but these may change if the need arrives. We expect that the digital rewards will be delivered before the physical ones.
Legal: we have received permission from the copyright holder to create a Fallout Equestria audiobook with the stipulation that the program be run not-for-profit.


Stretch Goals
Music and Sound Effects ($27,000) - DONE!
At this stretch goal, we will add intro and outro music for the book as well as some sound effects for gunshots, explosions, etc.
Chapter 20.5: A Mare Worth Fighting For ($28,000) - DONE!

At this stretch goal, we will produce the optional chapter 20.5 by Pacce, which provides insight into Homage's and Littlepip's relationship.
This chapter will be kept as a separate audio file which can be skipped by those not wishing to hear sexual content.

Second VA for all male dialog ($35,000) - DONE!
At this stretch goal, we will have enough money to hire a second VA to voice male parts such as Calamity, Red Eye, and Watcher.  
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money, it doesn't mean you can't help:

Please let your friends know about our campaign, especially if they’re interested in Fallout Equestria, Fallout, or magical ponies!
Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page!

Thank you again, and Ad Victorium!

story:
Story of My Book 

My name is Andrea Medina and I am the author of The Energized Self: Explorations of Inner Peace to Foster Self-Awareness, Compassion & Service. I wrote this book after a challenging year of feeling lost and disillusioned with my life. While I’d initially set out to write a memoir, a key piece was missing. What was supposed to be an interview with a stranger to gather supporting information for my arguments turned into a two-hour conversation about feeling inadequate, experiencing a loss of faith, and exploring childhood trauma. I left the interview knowing that my book would actually represent my journey to a place of clarity; I needed to find out who I was and how I related to the world around me. That is why one intimate conversation turned into twenty-two that contributed lessons, tools, motivations, excitements, fears, creations, and nuances that reminded me healing was an interconnected process. 

Many of us have had moments in our lives that have felt like coming home to ourselves. Few people can expand on this feeling and see that human beings thrive from connections at their core. As somebody that has always been quite introverted, exploring these human relationships has made me more accepting of myself. When we create a space for connection without judgment, the sky is the limit for what can be bred from such interactions.

For one, they can inspire a book.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will reflect upon the life experiences that have brought you until this point and view them as your personal power and purpose. With my story and those of 22 others, I hope to instill in you the inner peace and confidence to make sense of confusing, disorderly moments in life. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a collection of tools to help you in moments of uncertainty with yourself and others.

As part of these chapters, you’ll hear stories such as: 

  • Eva’s, whose bipolar disorder episode caused her to be accused of a crime that she’s still on trial for, but in the process has lost her family. Her story shows us how life can sometimes bring moments that are not only hard because they change the world we knew, but because they alter the self we knew.
  • Mike’s, who was given six months left to live but survived his kidney disease diagnosis and found the inspiration to start a new company, Happy Plate. His story teaches us that we have the power to restructure the ties between the events that occur in our life. 
  • Nisha’s, who went through years of peeling back the layers to her childhood trauma and first memories of gender exploration to discover who she was. Her story is more than one of gender—it is a story of someone becoming the most authentic version of themselves. 

The Energized Self: Explorations of Inner Peace to Foster Self-Awareness, Compassion & Service is a book for anyone who wants to understand themselves better. You will love this book if you are someone who enjoys storytelling as a way to kickstart self-reflection and a bigger-picture mentality. This book is for anyone who is curious about what’s on the other side of discomfort. While these stories outline individual experiences, they resonate with universal feelings.

The Book 

The book is written in 3 parts.

I've structured this book into my essential components for a total sense of wellbeing. I present these as the Me, They, and We. First, we look within and try to build a strong foundation of self. This foundation allows us to understand that everyone is an extension of ourselves. Fostering compassion for others will enable us to practice service in any way that comes naturally to us. 

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-6. In this section, you will read about my journey to self-discovery: how I approached loving myself and healing my trauma with narrative therapy. These chapters don’t sugarcoat how difficult but rewarding the act of self-reflection could be.

Part 2 contains chapters 7-13. In this section, you will hear from fourteen individuals about their experiences overcoming issues from low self-worth to the murder of a family member. This section promotes the prioritization of self, and offers tips and tricks for better self-reflection. 

Part 3 contains chapters 14-20. In this section, you will hear from eight individuals that have used their new understanding of self and others to promote positive change in their world. 

What I Need & What You'll Get 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021. 
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall. 

When I hit $5,500, I will publish the ebook/softcover editions.

When I hit $6,500, I will publish the book as a hardcover edition.

When I hit $8,500, I will get an audiobook edition. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author 

Andrea Medina graduated from Claremont McKenna College with a bachelor's degree in Literature and International Relations. While in college, she conducted research on Latin America and the Middle East, read dozens of psychology and self-help books, helped indigenous women in Peru as a volunteer, and became pen-pals with five exceptional students from Brazil. She also graduated with honors from her class and won the best thesis award in her International Relations major. Her next steps are to teach English in Mississippi with Teach for America and to take counseling courses on the side. 

When she is not writing, you can find Andrea meditating or listening to rap (Eminem is her obsession) while weight lifting. The oddness of this combination doesn't elude her. She also loves being outdoors and reconnecting with friends from Brazil to ensure she isn't forgetting the language and beautiful bonds she formed while doing an exchange program there.

For more information, you can connect with Andrea Medina on Linkedin, at andrea.medina.author@gmail.com, Facebook, Website, or at @andreamedina_author on Instagram. 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheEnergizedSelf and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! I've got my heart in this project and hope it will change you as positively as it did me while writing it. God bless...

Thanks again,
Andrea Medina

story:
Sudbinske 2020 pokrenuo sam putopisni projekt Kronike globalnog zatopljenja (KGZ). Lanjski cilj bio je daleki sjever, ledenjaci koji se otapaju..... ekspedicija je prošla izuzetno uspješno, i rezultirala sadržajem na društvenim mrežama, virtualnom izložbom dostupnom svima na Internetu, i pravom, fizičkom izložbom u Zagrebu.

Ove godine, za KGZ Episode II, cilj su neki otoci kojima prijeti podizanje razine mora - podizanje, do kojeg i dolazi zbog otapanja leda koje smo pratili lani na Grenlandu i Islandu.

Glavni sponzor projekta je Bosch Hrvatska.

Srebrni partneri su Moj e-račun, Croatia Osiguranje, Hrvatska Pošta, JGL – Jadran galenski laboratorij, Raiffeissen Bank, a ostali partneri Revuto, Aircash, Leda, Sedmi Odjel, ETF Airways, konferencija 3T – Tourism, Travel and Tech; IT medij BUG, te Duplerica.

Globalno zatopljenje problem je aktualan već neko vrijeme. Ideja serijala Kronike globalnog zatopljenja obilazak je mjesta koja su najpogođenija dosadašnjim promjenama životnih uvjeta izazvanih klimom, i reportaža s mnoštvom osobnih dojmova.

Glavni kanal komunikacije je grupa na Facebooku. (kliknite na link)

Prijavite se! Pozovite znane i neznane, lajkajte, šerajte...

Ako ste u grupu došli naknadno, preporučam da pogledate i starije postove. Možete skrolati do dna, pa polako prema gore.

Drugi, bolji način je da otvorite slike (Photos). Fotke su poredane kronološki, a gotovo svaki post ima sliku, pa klikanjem po fotkama ili prebacivanjem strelicom možete ići po redu. Najranije fotke su naravno na dnu galerije fotografija....

Zamolio sam i stručnjake za pitanja klime, ekologije i održivosti da sudjeluju svojim stručnim opažanjima kao suradnici putopisa. Ne očekujem da ću se s njima nužno uvijek slagati, ali diskusija će u svakom slučaju biti zanimljiva.

Ideja iza svih sedam putopisa dosad bila je Facebook izdavaštvom baciti rukavicu u lice tradicionalnim oblicima izdavaštva. Vrlo je bitno pokazati i dokazati da izdavaštvo na društvenim mrežama može polučiti interesa koliko i klasično. Linkovi na sve prošle projekte nalaze se na mom Fejs profilu sa strane lijevo, u rubrici Intro, ili u Linked Groups za grupu Kronike globalnog zatopljenja na Fejsu.

Svijet u zadnjih barem pedesetak godina nije bio u većem kaosu. Kako uopće otići igdje? Kao motiv za praćenje ovakvih putopisa kažem - pratite i podržite, jer vi sami nikada tamo nećete otići. Ne zanima vas, ne da vam se, daleko je.... obično to ubacim kao šaljivi element, možda i poticaj da pokažete da sam u krivu i odete na lokaciju, ali zapravo to nikad nije vrijedilo više nego sada. Svijet putovanja kakav nas čeka u dogledno vrijeme bit će drugačiji od onoga prije....

Zašto biste trebali podržati ovu kampanju?

Ove godine, cilj crowdfunding kampanje postavio sam namjerno vrlo nisko. Eto, zašto ne. 

Cilj u ovom slučaju treba shvatiti vrlo ležerno. Čak i ako vas putopis kao takav ne zanima, ako su vam moji dnevni, ne-putopisni komentari na Facebooku zabavni, poučni, informativni, ili jednostavno pomažu da sačuvate mentalno zdravlje, u poplavi medijskih toskina, možete me nagraditi sudjelovanjem u kampanji. 

Što se dobije zauzvrat, šta ima od perkova?

Ovo je jednostavna kampanja i nema puno perkova.

15 evra – Fotopis

Sa 15 eura podržavate putopis, sve postove i fotke koje ćemo stavljati kao pripremu i sa samog putovanja. S prethodnih ekspedicija bilo je na svakoj slika i teksta u dimenzijama prave knjige! 

25 evra – Fotopis XL

Za one kojima moji postovi za vrijeme corone pomažu očuvanju mentalnog zdravlja. Enough said! 

60 evra – Fotopis F+

Isto kao fotopis, samo za one koji mogu i žele pomoći malo više! Prvi put sam u ovom rangu nudio Fotopis + pivo, ali onda se desilo sljedeće – nakon povratka kad sam ponudio ljudima da se nađemo i "odradimo" dogovoreno pivo koje im pripada, svi su u nekoj gužvi, ovo, ono, a ja sam zapravo sve s terena ispričao, i fotke stavio, već u putopisu. Tako da je to s pivom ispalo malo promašeno.

U svakom slučaju – budući da je 15 novaca zbilja sitna lova, tko želi pomoći s 60 – samo naprijed, cijenim to, ekspedicija ima troškove.... a što se piva tiče, lako se dogovorimo.

250 evra – Big Picture

Lovatori i oni koji vole umjetnost – ne znam kako će se pogledati u ogledalo ako ne uzmu ovaj jaki perk... uspješni startupi, njihovi pokretači, investitori, vlasnici iPhonea, kapitalisti, neoliberali, paleoanarhisti, ljubitelji Tesli, mrzitelji Tesli, poduzetnici, saborski zastupnici, socijalisti, kriminalci.... a svih njih ima među mojim frendovima.... KGB ZNA da ovo čitate.... 

U sklopu tog perka dobije se divna slika za staviti na zid – poput ovih koje vidite na fotografijama pored ovog pasusa.

Slike s fotografija dio su mog projekta Without People – samo kao ilustracija kako slika ovog formata, koja je dio perka, izgleda.

Kliknite gore na tab Gallery, tamo je par primjera mojih fotografija koje vam daju ideju kakav tip fotografija radim s puta. Ovo su inače fotografije iz Pamira, Armenije, Nepala, Kazahstana, Tajlanda, Irske, Turske, Bolivije, Mauritanije, Grenlanda, Maroka, Kalifornije i Nevade (SAD).

599 EVRA – SINDIKALNI POVJERENIK

Ovo je corporate package – imaš firmu, aute, robote, virtualne điđe, datacentre, softvere, ekstraprofite, saprofite? Imaš SINDIKAT?? ...aj ne škrtari, pokaži da si baja!

SINDIKALNI POVJERENIK je logični slijednik najlegendarnijeg, najneisplativijeg, najflambojantnijeg perka hrvatskog crowdfundinga ikad - NEOLIBERAL BASTARDA!!! 

Promjena je u skladu s vremenima - osjećajniji smo, brinemo o drugima.... ali..... ali.... neoliberal bastard will be back!!!!!

English summary

Hi, this is a campaign to get funding for the photo expedition projecT.

Main sponsor of this project is technology company BOSCH.

The project is in Croatian, because we plan to write travelogue in Croatian language, for our Croat readers (and others who understand Croatian). We will also post high quality photos. So, since photos do not require any translation – if you like nice photos you can support the campaign too....

Thanks!

Čak i ako vas putopis kao takav ne zanima, ako su vam moji dnevni, ne-putopisni komentari na Facebooku zabavni, poučni, informativni, ili jednostavno pomažu da sačuvate mentalno zdravlje, u poplavi medijskih toskina, možete me nagraditi sudjelovanjem u kampanji. Što se dobije zauzvrat, šta ima od perkova?Ovo je jednostavna kampanja i nema puno perkova.15 evra – FotopisSa 15 eura podržavate putopis, sve postove i fotke koje ćemo stavljati kao pripremu i sa samog putovanja. S prethodnih ekspedicija bilo je na svakoj slika i teksta u dimenzijama prave knjige! 25 evra – Fotopis XLZa one kojima moji postovi za vrijeme corone pomažu očuvanju mentalnog zdravlja. Enough said! 60 evra – Fotopis F+Isto kao fotopis, samo za one koji mogu i žele pomoći malo više! Prvi put sam u ovom rangu nudio Fotopis + pivo, ali onda se desilo sljedeće – nakon povratka kad sam ponudio ljudima da se nađemo i "odradimo" dogovoreno pivo koje im pripada, svi su u nekoj gužvi, ovo, ono, a ja sam zapravo sve s terena ispričao, i fotke stavio, već u putopisu. Tako da je to s pivom ispalo malo promašeno.U svakom slučaju – budući da je 15 novaca zbilja sitna lova, tko želi pomoći s 60 – samo naprijed, cijenim to, ekspedicija ima troškove.... a što se piva tiče, lako se dogovorimo.250 evra – Big PictureLovatori i oni koji vole umjetnost – ne znam kako će se pogledati u ogledalo ako ne uzmu ovaj jaki perk... uspješni startupi, njihovi pokretači, investitori, vlasnici iPhonea, kapitalisti, neoliberali, paleoanarhisti, ljubitelji Tesli, mrzitelji Tesli, poduzetnici, saborski zastupnici, socijalisti, kriminalci.... a svih njih ima među mojim frendovima.... KGB ZNA da ovo čitate.... U sklopu tog perka dobije se divna slika za staviti na zid – poput ovih koje vidite na fotografijama pored ovog pasusa.Slike s fotografija dio su mog projekta Without People – samo kao ilustracija kako slika ovog formata, koja je dio perka, izgleda.Kliknite gore na tab Gallery, tamo je par primjera mojih fotografija koje vam daju ideju kakav tip fotografija radim s puta. Ovo su inače fotografije iz Pamira, Armenije, Nepala, Kazahstana, Tajlanda, Irske, Turske, Bolivije, Mauritanije, Grenlanda, Maroka, Kalifornije i Nevade (SAD).599 EVRA – SINDIKALNI POVJERENIKOvo je corporate package – imaš firmu, aute, robote, virtualne điđe, datacentre, softvere, ekstraprofite, saprofite? Imaš SINDIKAT?? ...aj ne škrtari, pokaži da si baja!SINDIKALNI POVJERENIK je logični slijednik najlegendarnijeg, najneisplativijeg, najflambojantnijeg perka hrvatskog crowdfundinga ikad - NEOLIBERAL BASTARDA!!! Promjena je u skladu s vremenima - osjećajniji smo, brinemo o drugima.... ali..... ali.... neoliberal bastard will be back!!!!!English summaryHi, this is a campaign to get funding for the photo expedition projecT.Main sponsor of this project is technology company BOSCH.The project is in Croatian, because we plan to write travelogue in Croatian language, for our Croat readers (and others who understand Croatian). We will also post high quality photos. So, since photos do not require any translation – if you like nice photos you can support the campaign too....Thanks!

story:
My name is Shanti Leonard and after years of working I can now say that my noveI is finished. It is very personal to me and took a great deal of time, so I want to give it the best shot at finding its audience.

From beta reader comments and responses the most common comparisons I have received have been to Neil Gaiman, Ray Bradbury, Stephen King, Tim Burton, and Stranger Things. So if you are a fan of any of those giants you might fall for this odd tale. It is definitely it's own thing, and I feel a bit ridiculous mentioning these creators in the same breath as my yet-to-be published debut novel, but I also feel like it might be the best way to convey the type of story it is.

OD AND ED is the story of a sister and brother in 1988. They find a mysterious box hidden under the floor of one of their bedrooms and...they open it. When opened the box pushes Ed's soul out of his body, leaving it still able walk and talk, but otherwise empty. Od soon realizes that it's up to her to get his soul back.

The book is almost ready to print, there are just a couple things it needs to nudge it over the finish line. Your support can make this happen and it would mean the world to me.

 

Here, let me break down what I need and where your money is going.

My novel has gone through several rounds of beta readers, and many rewrites, but there are still things that need to be completed, outside of writing, to give the book a chance at being successful.

Here is a list of those things:

  • Editor - The book still needs a professional copy edit and proofread.
  • Cover - The book still needs a professional cover artist to design and produce a cover that can convey the right genre, as well as make it stand out.
  • Formatting - The book must be formatted for print and various eBook platforms.
  • ISBN numbers and fees
  • Marketing for the book (ads, book deal sites, ARCs, etc.)

All money I raise of my goal will go directly toward this.

 

Any money raised over my goal will go toward:

  • ARCs (advanced reader copies) for reviewers
  • Marketing and ads (so that I can market the book to as many potential readers as possible and find its audience).

 

If there is anything left over after paying for the edit, cover, formatting, ARCs, and marketing, I have some cool ideas for stretch goals that I will reveal! Anything on top of that I will put toward my next book, which I hope to release later this year.

If I do not reach my goal all the money raised will go toward the edit. The most important thing is that the book be as good as it can be and a good copy edit is paramount to that. If I do not raise enough for a professional cover I will have to go with a cheaper option or possibly design it myself. If this occurs I may also have to format the book myself, which isn't easy, but I can do it. This will all be more time consuming, and might not result in as clean a package.

I am already planning on paying for all the ISBN numbers, fees, and Author Platform costs (website, mailbox, newsletter, reader magnet, etc.) myself.

No matter what though, no matter how much is raised, the book will be published.

So, what do you get out of this? Besides my forever gratitude, the knowledge that you helped bring something in to the world that wasn't there before, and the warm fuzzies from helping?

Depending on your level of contribution you could get all this:

  • A softback trade copy of my book. Signed, sealed, and delivered. It's yours!
  • A hardback copy of my book. It will be signed as well and shipped to you ASAP.
  • A Special Thanks in my book!
  • Your name somewhere in the actual story of my book! Maybe your name will be on a tombstone, or maybe a store will be named after you, or a street...heck it could be anything. I just have to see where your particular name would fit. We will discuss before.

 

I believe that my greatest strength is creativity. It has served me well in figuring out many problems and it has been the fuel for my most successful endeavors, including several screenplays that are in various stages of development, award winning short scripts, and award winning commercials. Not to mention all the successful projects I have served in a minor role.

I truly believe you will enjoy my novel. Even the beta readers who don't usually read in my genre enjoyed it. And there is a chance you could love it.

Stories that we love have a chance to change people for the better and to inspire them to do things they would not have done without them. I am not saying this will happen with my book, but even if it happens once, even if it nudges somebody toward creating something, or opens their mind to a new perspective, or makes them feel good for an hour, or gives them a needed escape for a bit, it is worth it. That, to me, is an immense impact.

 

Self Publishing is not what it used to be. Changes in the industry have made it a much more viable option for success. There are many authors now that are very successful going this route. But going this route in lieu of traditional publishing also leaves much of the work that the publisher would normally do to the author.

I am confident that I can accomplish everything that needs to be done to get it published. I have, in fact, done much of it already. I have also taken a course as well as read several books on the subject.

After my research and education, I believe the biggest hurdle is getting somebody to pick the dang thing up (digitally or physically).

There are three things I need to ensure that a perspective reader will pick up my book.

  • A cover that signals to the correct readers that this is the type of book they like to read, as well as one that stands out in the crowd.
  • An absolutely killer blurb on the back that can hook the reader (I will work on this with the editor) .
  • Great reviews (which come from having a well written and compelling book)

Not having these things could mean the difference between a successful book and one that falls short of expectations, no matter what it is like inside.

There are a lot of books out there competing for attention and even with all of these things done professionally and perfectly the book could still fall short of sales expectations. That is just the nature of art. No matter what though, barring some freak occurrence or act of God, this book will be published within the next few months.

 

I know that not everyone one can support financially. Things are rough, and luck is hard, especially right now. But you can help! You can share! My social media following is pretty meager and my reach is not yet long, so if you could boost my signal, and let people know about this campaign, if you could share it on your social media channels, online groups, or wherever you think is appropriate, it would not only mean a lot to me, it could make a big difference.

I guess that about does it.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out this thing I made, and for considering to support my project.

story:
Story of My Book

In today’s society, there is both an extreme lack of financial education and an overwhelming social pressure to pursue higher education in order to succeed in life. As young professionals and other young adults enter the work force, they are blindsided by the amount of financial knowledge needed to position themselves for success in the future. 

Young, Educated and Broke will discuss the systematic way to navigate the cluttered world of personal finance and address the manner in which financial values and questions support and drive the improvement of one's financial literacy. Financial literacy should not be a privilege to learn, it should be the standard.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that your financial values will drive change regarding financial literacy and wealth accumulation. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for financial literacy specifically for young professionals. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you utilize questions to supercharge your financial wholesomeness journey.

In this book, you'll learn about the logical progressions of addressing financial literacy and how we can utilize questions to derive knowledge and bypassing the learning curve. You'll hear stories such as...

  • My time spent at a financial advisory firm where I kicked off my journey toward building and   sharing financial literacy lessons. 
  • Trial and error from many others who have learned financial lessons the hard way; through doing.
  • How even financial professionals were once beginners still learning these very topics, highlighting the idea that we all start at zero.

You will love this book if you are looking for a common sense path to work toward financial literacy, a fresh perspective on the way to systematically tackle each piece of wealth building, and looking for a finance book that doesn't read like a textbook!

Young, Educated and Broke: How a Questioning Mindset Can Combat the Financial Illiteracy Epidemic is a nonfiction book that speaks to young professionals and anyone seeking a path toward financial freedom who want to look at realistic viewpoints on personal finance and view the shifting financial landscape in a new way.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

    •The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

    •The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

    •The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

    •The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

    •The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Michael J. Grus is driving change and coaching innovation at Turner Construction Company. Specifically, he is working with trade partner companies and Turner employees to push the boundaries of what is possible regarding innovation in the workplace and on construction sites. He enjoys coaching teams to success through question-driven process improvement resulting in an overall better working environment. 

Michael's interest in process improvement and operational efficiency is rooted in his inquisitive nature and desire to change the way “we have always done things.” His experience optimizing human performance and driving personal growth found it's intersection with the similarities of the personal finance world, which later drove him to author this book. 

Michael spends most of his free time partaking in physical activities including triathlon and outdoor sports. The idea of writing a book was always something he pondered but with the on set of the pandemic, it drove him to action to execute this aspiration. The book came to life through engaging in social media interactions to drive content and employing his working skills of challenging the status quo that brought “Young, Educated and Broke” to life. 

For more information, you can connect with Michael J. Grus at:

 

Email: Michael.j.grus@gmail.com

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/grusbus/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michael.grus.7

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-j-grus/

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6Rsd... 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

  • Please use #BrokeNoMore and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
    Tag: 
    Instragram - @grusbus/ @newdegreepress
    Facebook - Michael Grus / @NewDegreePress 

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
 

 

-Michael J. Grus

story:
Story of My Book

Towards Machine Literacy is a book about AI at its best and worst: how AI systems can and will do incredible things, but why we need to be careful as we develop and use them. The book focuses on AI literacy, the simple act of understanding the abilities and limitations of AI systems, and being able to understand how those systems affect us today. 

My name is Daniel Bashir and I am the author of Towards Machine Literacy. I wrote this book because while working on machine learning in academia and in the industry, I’ve been exposed to a number of questions about the ethical and societal consequences of AI. I’m convinced we need more voices in the conversation we’re having about this technology, and I wanted to explore these ideas and make them accessible to a broad audience. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover AI literacy’s importance in today’s world. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for AI literacy. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand how AI technologies affect us today and how we can ensure they have a positive impact in the future.

In this book, you'll learn about current uses of AI and some of the ethical and societal quagmires those uses engender. You'll hear stories such as...
  • How the field of AI started, with a paper by Alan Turing and a summer workshop at Dartmouth.
  • How one YouTube addict became radicalized—and eventually deradicalized himself—after diving down a rabbit hole of incendiary videos recommended to him by YouTube’s algorithm. 
  • The governance of a real-life algorithm for matching kidneys to recipients. 

You will love this book if you are interested in current technology, want to understand how technology impacts society, or are concerned about how advanced technologies might impact the lives we lead.

Towards Machine Literacy is a nonfiction book that speaks to the general public and technologists or policymakers who want to look at artificial intelligence and its impacts in a new way.

 

The Book - Towards Machine Literacy

The book is written in 5 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. In this section, I’ll talk about how AI got where it is today, considering both the research advances and how practitioners and the public think about the field. We’ll talk about the famous summer at Dartmouth as well as how legislation tends to lag behind technology. 

Part 2 contains chapters 3-5. This section on the principles of AI literacy will begin to unpack the important things to understand about AI systems today.  

Part 3 contains chapters 6-15. This section—the longest by far—dives into the pros and cons of many AI systems. We look at dilemmas about technologies like facial recognition and recommender systems, and how questions about making these systems better don’t have easy answers. 

Part 4 contains chapters 16-18. In these three chapters, we look at specific ways we can develop AI literacy among groups like policymakers and students. At this point, you, the reader, will have developed your own literacy!

Part 5 contains chapters 19-20. The book’s finale will center around case studies on the governance of algorithms and AI systems. I’ll go into detail about pitfalls in the use of algorithmic and AI systems, and use examples to show how we can uncover these issues and prevent potential problems in the future. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Hit $6,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published

 

About the Author

Daniel Bashir is a machine learning software engineer who previously spent time at Amazon Web Services and Amazon working on machine learning platforms and recommendation systems. 

Daniel wrote this book because his own experience working with AI systems, as well as his passions for philosophy and the humanities, have led him to think deeply about the impact that these technologies have on our daily lives. Between doing machine learning research, writing for Skynet Today, and working in the industry, he has spent a lot of time considering why we should be developing AI at all, and how we can develop a cautious optimism about technology generally. 

Beyond the time he spends thinking about AI, Daniel is an avid reader of fiction, philosophy, and political science. He loves playing tennis, spending time with his family, traveling, and cooking and eating delicious food. Daniel has a special talent for losing his balance and a deep-seated fear of butterflies. 

For more information, you can connect with Daniel at dbashir@hmc.edu and on Twitter and LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #towardsmachineliteracy and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag: 
Facebook - @daniel.bashir.58 / @NewDegreePress 

Twitter - @spaniel_bashir / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Daniel Bashir

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Brenna Blaylock and I am the author of, The Story They Never Tell Us. I wrote this book because I wanted to introduce a youthful depiction of the racial tensions unaddressed by our country. Racism has become covert, yet prevalent in every institution; I wanted to shed light on what I call, “reformed racism.” 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired to protect communities that are outside of your own. I hope readers become educated on the ways our communities can progress simply due to conversations. I want readers to see this book as an opportunity to learn along with the characters how to engage with others in a progressive way. We must move past a society that requires Black students to learn how to navigate microaggressions and transition into a society that teaches their white counterpart that they exist. Ideally, we will move into a society that eradicates anti-black vernacular from vocabulary completely.

The Story They Never Tell Us, is a book about a young Black woman named Aaliyah Harris. She attempts to navigate a PWI (predominately white institution) with the help of a new friend, her roommate Charlie.

Fear of the unknown encompasses Aaliyah as she arrives at Stanford University for Move-in Day. She recognizes the lack of community she feels as soon as she arrives on campus and is desperate to find comfort, community. 

In, The Story They Never Tell Us, readers will see Aaliyah attempt to adjust to a predominantly white social environment, while also feeling overwhelmed by trying to “remain Black.” Readers will see Charlie, Aaliyah's roommate, educating herself by trying to become the perfect ally and friend. Both assist in each other’s development throughout the story, learning from each other that the commitment to understanding can contribute to the banality of one’s own sanctuary of ignorance.


You will love this book if you are looking for healing and hope in this unforgiving world.The Story They Never Tell Us speaks to those constantly disregarded by educational institutions in America. It provides hope by showing the growth of two friends, both healing through the commitment to conversation and understanding.

Ultimately, I hope The Story They Never Tell Us inspires young readers to engage in conversations that may lead to frustration; for those are the conversations that allow reflection and dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Have I subconsciously contributed to this educational institution rooted in discrimination? 
  • Who can I engage in conversations with in order to create a safer space for Black and brown individuals?
  • What are some communities that I can support and discuss with in order to increase my own awareness? 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing social justice, education reform, and creating awareness through difficult conversations will change us all for the better. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Brenna Blaylock is a second year student at San Diego State University. She is heavily involved on campus as the Executive Vice President of the Greenfest Board, an attorney for the university’s First Team Mock Trial organization, and an employee of an on-campus job.

Brenna’s passions have always aligned with being socially and politically engaged. She intends to continue amplifying and supporting those who are in communities that extend past her own. After organizing a peaceful protest in June 2020, she decided to create a more tangible body of work. She hopes this book will reflect the issues she will continue to address once she graduates from law school. 

Aside from writing, you will find Brenna reading. Her favorite place in her hometown is the Coronado Library. But don’t mistake her introverted tendencies for shyness because she will also be the life of the party once the pandemic is over! 

For more information, you can connect with Brenna Blaylock at brenna.janele@gmail.com and @brennablaylock on all social media platforms.
 

Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheStoryTheyNeverTellUs and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Brenna Blaylock
