story:
"Nowhere is the dreamer or the misfit so alone . . ."

When Neil Peart, drummer and lyricist of legendary rock band Rush, died on January 7, 2020, fans the world over expressed their grief and sadness. Neil's passing was more than just passing news: Fans felt like they knew him. They felt like they knew all three members of Rush . . .

. . . and now the band was definitively over.

I felt these same feelings, having been a Rush fan for over 20 years. Geddy, Alex, and Neil created a body of work that spoke to me, and very often if felt like it spoke to me specifically. In reading tributes to Neil and the band after his death, I realized that millions of other fans felt the same way.

My question was: Why? What was it about Rush fans that makes us respond so strongly to their music? Is there a Rush fan "type"? Are the stereotypes about Rush fans being white middle-aged male nerds true? And most importantly: Why does this band mean so much to us?

So I decided to write a book about it. 

I'm a science-fiction author with two novels published, but I decided to throw my hat into the non-fiction ring, put back on my historian's hat, and get to work. I interviewed people such as legendary DJ and media historian Donna Halper, who first broke the band in the U.S., and conducted a survey gathering information and wonderful stories from hundreds of Rush fans. 

This information and these stories are used in the book, and I really think I got an answer to my three primary questions:

  1. Is there a Rush fan type? If so, what is it?
  2. Why did Neil Peart's death mean so much to so many people?
  3. Why is there such a strong bond between Rush and their fans?

What I Need & What You Get

I want this book to be spectacular. Not just content-wise--it is, as you'll see. I want the whole package to be worthy of both the band and YOU, the fans. Self-publishing is rewarding, but expensive, and I front the costs myself. These include editing, formatting, and especially cover art.

I want my friend, excellent comics artist and Rush fan Jessie White, to paint the cover. He's ultra-talented and I know he'll do a bang-up job. He's excited to be a part of this project . . . but he also deserves to get paid. You can check out some of his work here. 

I'm looking to raise $2,000 to make this project a reality. The money will be spent as follows:

  • $1,500 for cover art
  • $250 for editing
  • $250 for formatting

$2,000 is the minimum of what I need, but I do have some great stretch goals!

Stretch Goals

$3,000: If I can raise $3,000, my friend, artist extraordinaire Manuel Guzman will create interior illustrations for each chapter! Manuel is the author and illustrator of the storybook In Search of Sacha, as well as the cover artist for my books The Last Ancestor and The Second Sojourn. He's incredibly talented--check out his book here and his art here. This will make the finished book even more spectacular.

$3,200: For another $200 more, Jessie White will create a two-page comic to accompany the book's intro.

As the campaign goes on, if I can think of any more stretch goals, I'll put them here. I'm also willing to hear ideas, so feel free to email!

The Impact

This book is likely to happen regardless, but it won't be as awesome. Specifically, I am going to have to skimp on the cover, editing, and formatting. 

I am willing and able to make this a reality, and have published two complete novels already with another ready to be released later this year. I'm a consistent writer and blogger and always carry through with my promise. 

Your support will allow me to put a high-quality book in the hands of Rush fans all around the world, many of whom have written me expressing their eagerness to read Dreamers and Misfits. This isn't a cash grab, and it's not a vanity project. It's a serious, loving, and sometimes humorous project. I'm using both my training as an attorney and a historian to find sources, synthesize them, and construct arguments. I'm also using my musician's training and imagination to make sure it's well-written, informative, and most of all FUN. In other words, just like the band.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest hurdles are financial and personal. You see, I personally will feel like I'm short-changing Rush fans if I can't give them the best book money can buy. And much like Rush put an incredible amount of thought not just into their music but also into their artwork and album packaging, I want to do the same for Dreamers and Misfits.

Time is also a big challenge. If I can't raise enough money to pay Jesse, as well as my editor and formatter, it will take even longer to publish this book than the four months it's taken me to write it.

If I don't raise enough money, I will use what I did raise to defray some of the costs of publishing, but the book will likely be delayed and won't have as awesome of a cover. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with the Rush fan in your life who you think would love to be a part of this project! I appreciate as many eyeballs on my campaign and writing as possible!

You can also support by taking the survey! It's still open and there's still time to be in the book yourself!

Thank you for reading, God bless, and long live Rush!

When Neil Peart, drummer and lyricist of legendary rock band Rush, died on January 7, 2020, fans the world over expressed their grief and sadness. Neil's passing was more than just passing news: Fans felt like they knew him. They felt like they knew all three members of Rush . . .
. . . and now the band was definitively over.
I felt these same feelings, having been a Rush fan for over 20 years. Geddy, Alex, and Neil created a body of work that spoke to me, and very often if felt like it spoke to me specifically. In reading tributes to Neil and the band after his death, I realized that millions of other fans felt the same way.
My question was: Why? What was it about Rush fans that makes us respond so strongly to their music? Is there a Rush fan "type"? Are the stereotypes about Rush fans being white middle-aged male nerds true? And most importantly: Why does this band mean so much to us?
So I decided to write a book about it. 
I'm a science-fiction author with two novels published, but I decided to throw my hat into the non-fiction ring, put back on my historian's hat, and get to work. I interviewed people such as legendary DJ and media historian Donna Halper, who first broke the band in the U.S., and conducted a survey gathering information and wonderful stories from hundreds of Rush fans. 
This information and these stories are used in the book, and I really think I got an answer to my three primary questions:

Is there a Rush fan type? If so, what is it?
Why did Neil Peart's death mean so much to so many people?
Why is there such a strong bond between Rush and their fans?

What I Need & What You Get

I want this book to be spectacular. Not just content-wise--it is, as you'll see. I want the whole package to be worthy of both the band and YOU, the fans. Self-publishing is rewarding, but expensive, and I front the costs myself. These include editing, formatting, and especially cover art.
I want my friend, excellent comics artist and Rush fan Jessie White, to paint the cover. He's ultra-talented and I know he'll do a bang-up job. He's excited to be a part of this project . . . but he also deserves to get paid. You can check out some of his work here. 
I'm looking to raise $2,000 to make this project a reality. The money will be spent as follows:

$1,500 for cover art
$250 for editing
$250 for formatting

$2,000 is the minimum of what I need, but I do have some great stretch goals!
Stretch Goals
$3,000: If I can raise $3,000, my friend, artist extraordinaire Manuel Guzman will create interior illustrations for each chapter! Manuel is the author and illustrator of the storybook In Search of Sacha, as well as the cover artist for my books The Last Ancestor and The Second Sojourn. He's incredibly talented--check out his book here and his art here. This will make the finished book even more spectacular.
$3,200: For another $200 more, Jessie White will create a two-page comic to accompany the book's intro.
As the campaign goes on, if I can think of any more stretch goals, I'll put them here. I'm also willing to hear ideas, so feel free to email!

The Impact
This book is likely to happen regardless, but it won't be as awesome. Specifically, I am going to have to skimp on the cover, editing, and formatting. 
I am willing and able to make this a reality, and have published two complete novels already with another ready to be released later this year. I'm a consistent writer and blogger and always carry through with my promise. 
Your support will allow me to put a high-quality book in the hands of Rush fans all around the world, many of whom have written me expressing their eagerness to read Dreamers and Misfits. This isn't a cash grab, and it's not a vanity project. It's a serious, loving, and sometimes humorous project. I'm using both my training as an attorney and a historian to find sources, synthesize them, and construct arguments. I'm also using my musician's training and imagination to make sure it's well-written, informative, and most of all FUN. In other words, just like the band.

Risks & Challenges
My biggest hurdles are financial and personal. You see, I personally will feel like I'm short-changing Rush fans if I can't give them the best book money can buy. And much like Rush put an incredible amount of thought not just into their music but also into their artwork and album packaging, I want to do the same for Dreamers and Misfits.
Time is also a big challenge. If I can't raise enough money to pay Jesse, as well as my editor and formatter, it will take even longer to publish this book than the four months it's taken me to write it.
If I don't raise enough money, I will use what I did raise to defray some of the costs of publishing, but the book will likely be delayed and won't have as awesome of a cover. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with the Rush fan in your life who you think would love to be a part of this project! I appreciate as many eyeballs on my campaign and writing as possible!
You can also support by taking the survey! It's still open and there's still time to be in the book yourself!
Thank you for reading, God bless, and long live Rush!

story:
Pachamama - The Cookbook is the culmination of 10 years of our learning, testing, tasting, tweaking, exploring and experimenting with plant-based foods. But more significantly it is ultimately the story of our lifetime love of nature and the magic of plants.  We want to share that passion and gratitude with you!




We are Benjamin & Anne Marie and we live on the side of a small river in the countryside of Tarifa, Spain. We're the plant-based culinary witch & wizard behind La Pachamama | Organic Kitchen & Garden.

Having cooked professionally for more than ten years all over Europe, we've had countless requests from our fans and friends to put together for a cookbook full of our recipes and our story.. We have now finally  found the time to create Pachamama Organic - The Cookbook.

We could not be more happy, proud and excited to be sharing our most loved and cherished plant-based recipes that we have created over the past ten years as well as telling our story together.






This campaign has more than just a beautiful book - It’s an all-out PACHAMAMA PLANT-BASED BONANZA! We have added a bunch of super hot extras to celebrate the release of our book and help raise the funds needed to publish!  Check out the extra perks available:

 

  • Bonus Gifts & Gift-Giver Sets: 
    Especially for our fans! Get your exclusive Pachamama Organic 100% organic cotton tote bags +  stylish recipe-saver bookmark set!

     
  • VIP LAUNCH PARTY Tickets:
    Exclusive invitation to our riotous (& fully catered!) VIP BOOK LAUNCH PARTY December 2020 in Tarifa Spain! (Included with all gift-giver sets!)

 

  • Plantbased Cookery MASTERCLASS RETREAT PLACES:
    OH YES!  A FOUR-DAY immersion in the Plant Based kitchen! We personally guide and teach you the full plant-based masterclass series in one of the most beautiful retreat venues in Andalucia. Email for full info: info@pachamamaorganic.eu (November 2021)

 

  • The Plant Based Revolution & Super Wholefood WORKSHOP + 9 Friends :
    We will facilitate one of our famous plant based cooking classes in your own home with you and nine friends! Not only will you all receive a copy of our book but will learn first hand from us our cooking secrets.

 

  • The Gourmet Plant Based Long-Table Feast Dining Experience + 9 friends:
    Book us in the flesh! The Plant Based Dining Feast for the ultimate sneak-peek of what's inside the book, you can have us personally cook for you in your home (or ours) and enjoy the colours, delights, sights & smells of the most gourmet & delcious offerings our book has to offer. All diners will go home with a copy of our book.

 

  • The MASTERCLASS SERIES:
    Never-before-advertised EXCLUSIVE! Private 1-on-1 culinary coaching over three days in all aspects of plant based home wholefood cooking! Discover all our secrets with personal attention and structured learning tailored to your kitchen needs.

 

And many more Special Perks to follow during the campaign!!!



We are beyond excited to work together with Aleksandra Olejnik from A Simple Life Project. She's a Marbella based photographer who is incredibly talented. She works with light the way we work with spices!

We've met Aleksandra in 2016 at a yoga retreat that we were hosting at our previous home & glamping Casa de Laila . From that moment onwards, we always knew we wanted to collaborate one way or another.

We are so happy that time has finally come. With Aleksandra in our team, we guarantee the book is going to look absolutely amazing!


The Cookbook is going to be a beautiful hardcover, full of amazing photos, recipes, tips, tricks and personal stories. Even though the book will be a beautiful addition your cookbook shelf, or even your coffee table, we hope for it to be used intensely in the kitchen, complete with olive oil stains, flour marks, and tomato splats! It will have 2 ribbons so you can easily keep pages open. Oh, and of course we're printing on chlorine-free, recycled paper.

You will receive The Cookbook in December 2020 - in time for Christmas 2020 - so you can be generous and enjoy that unique gift-giving feeling!

Gift it your friends, family, neighbours, colleagues, your crush, the postman, your hairdresser, your plumber, your accountant! They will all LOVE it!


We want The Cookbook to be done just right, which is why we are self-publishing the book to ensure it is simply authentically us, our story & our food.

This production will involve a lot of people other than just us – photographers, food stylists, editors, recipe testers, printers & more! All in all, it’s a mighty and costly operation.

We need to raise €12,500 to publish this book and to make that happen we are kindly calling on YOU to support us by pre-ordering your copy during this campaign.

By ordering your copy now, our team will be able to work diligently in the next couple of months to create a gorgeous cookbook for you!


For this campaign to reach far and wide, it's incredibly helpful to please share this page with your friends, family and professional networks. Use the social links that you find on the right hand top of the page to let your world know about The Cookbook!
In the midst of what has been a challenging year, we are giddy and excited by this opportunity to create something for positive in our lives and yours.

We are beyond grateful for any and all support, and we send a heartfelt thankyou to all for helping in bringing this book to life.

With happy hearts full of gratitude,

¡Gracias Gracias!

Anne Marie & Benjamin ♡ La Pachamama | Organic Kitchen & Garden
 

www.pachamamaorganic.eu

PRESS & OTHER ENQUIRIES
info@pachamamaorganic.eu 
+34 645 050 840 / +34 655 84 34 54

story:
Notice 1: IndieGoGo requires payment up front when you make your pledge and this cannot be lowered after the fact (and can only be raised by making a new contribution). Be very sure before you hit that payment button.

Notice 2: This campaign is set up very differently than most crowdfunding campaigns. Read the descriptions carefully. If you have any questions, please drop a line to lotfp@lotfp.com or leave a comment at the tab above before laying down your cash.

Notice 3: New last-minute extra! Jason Thompson adventure walkthrough! See the Extras section!

  • We're doing a new LotFP Ref book to match - if not exceed - the standards of the recently released Rules & Magic book. Hardcover, new layout, expanded content!
  • Backers get to vote on which stretch goals come next. You decide whether we go for a full color layout, or reprinting adventures, or comprehensive indexing, etc.
  • Backers can add on extras that make the book better for everyone. Want Frank Mentzer, Kenneth Hite, Zak S, or Michael Curtis to contribute? You want new monsters by Rafael Chandler and Aeron Alfrey to be part of the book? You make it happen!
  • No matter how much extra material is added, no matter what the final retail price of the book ends up being, your price is locked in once you back the project.
  • There are a ton of exclusives available, like a Referee screen, a new adventure, and an alternate cover available only to backers of this campaign.
  • Backers get a copy of the new printing of Death Frost Doom at no additional cost!
  • Backers get a copy of the new printing of Tower of the Stargazer at no additional cost!
  • Backers get a copy of a new Michael Curtis mini-adventure in PDF, or in print if contributing 100€ or more to the campaign!
And now for the long version of the campaign text with all the conditions and disclaimers and important detailed information:

Lamentations of the Flame Princess is a tabletop RPG company based out of Helsinki Finland, and Weird Fantasy Role-Playing is a horror/fantasy/adventure RPG. It is wildly imaginative and uncompromising (read: explicit content; not for gaming with your kids), with top notch production values, striking art and a heavy metal attitude.

You can download a free version of the core rules without the artwork here and check out the guts of LotFP yourself, and you can download a fully illustrated 180 page LotFP adventure at no charge here.

You can see a gallery of previously published art (and even some art that will be included in the Ref book this campaign is funding!) here. Not safe for work.

You can buy current LotFP releases at the LotFP Webstore. Most of our releases are in the distribution chain, so you can get them at your local store, but the newer books (including the new Rules & Magic) won't go to distribution until the Referee book is printed.

Which is why we're doing the crowdfunding push. Read on...

The previous edition of LotFP (the "Grindhouse Edition") is just about sold out. We're out of copies at the LotFP headquarters, and there are few copies left in distribution. We need the core in print.

The Rules & Magic book (basically the player book) has been printed and is on sale from the LotFP webshop in Finland, but the Ref book has not yet been printed so the new version of the game as a whole cannot yet go into the retail chain where it attracts new fans.

We could go to press right now effectively reprinting the Grindhouse Ref book as a hardcover, but that's not good enough. It needs the professional layout and presentation to match the Rules & Magic book. And it could use some new art, additional editorial input, and all the great things that money can buy but that small publishers have problems financing out of pocket since they're not essential to the production of a book for it to still turn out pretty good.

So we here at LotFP hope you help to finance all of that and make this Ref book one that will both completely bury the previous editions of the book and be impressive enough to attract legions of new fans!

It'll be in hardcover. More durable, more impressive. It will have fresh editing. It will have a professional layout to match the new Rules & Magic book.

It will also have expanded content. LotFP is a living, growing game and so the advice in the book needs to be updated. But it will not replace the old advice, rather it will be presented alongside the previous advice in the book to highlight the fact that there is no one right way to play the game.

It will have a brand new section with tons of crunchy play aids, including a brand new creature generator (specializing in extra-dimensional mockeries of reality) with an expanded roster of sample monsters (but still no official game bestiary!), adventure generators, and all sorts of (hopefully) useful charts and tables to make adventure creation easier that will ensure that you keep this Ref book at hand when preparing your next session.

And of course there is new art, with Jason Rainville, Aeron Alfrey, and Eric Lofgren already having turned in new interior pieces (yes, a good pile of money has already been put into the project, this isn't all being done just on all your backs):

Plus there is a new cover for the Ref book (standard edition) by Malcolm McClinton:

And exclusive to this campaign is the limited edition wraparound cover, by Yannick Bouchard:

We're doing two things differently than traditional crowdfunding campaigns:

First, the Levels 3 - 5 Perks DO NOT INCLUDE SHIPPING COSTS.

What will happen is when the book is ready, you will receive a coupon code for the value of the Ref book (or two), and you will purchase it from the LotFP Webstore, paying the regular shipping costs at that time (and adding whatever other items you wish at the time).

Many crowdfunding campaigns, even ones that are on schedule, either wind up producing larger books than originally planned (which should be a good thing for everyone, right?) or the post office raises their rates between the time the campaign ends and fulfillment begins. It has turned seemingly profitable crowdfunding campaigns into a shipping cost grinder that causes the loss of thousands of dollars.

The estimated weight that this Ref book + Death Frost Doom will be is 575g. Economy shipping for 575g in books would be 7,50€ according to current second-class rates. 1075g for both versions of the Ref book + Death Frost Doom would be 12,50€ to EU addresses and 15,00€ to non-EU addresses for second-class rates. But the book may be bigger. Or smaller. 

But to the customer's advantage here, the extras will be added to those shipments at no added charge. And if we load up on stretch goals increasing the retail price of the book, Perk Levels 3-5 still get you the voucher for the full price based on your backing of the project here.

And then we can just add the value of any additional Stretch Goal Adventures to the voucher, and as each of those books is estimated to weigh about 75g, that would result in a 2,50€ shipping cost increase for non-EU residents if more than one stretch goal adventure is funded.

But again, those are all according to current postage rates, which may change at any time and we don't get much advance notice, and that's why we're not just adding 7,50€ to the cost of the perk levels and calling shipping costs covered.

Second, Extras bought will not automatically count towards stretch goals.

Extra bits and stretch goals have also been a frequent financial killer of "successful" crowdfunding campaigns.

Publishers want to give you lots of cool stuff and extra tidbits. We really do. But this stuff costs money to produce. If you're running a campaign and you say the stretch goal for the next big improvement to the book is 2000€, and you get there because people bought 200 10€ fiddlydoos, and those fiddlydoos cost 5€ to produce... congratulations, you're on the hook for both the stretch goal improvements and the fiddlydoos, and you're down 1000€ out of pocket.

But I still want to offer stretch goals, and I still want to offer fiddlydoos.

So here's how we're going to do it.

Some of the extras have absolutely fixed costs. These are the Commentary, New Monsters, and Personalized Art extras. Half of each purchased extra will go towards the costs of the extra (paying talent!), the other half will go towards stretch goals.

Thulian Echoes will have half of each purchased extra go towards production costs for that adventure (its art budget in particular will be wholly dependent on the money the adventure earns), and half goes towards campaign stretch goals.

The other extras (Slipcase, Screen, Shirts, Dice) will not count towards stretch goals at all until their own costs are cleared. At that point all "profit" from each item will go towards general campaign stretch goals. (And the more that are produced, the less each individual unit costs.) Think of it as mini-embedded sub-crowdfunding campaigns. Because while some of those prices allow break-even to come relatively quickly (the dice in particular), those pricey Slipcases and Ref screen are listed pretty much at cost for 100 units. Get them while you can.

Now, IndieGoGo is not set up like a shopping cart, so if somebody picks Level 3 (30€ base) with 100€ in extras... I won't know whether that's going towards shirts or slipcases or Commentary or what. You can be helpful and email lotfp@lotfp.com right after pledging to let me know where you want your money allocated, to help us know where we are in relation to stretch goals. Otherwise, this tally won't happen until after the campaign ends... leaving a very good chance that we won't know about what stretch goals will be reached until after the campaign ends!

Also, the budget for each extra and all stretch goal amounts assume that IndieGoGo + Paypal will take 10% of all pledges in as fees. That's worst-case scenario, with 8-9% in fees being more typical. After the campaign ends, I will know exactly what percentage has been taken in fees, and adjust the stretch goal costs. So it is possible yet again for stretch goals to be achieved after the campaign ends.

This might sound complicated, and it is (you should see the scary database I've set up on my end to keep track of it all), but people who run these campaigns obsessively crunch numbers on their campaigns daily anyway, so might as well publish the numbers...

And that's how LotFP is going to attempt to run a fiscally responsible crowdfunding campaign where all the money goes where it's supposed to go and you get the best frickin' book possible and nobody goes broke delivering it. Seems a better solution than inflating stretch goals by guessing what proportion of extras vs. core rewards people will choose.

Each of these extra items may be added to your pledge. You may add multiples of each item if you wish. These prices already include shipping costs.

These items are exclusive to this crowdfunding campaign. While there may be extras of any particular item after your rewards have all been mailed out, they will only be sold in person at conventions, never online. (Do note that the Retail option allows participating retailers to get some of these "exclusive" items - they are backers too! - so they may show up elsewhere after the campaign.)

  • 50€ New Monster by Rafael Chandler and Aeron Alfrey!
    "LotFP doesn't have a bestiary!" I'm sure you've heard that one before. Well... there will be an expanded selection of sample monsters. But this is your chance to expand that even more for everyone! Rafael Chandler and Aeron Alfrey will team up to write up and illustrate a new monster for the Sample Monsters section.

  • 45€ Personalized Olli Hihnala Art!
    Artist Olli Hihnala will do a one-of-a-kind sketch for you inside your copy of the Ref book. (If you are getting both Ref books, the sketch will go inside the limited version.) Your perks would ship later than they otherwise would because of course Hihnala would need time to receive and work through the books to be sketched in.

  • 25€ Commentary!
    When the new Referee book's text is finalized, your choice of Frank Mentzer, Michael Curtis, Kenneth Hite, or Zak S will read through it and offer at least 100 words of commentary/suggestions/advice where they see fit, to be included in the final text of the book. Every Commentary! extra added by a backer means at least 100 more words of commentary, expanding the scope of the book for everyone!

  • 25€ Slipcase
    A nice thick (1.8mm board) full color slipcase designed to hold this Referee hardcover and the Rules & Magic hardcover (which is not included in this campaign, but is available for purchase here), with brand new artwork from Olli Hihnala. This extra includes JUST the slipcase, not any books inside!

    (Hihnala's slipcase art... Summon gone wrong at the auto-da-fé!)

  • 25€ Referee Screen
    (Ryan's Ref screen concept roughs.)
    A large (estimated 21x89cm) three-panel Referee screen on heavy 2.5mm board with full color art by Matthew Ryan on one side, and a load of reference charts - many not in the Rules & Magic or Referee book endpapers, on the other! (Artwork is already underway and we hope/expect to be able to show the final art before the end of the campaign.)

    The screen art:

  • 20€ A2-size (420 × 594mm) print of a God That Crawls visual walkthrough
    Jason Thompson's poster-size visual walkthrough of the LotFP adventure The God that Crawls. The print will be folded twice down to A4 size for shipping. Contact lotfp@lotfp.com if you'd like to arrange shipping in a poster tube.

  • 16€ LotFP T-Shirt with Aeron Alfrey Art
    Black T-shirt with wild Aeron Alfrey artwork! Sizes Ladies' S-XXXL, Mens' S-XXXL. Printed on preshrunk 100% cotton Gildan Heavy Cotton shirts. (Add 3€ for sizes XXL and above.)    (Aeron Alfrey's T-shirt design - we may add a logo to it)


  • 13€ 12-Dice Set
    Opaque red dice with white numbering, perfect for every chart or rule found in the game:
    1x d4
    1x d6 (numbers)
    3x d6 (pips with a Dead Sign in the 1 spot)
    1x d8
    1x d10 (0-9)
    1x d10 (00-90)
    1x d10 (000-900)
    1x d12
    1x d20
    1x d30
    (Gardening Society members get a set of these free if they contribute at Level 3 or more.)

  • 12€ Thulian Echoes Print + PDF / 5€ PDF Only
    "When Titus sacked Jerusalem, it is said that during the chaos an enterprising sorcerer made off with a King's ransom in silver and disappeared to far off Thule. A century later an enterprising party of explorers made a failed bid to reclaim it.  Armed with their notes, are you able to succeed where they failed over a thousand years prior?"

    Zzarchov Kowolski (Lamentations of the Gingerbread Princess, The Gnomes of Levnec, A Thousand Dead Babies) is helping out by letting LotFP release his new adventure. The print version will be exclusive to this campaign. Zzarchov of course gets a cut of every purchase of Thulian Echoes. (This is not a "Stretch Goal Adventure" and is only included if you add this extra to your pledge.)

    (Yannick Bouchard's cover for Thulian Echoes)

  • 10€ LotFP Note Pad
    48 page, A5-sized note pad (with cover artwork by Satine Phoenix!). The book has graph paper on one side of each page spread and hex paper on the other - perfect for your mini One Page Dungeons and Wilderness or general notetaking needs.


    (Satine Phoenix's cover art for the LotFP Note Pad)

Once a goal is reached, backers will receive an email to vote on what the next stretch goal should be. Backers will have 24 hours to respond, and then the results will be announced.

Each € value listed with the stretch goal is the amount of money beyond the previous stretch goal that would be needed to fund it.

Possible stretch goals:

  • + 2500€ Full Color Layout
    The layout will be in full color. (Note this does not mean all illustrations will be in color.)

  • + 2600€ Indexes
    A comprehensive index covering both this new Ref book and the Rules & Magic hardcover will be in this book.

    GOAL REACHED!

  • + 3250€ Developmental Editing
    The Ref book is going to be one part advice and procedures, one part game tools, one part inspiration, plus intro material for new Refs. To help everything flow more smoothly and to help keep a unified tone, Joshua Yearsley (Nova Praxis) will be brought on board with this stretch goal.

    GOAL REACHED!

  • + 2500€ Full Color Section
    An 8-page insert with full color art, similar to the color section that appears in the Rules & Magic book, will be part of the Referee book.

    GOAL REACHED ONCE!

    This goal may be reached multiple times.

  • + 3000€ Module Reprint
    Older, out-of-print adventures need to be reprinted. Reaching this goal will get one of the following adventures reprinted: Tower of the Stargazer, Death Frost Doom, The Grinding Gear, Hammers of the God. The price of the adventure will be added to the LotFP store voucher backers receive, so you get it for just the cost of added shipping if the goal is reached. This goal may be reached 4 times, once for each adventure. Tower of the Stargazer will have to be first because of its "intro" focus (and more beginner and learning material on store shelves is always good), but after that backers will vote on which adventure gets reprinted next after the stretch goal is reached.

    DEATH FROST DOOM REPRINT GOAL HAS BEEN REACHED THANKS TO GENEROUS SPONSORS!

    TOWER OF THE STARGAZER REPRINT HAS BEEN FUNDED!

  • + 350€ Maria Appreciation Fund!
    My wife puts up with a lot of crap to allow LotFP to function, from going without rent for months at a time (while watching thousands of euros come and go for business concerns), the living room being turned into a warehouse for weeks once or twice a year and being littered with packing supplies year-round, the "Leave me alone I'm writing!" shenanigans, "Help me get this load to the post office?", to dealing with the stress of being married to someone running a small business in a very small and weird industry.

    This crowdfunding campaign is not designed to generate profit in and of itself (of course the hope is the Ref book will go on afterwards to be a wildly successful and profitable book!), but if you vote for this stretch goal, Maria gets her share of the rent immediately after the campaign ends, not three months after the Ref book goes to press. This stretch goal can be achieved numerous times, if you're feeling that nice.

    GOAL REACHED ONCE!

Note: Certain estimates about how long the book will be were factored into some of these stretch goal costs and even in estimating the base costs of the book and campaign. Should we not reach the largest possible wordcount, some of these costs will be (much) less than what is listed. But we won't know until after the campaign is over. Which means that when such costs are finalized there is a chance that new stretch goals could be funded long after the campaign has ended just by updating the accounting!

The interface here does not act like a shopping cart... For example, if you choose the Level 3 perk and pay 50€, there is no indication exactly what extra you wanted in addition to the standard edition Ref book.

So after the campaign ends, all backers will receive an email confirming the amount they contributed, to ask them exactly what extras they want. Within days of the campaign ending, everyone should be on the same page with no surprises as to what they will receive and what they will not.

(You are of course free to email lotfp@lotfp.com at the time you back the project and specify where you want the money to go. In fact, if you have any questions at all about the process, leave a message on this campaign's comment page, or email, before spending any money.)

Backers at the appropriate levels will receive a PDF of the current Ref book right after the campaign ends, as well as the current PDFs of any Stretch Goal Adventures that are attained. The Thulian Echoes PDF will be distributed as soon as it is ready (a completed draft is already in hand as the campaign starts).

When the books are ready, they'll go on sale at the LotFP store and you will receive a notification email with your own unique coupon code to use. The coupon code will include the price of your Ref book plus any Stretch Goal adventures. This will be a general one-use coupon and not tied specifically to these items, so if you want to use it for different items in the store, you can. However, placing an order after this time that does not include the Ref book will mean a copy with the bookmark ribbons (and/or alternate cover copy) is no longer reserved for you.

The extras will not be on sale through the LotFP store - they will simply be added to your order. If you just backed for the extras and not the Ref book itself, just say so in response to the notification email and your stuff will be shipped out on its own.

If you're having budget problems at the time the books are made available and can't put in the order for the Ref book right away, let us know when we send the notification email so we can reserve your items.

People with Finnish addresses don't pay shipping through the LotFP store, so the notification email for them will pretty much just mean "update your address if you've moved."

Retail backers will be contacted directly and will not have to deal with the LotFP store at all.

Being honest... a great many crowdfunding campaigns greatly underestimate the time it takes to get the projects together and to the backers and end up being late. LotFP still has some stuff outstanding that's past deadline. Guessing a "real" date seems like a losing proposition.

Because there is no real deadline for the book.

But the Ref book is essential to LotFP as a game and as a business, and the company is basically in neutral gear until it's done. So it's in everyone's interest to get it done in as timely manner as possible. And we will do our best not to drag our butts. But we won't cut corners.

Layout for the Rules & Magic book took longer than expected, but the same template will be used for this book so who knows how that will affect things. We might hit some of the stretch goals that affect the book's content (more art, color layout, developmental editing), and those will add unknown amounts of time to the project. Someone pointed out in the run-up to this campaign that "You mean if 50 people add on commentary by Zak, he's going to write 5000 words?" and if that happens to one (or more...! One can dream...) of the commentators, that might add more time in.

While all of these things add time to the project, they also make the book better. And I hope they happen and will push for them to happen, but at the end of the day the people doing most of this stuff are freelancers who will need to fit this book into their schedules at the time it's ready for them.

So the actual delivery date is "When it's done." That isn't an option to enter into IndieGoGo for a delivery date though, and any reasonable guess is still pretty much blindly throwing darts. So why not January 2019 and poke fun at myself and others who have failed to correctly divine past completion dates?

So... You either want the book, or you don't. You either trust that it'll get done, or you don't.

If you don't want the book or don't trust that it'll get done, then backing this project is a bad idea no matter what date we stamp on it.

If you do want the book and do trust that it'll get done, we've put together some incentives to get you to back now instead of waiting until it's properly released.

It's up to you to decide whether those incentives are effective.

300€  gets you 20 standard Referee books (with the bookmark ribbons) at a 50% discount, shipping included - the standard LotFP direct retail discount at 20 units ordered. You get 2 more standard Ref books for every additional 30€ you pledge. In addition:
  • You may substitute 3 standard Ref books for 2 of the limited edition cover version.
  • You may substitute 4 standard Ref books for 3 of the Slipcases (just the slipcases, no books in them).
  • You may substitute 2 standard Ref books for 3 Rules & Magic hardcovers.
  • You may substitute 4 standard Ref books for 3 Referee Screens.
  • You may substitute 2 standard Ref books for 5 print copies of Thulian Echoes.
  • You may substitute 1 standard Ref book for 2 T-shirts.
  • You may substitute 2 standard Ref books for 5 sets of Dice.

Retail Package backers will also get 1 copy of each Stretch Goal adventure reached for every 5 standard Ref books (or the equivalent) pledged for at no extra charge (including Death Frost Doom!).

Email lotfp@lotfp.com before making your pledge to make sure we're exactly on the same page as far as what you'll be getting.
story_txt:
Notice 1: IndieGoGo requires payment up front when you make your pledge and this cannot be lowered after the fact (and can only be raised by making a new contribution). Be very sure before you hit that payment button.
Notice 2: This campaign is set up very differently than most crowdfunding campaigns. Read the descriptions carefully. If you have any questions, please drop a line to lotfp@lotfp.com or leave a comment at the tab above before laying down your cash.
Notice 3: New last-minute extra! Jason Thompson adventure walkthrough! See the Extras section!





We're doing a new LotFP Ref book to match - if not exceed - the standards of the recently released Rules & Magic book. Hardcover, new layout, expanded content!

Backers get to vote on which stretch goals come next. You decide whether we go for a full color layout, or reprinting adventures, or comprehensive indexing, etc.


Backers can add on extras that make the book better for everyone. Want Frank Mentzer, Kenneth Hite, Zak S, or Michael Curtis to contribute? You want new monsters by Rafael Chandler and Aeron Alfrey to be part of the book? You make it happen!


No matter how much extra material is added, no matter what the final retail price of the book ends up being, your price is locked in once you back the project.


There are a ton of exclusives available, like a Referee screen, a new adventure, and an alternate cover available only to backers of this campaign.

Backers get a copy of the new printing of Death Frost Doom at no additional cost!
Backers get a copy of the new printing of Tower of the Stargazer at no additional cost!
Backers get a copy of a new Michael Curtis mini-adventure in PDF, or in print if contributing 100€ or more to the campaign!

And now for the long version of the campaign text with all the conditions and disclaimers and important detailed information:Lamentations of the Flame Princess is a tabletop RPG company based out of Helsinki Finland, and Weird Fantasy Role-Playing is a horror/fantasy/adventure RPG. It is wildly imaginative and uncompromising (read: explicit content; not for gaming with your kids), with top notch production values, striking art and a heavy metal attitude.
You can download a free version of the core rules without the artwork here and check out the guts of LotFP yourself, and you can download a fully illustrated 180 page LotFP adventure at no charge here.
You can see a gallery of previously published art (and even some art that will be included in the Ref book this campaign is funding!) here. Not safe for work.
You can buy current LotFP releases at the LotFP Webstore. Most of our releases are in the distribution chain, so you can get them at your local store, but the newer books (including the new Rules & Magic) won't go to distribution until the Referee book is printed.
Which is why we're doing the crowdfunding push. Read on...

The previous edition of LotFP (the "Grindhouse Edition") is just about sold out. We're out of copies at the LotFP headquarters, and there are few copies left in distribution. We need the core in print.
The Rules & Magic book (basically the player book) has been printed and is on sale from the LotFP webshop in Finland, but the Ref book has not yet been printed so the new version of the game as a whole cannot yet go into the retail chain where it attracts new fans.
We could go to press right now effectively reprinting the Grindhouse Ref book as a hardcover, but that's not good enough. It needs the professional layout and presentation to match the Rules & Magic book. And it could use some new art, additional editorial input, and all the great things that money can buy but that small publishers have problems financing out of pocket since they're not essential to the production of a book for it to still turn out pretty good.
So we here at LotFP hope you help to finance all of that and make this Ref book one that will both completely bury the previous editions of the book and be impressive enough to attract legions of new fans!

It'll be in hardcover. More durable, more impressive. It will have fresh editing. It will have a professional layout to match the new Rules & Magic book.
It will also have expanded content. LotFP is a living, growing game and so the advice in the book needs to be updated. But it will not replace the old advice, rather it will be presented alongside the previous advice in the book to highlight the fact that there is no one right way to play the game.
It will have a brand new section with tons of crunchy play aids, including a brand new creature generator (specializing in extra-dimensional mockeries of reality) with an expanded roster of sample monsters (but still no official game bestiary!), adventure generators, and all sorts of (hopefully) useful charts and tables to make adventure creation easier that will ensure that you keep this Ref book at hand when preparing your next session.
And of course there is new art, with Jason Rainville, Aeron Alfrey, and Eric Lofgren already having turned in new interior pieces (yes, a good pile of money has already been put into the project, this isn't all being done just on all your backs):
Plus there is a new cover for the Ref book (standard edition) by Malcolm McClinton:
And exclusive to this campaign is the limited edition wraparound cover, by Yannick Bouchard:

We're doing two things differently than traditional crowdfunding campaigns:
First, the Levels 3 - 5 Perks DO NOT INCLUDE SHIPPING COSTS.
What will happen is when the book is ready, you will receive a coupon code for the value of the Ref book (or two), and you will purchase it from the LotFP Webstore, paying the regular shipping costs at that time (and adding whatever other items you wish at the time).
Many crowdfunding campaigns, even ones that are on schedule, either wind up producing larger books than originally planned (which should be a good thing for everyone, right?) or the post office raises their rates between the time the campaign ends and fulfillment begins. It has turned seemingly profitable crowdfunding campaigns into a shipping cost grinder that causes the loss of thousands of dollars.
The estimated weight that this Ref book + Death Frost Doom will be is 575g. Economy shipping for 575g in books would be 7,50€ according to current second-class rates. 1075g for both versions of the Ref book + Death Frost Doom would be 12,50€ to EU addresses and 15,00€ to non-EU addresses for second-class rates. But the book may be bigger. Or smaller. 
But to the customer's advantage here, the extras will be added to those shipments at no added charge. And if we load up on stretch goals increasing the retail price of the book, Perk Levels 3-5 still get you the voucher for the full price based on your backing of the project here.
And then we can just add the value of any additional Stretch Goal Adventures to the voucher, and as each of those books is estimated to weigh about 75g, that would result in a 2,50€ shipping cost increase for non-EU residents if more than one stretch goal adventure is funded.
But again, those are all according to current postage rates, which may change at any time and we don't get much advance notice, and that's why we're not just adding 7,50€ to the cost of the perk levels and calling shipping costs covered.
Second, Extras bought will not automatically count towards stretch goals.Extra bits and stretch goals have also been a frequent financial killer of "successful" crowdfunding campaigns.Publishers want to give you lots of cool stuff and extra tidbits. We really do. But this stuff costs money to produce. If you're running a campaign and you say the stretch goal for the next big improvement to the book is 2000€, and you get there because people bought 200 10€ fiddlydoos, and those fiddlydoos cost 5€ to produce... congratulations, you're on the hook for both the stretch goal improvements and the fiddlydoos, and you're down 1000€ out of pocket.But I still want to offer stretch goals, and I still want to offer fiddlydoos.So here's how we're going to do it.Some of the extras have absolutely fixed costs. These are the Commentary, New Monsters, and Personalized Art extras. Half of each purchased extra will go towards the costs of the extra (paying talent!), the other half will go towards stretch goals.Thulian Echoes will have half of each purchased extra go towards production costs for that adventure (its art budget in particular will be wholly dependent on the money the adventure earns), and half goes towards campaign stretch goals.The other extras (Slipcase, Screen, Shirts, Dice) will not count towards stretch goals at all until their own costs are cleared. At that point all "profit" from each item will go towards general campaign stretch goals. (And the more that are produced, the less each individual unit costs.) Think of it as mini-embedded sub-crowdfunding campaigns. Because while some of those prices allow break-even to come relatively quickly (the dice in particular), those pricey Slipcases and Ref screen are listed pretty much at cost for 100 units. Get them while you can.Now, IndieGoGo is not set up like a shopping cart, so if somebody picks Level 3 (30€ base) with 100€ in extras... I won't know whether that's going towards shirts or slipcases or Commentary or what. You can be helpful and email lotfp@lotfp.com right after pledging to let me know where you want your money allocated, to help us know where we are in relation to stretch goals. Otherwise, this tally won't happen until after the campaign ends... leaving a very good chance that we won't know about what stretch goals will be reached until after the campaign ends!Also, the budget for each extra and all stretch goal amounts assume that IndieGoGo + Paypal will take 10% of all pledges in as fees. That's worst-case scenario, with 8-9% in fees being more typical. After the campaign ends, I will know exactly what percentage has been taken in fees, and adjust the stretch goal costs. So it is possible yet again for stretch goals to be achieved after the campaign ends.This might sound complicated, and it is (you should see the scary database I've set up on my end to keep track of it all), but people who run these campaigns obsessively crunch numbers on their campaigns daily anyway, so might as well publish the numbers...And that's how LotFP is going to attempt to run a fiscally responsible crowdfunding campaign where all the money goes where it's supposed to go and you get the best frickin' book possible and nobody goes broke delivering it. Seems a better solution than inflating stretch goals by guessing what proportion of extras vs. core rewards people will choose.Each of these extra items may be added to your pledge. You may add multiples of each item if you wish. These prices already include shipping costs.These items are exclusive to this crowdfunding campaign. While there may be extras of any particular item after your rewards have all been mailed out, they will only be sold in person at conventions, never online. (Do note that the Retail option allows participating retailers to get some of these "exclusive" items - they are backers too! - so they may show up elsewhere after the campaign.)


50€ New Monster by Rafael Chandler and Aeron Alfrey!"LotFP doesn't have a bestiary!" I'm sure you've heard that one before. Well... there will be an expanded selection of sample monsters. But this is your chance to expand that even more for everyone! Rafael Chandler and Aeron Alfrey will team up to write up and illustrate a new monster for the Sample Monsters section.


45€ Personalized Olli Hihnala Art!Artist Olli Hihnala will do a one-of-a-kind sketch for you inside your copy of the Ref book. (If you are getting both Ref books, the sketch will go inside the limited version.) Your perks would ship later than they otherwise would because of course Hihnala would need time to receive and work through the books to be sketched in.


25€ Commentary!When the new Referee book's text is finalized, your choice of Frank Mentzer, Michael Curtis, Kenneth Hite, or Zak S will read through it and offer at least 100 words of commentary/suggestions/advice 
where they see fit, to be included in the final text of the book. Every Commentary! 
extra added by a backer means at least 100 more words of commentary, expanding the scope of the book for everyone!


25€ SlipcaseA nice thick (1.8mm board) full color slipcase designed to hold this Referee hardcover and the Rules & Magic hardcover (which is not included in this campaign, but is available for purchase here), with brand new artwork from Olli Hihnala. This extra includes JUST the slipcase, not any books inside! (Hihnala's slipcase art... Summon gone wrong at the auto-da-fé!)


25€ Referee Screen(Ryan's Ref screen concept roughs.)A  large (estimated 21x89cm) three-panel Referee screen on heavy 2.5mm board with full color art by Matthew Ryan on one side, and a load of reference charts - many not in the Rules & Magic or Referee book endpapers, on the other! (Artwork is already underway and we hope/expect to be able to show the final art before the end of the campaign.)The screen art:


20€ A2-size (420 × 594mm) print of a God That Crawls visual walkthroughJason Thompson's poster-size visual walkthrough of the LotFP adventure The God that Crawls. The print will be folded twice down to A4 size for shipping. Contact lotfp@lotfp.com if you'd like to arrange shipping in a poster tube.


16€ LotFP T-Shirt with Aeron Alfrey ArtBlack T-shirt with wild Aeron Alfrey artwork! Sizes Ladies' S-XXXL, Mens' 
S-XXXL. Printed on preshrunk 100% cotton Gildan Heavy Cotton shirts. 
(Add 3€ for sizes XXL and above.)(Aeron Alfrey's T-shirt design - we may add a logo to it)








13€ 12-Dice SetOpaque red dice with white numbering, perfect for every chart or rule found in the game:1x d41x d6 (numbers)3x d6 (pips with a Dead Sign in the 1 spot)1x d81x d10 (0-9)1x d10 (00-90)1x d10 (000-900)1x d121x d201x d30(Gardening Society members get a set of these free if they contribute at Level 3 or more.)


12€ Thulian Echoes Print + PDF / 5€ PDF Only"When Titus sacked Jerusalem, it is said that during the chaos an enterprising sorcerer made off with a King's ransom in silver and disappeared to far off Thule. A century later an enterprising party of explorers made a failed bid to reclaim it.  Armed with their notes, are you able to succeed where they failed over a thousand years prior?"Zzarchov Kowolski (Lamentations of the Gingerbread Princess, The Gnomes of Levnec, A Thousand Dead Babies) is helping out by letting LotFP release his new adventure. The print version will be exclusive to this campaign. Zzarchov of course gets a cut of every purchase of Thulian Echoes. (This is not a "Stretch Goal Adventure" and is only included if you add this extra to your pledge.)(Yannick Bouchard's cover for Thulian Echoes)


10€ LotFP Note Pad48 page, A5-sized note pad (with cover artwork by Satine Phoenix!). The book has graph paper on one side of each page spread and hex paper on the other - perfect for your mini One Page Dungeons and Wilderness or general notetaking needs. (Satine Phoenix's cover art for the LotFP Note Pad)


Once a goal is reached, backers will receive an email to vote on what the next stretch goal should be. Backers will have 24 hours to respond, and then the results will be announced.Each € value listed with the stretch goal is the amount of money beyond the previous stretch goal that would be needed to fund it.
Possible stretch goals:


+ 2500€ Full Color LayoutThe layout will be in full color. (Note this does not mean all illustrations will be in color.)

story:
The Inspiration Behind Lenox Takes Flight

“That's a really long flight for a baby.”
“You’ll have to pack so many things! What if they don’t have diapers and baby necessities?”
“What about the hospitals? If he gets sick, you’ll be sorry.”

These were the questions and comments that we got on a daily basis from concerned family and friends who thought we were crazy for deciding to take our then two-month-old to Bangkok, Thailand. Since I love to travel any chance I can, I concocted a plan to make my husband’s international work assignment coincide with my maternity leave to create an epic adventure for our little family. Growing up in the Bronx, I experienced first hand how travel can completely open up ones perspective and provide a type of education that you could never get in a classroom. I knew early on that I’d want to provide the same opportunity for my children, and so I did just that.

My son Lenox was considered an anomaly for many reasons. He was only two months old embarking on a long trip most people don’t take until they are much older, if at all. Most notably, he is a Black boy, and is not represented in typical travel ads. As I scoured the shelves looking for anything that would help prepare him for our journey, I quickly realized that he wasn’t represented in books about travel. While flipping through the pages, one thing became painfully clear: none of the characters ever looked like him. It was important that he see himself as a traveler, and thus my book idea was born.

I am so grateful for the opportunity to fill a gap I saw in literature and write a book for young readers with diverse characters.

 

The Book - Lenox Takes Flight

Lenox is an imaginative kid who loves airplanes and dreams of the day he will get to board one. When his parents announce that the family is taking a trip overseas, he learns that his great grandad was a Tuskegee Airman who earned pilot wings. He cannot wait to board his first flight and get a pair of his own, until the excitement causes him to lose his passport in the airport. He and his little sister, Teagan, slip away from their parents and set out on an adventure to find it before their flight takes off.

This is an early chapter book for middle-grade students that speaks to everyone, but especially parents, educators and children from all backgrounds. Through the incorporation of historical elements like the legendary Tuskegee Airmen, depicting the kids reciting affirmations in the mirror as I do with my children each day, and the sheer excitement of taking their first flight, young readers will be inspired to expand their perspective. This novel will help readers experience the magic of travel, appreciate the unique differences in people and take an adventure through an airport, where all journeys begin.

Ultimately, I hope that Lenox Takes Flight:

  • Normalizes difference for middle grade readers so they understand that difference, is just different!
  • Inspires children of color to find comfort and gain confidence by seeing someone who looks like them represented in travel literature.
  • Helps children understand that travel is something anyone can experience, no matter their age or background.
  • Supports parents, teachers, and caregivers as they continue to foster curiosity and a sense of wonder in children.

I look forward to exploring these topics and beyond with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

‘Iolani L. Bullock is a Bronx native who caught the travel bug at a young age. She has been lucky to have a career that fed her love of travel and desire to experience other cultures as a global recruiter. A diversity, equity and inclusion professional by day and novelist by night, she received her bachelor of arts from New York University and her MBA from Georgetown University. She is a mother of two who believes in the power of normalizing difference and seeing diverse protagonists in children's literature.

For more information, please visit lenoxtakesflight.com and check out @BullocksAbroad on instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Tag #lenoxtakesflight as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media:
    • Instagram - @BullocksAbroad / @newdegreepress
    • Twitter - @iolaniLB / @NewDegreePress

 

Thank you for of all of your love and support. I feel so lucky to have you a part of this journey, and look forward to diversifying characters in children’s literature!

story:
THE DREAM + THE PROMISE / WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

We will make two extraordinary children's books. That's the dream and that's the promise. We cannot do it without you.

NO RISK

If we don't make our all or nothing goal, you will automatically be refunded 100% of your money. But don't count on it, because we're determined to make it and send you our little books instead. 

Tiny, pudgy baby hands signing the American Sign Language Alphabet. Enough said. If your heart just jumped looking at this illustration by Janice Wu for our book with a title too long to be included in our campaign heading, then you'll love what we have up our sleeve. The American Sign Language Hipster Alphabet For Babes - A Coffee Table Book For Young Humans is sure to make you smile out loud. 

And if that doesn't tickle you enough, then we're bringing you Ashley O'Mara's illustrations for our whimsical world of Henri Herald Honey Bee who dreams of being an investigative reporter for the Bee Bee See. Read and watch her break the story on how the polar bears do it on floating ice (hopefully well into our planet's future), the bats do it upside down and the whales do it under water. This milky tale may make you lactate, at least if you're still nursing. like me. 

THE HEAD LOON

Hello, I'm Linnie von Sky and we may have met before. If we did, I probably sprung a conversation on you while nursing my little lady and made you tell me much more about what floats your boat than you ever thought you'd share and then got so excited about it that I couldn't stop myself from spreading the word about your talent to my tribe.  I'm a guerrilla networker, story teller, author, relentless dream catcher, mama and wife. Bred in Berlin, I live deeply rooted in my Vancouver community. 

In 2012 I wrote a story on three Air Canada barf bags and the rest is history. My little indie publishing house is called Silk Web Publishing, because we elegantly weave webs of talented individuals who put their hearts together to make publishing dreams fly. THANKS to YOU, OUR CROWD, we have successfully published three extrodinary (if I may say so myself) children's books on Immigration, Bullying and Depression. Take a stroll through our Indiegogo campaign history here, here and here and see for yourself.

Now we're making Books IV + V and I'm once again willing to risk a very public belly flop, knowing in my soul that the talent of those up on the dive board with me and THE POWER OF THE CROWD behind us will turn this into a swan dive. 

* screenshot of our Sadly The Owl and that time Montecristo Mag interviewed me and gave us street cred (insert two hands framing wow emoji)

THE COLLABORATORS AND ART MAGICIANS

Let me introduce you to some of the most talented and sparkling human beings I have the privilege to work with and call friends. 

ASHLEY O'MARA (click to open a magic window to pet portrait heaven)

Illustrator, Designer, Animal Lover. Ash is the illustrator of our Sadly The Owl (2015). She also illustrates pet portraits.

I can't wait for this chicken loving queen of the brush to illustrate The Birds And The Bees Don't Do It. I love this woman's brain and strokes and I can't wait for her to surprise us with details that live between the lines of my stories that are yet to be imagined. 

Norm the Pug thinks you should buy our books. (c) by Ashley O'Mara

JANICE WU (click to open a window into a world of illustration that you will blow your art loving mind)

Illustrator. Talent to the core. Out of my league. 

Janice is currently perfecting the art of illustrating pudgy ABC signing baby hands that make your heart melt for The American Sign Language Hipster Alphabet For Babes A Coffee Table Book For Young Humans. I think she succeeded. I'm so grateful to have landed her as the illustrator for my new future favourite coffee table book. 

Here is how Janice gets you to feel emotional about a plastic bag. This stunning illustration makes me weep.

(c) Janice Wu “Kiu Shum”, 2014,  18″ x 24″, pencil and gouache on paper. 

LEE ANN STEYNS (click to learn to speak with babies w/o moving your lips)

Lee Ann is the queen bee of signing babies. If you have a baby in Vancouver, you've hopefully met this bright light of a life saver. Now that Ella can sign 'milk please' she's no longer clawing my clothes for self service boob breaks. Thanks to Lee Ann, minimal levels of civility have re-entered our home, but then again...Ella's going on two. Enough said. 

It's such a gift to have this incredible mama on a signing mission be involved in our American Sign Language Hipster Alphabet For Babes and we found her the perfect title: American Sign Language Alphabet Consultant. Lee Ann consults with good vibes, an infectious laugh and hands that gracefully communicate on mute. 

*Lift flat hand to mouth with palm facing toward face and fingertips touching lips and then bow hand toward recipient. 

Hopefully she'll stay tuned for our upcoming project The American Sign Language Baby Survival Guide to the Universe. (life's not life if you don't have your dream after the dream lined up)

Lee Ann signing the letter B for BELIEVE (and we believe in our crowd).

THE BEAN COUNTING MUMBO JUMBO BEHIND THIS DREAM 

Insert an Abacus and a whole lot more money than I've ever seen or can imagine. FOURTYTHOUSANDOLLARSCANADIAN. That's the magic sum that will allow me to pay everyone involved. Illustrators, editors (namely one...the incredible Taisha who has stuck by my side through more than one book), book designers, art digitalizers (shout out to Ted at Image This Photographics Inc who has worked on every one of my books and saved our publishing butt more than once with his experience from his former life as an Emily Carr Professor) and of course the printer folks. We're outsourcing no part of this and are so proud to pay all fine humans involved, fair wages. 

THE TIMELINE

How about Easter 2018? Sound fair? We have finished every project within its promised delivery window of a year and apart from the odd package being returned by Canada Post, we have yet to hear that any of our previous books were not delivered. We hope we found you all in the end. 

NOTICE: pipe up NOW if you're still out there sitting on your stoop waiting on any of our previous books, because we don't know we didn't find you and we'd like to make it right. We're not in the business of cheating those who help us make our dreams come true.

YOU CAN ALSO HELP US...

by spreading the sweet dream nectar to your tribe via instagram, facebook, twitter, email or good old fashioned carrier piegeon. 

On behalf of the entire team I THANK YOU from the bottom of our hopelessly, artistic little big hearts. 

Warmly and sincerely, 

Linnie von Sky 

Chief Instigator of Publishing Dreams at Silk Web Publishing

BIG SHOUTOUTS and GRATITUDE HUGS

Top of the list LUIS of @WHENTHEYFINDUS who captured the most incredible video for our campaign. Your lens and your perspective is a gift and we feel so lucky that you played with us. THANK YOU! You're a STAR. 

Jess of @CHORUSANDCLOUDS. Early childhood educator, musician, friend. An overall good human in the kind of ways that they don't make anymore. Though I hope for the sake of our world that they do. I love you and I thank you for opening your heart and your little shop for us and mesmerized us with your fairy voice and uke. 

THANK YOU ALSO TO THE MANY BEAUTIFUL PLACES WE CANNOT DO WITHOUT 

(in the order of how we visited you while shooting the video)

Le Marche St George

Liberty Cafe

Collage Collage

Juice Truck

Atelier 7e7

The Wildbunch Studio

Chorus and Clouds

The Birds and The Beets

ps oh oh our one perk delivery date is off by one year. The Whole Beehive is due for delivery in 05/2018 not 05/2017. We cannot edit the boo boo because the perk has been claimed, but we are currently communication with the IndieGoGo folks to have this fixed...soooo sorry.

story:
The Story of Implants

Implants follows a diverse group of college students who travel to Sweden and shortly after begin facing inexplicable experiences that set them on a mission to make it back home. The four students accepted into The School of International Relations face unique challenges the week before their Fall semester, a semester that never begins.

In this futuristic society, everyone relies on hand microchips for basic activities such as opening doors and making purchases. At one point, the students suspect that their strange experiences are related to these microchips. However, their struggles began before they got implanted. After witnessing the loss of one of their fellow students, the remaining classmates are determined to escape from the experimental program they have become a part of, only to face increasingly precarious barriers as they discover their fate.

My name is Amari Rae Pulido (they/them/theirs), and I am the author of Implants. I wrote this book because I love reading, and it has been my dream to write a story that people enjoy since the age of six. I hope that this book will encourage readers to think critically about the consequences of technological advancements. Implants takes readers on a multi-perspective journey that questions the figures we trust and how we perceive our realities through an intersectional lens.

The main characters are four study abroad students who travel to attend The School of International Relations in Sweden. Within the first week leading up to the start of classes, they learn more about each other and their program directors through conversations and excursions in the country. During one of these excursions, a student tells his classmates something strange has happened to him that they don’t believe. That is, until strange things begin happening to them, too.

After losing a classmate, the students question who they can trust while struggling to control themselves against external and seemingly internal factors. They seek help to leave the experiment they have unwillingly joined, but not all of the students or their program directors turn out to be helpful.

You will love this book if you enjoy science fiction, dystopian stories, psychological thrillers, mysteries, Ray Bradbury, or series like Black Mirror and Stranger Things. Implants speaks to adults and students everywhere who want to grapple with futuristic technology and intersectional journeys in a new way.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling before publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish, and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

About the Author

Amari Rae Pulido (they/them/theirs) is a Sakura Scholar at American University studying Global International Relations. They care deeply about creative expression, human rights, animal welfare, and international development. Amari wrote Implants after reading artificial intelligence articles on the current development of microchips in animals, including humans. This information ignited several imaginative scenarios that they found simultaneously admirable and frightening.

Implants is a warning of the dystopia we may be nearing, intertwined with underlying sociopolitical issues to resolve. They have been writing songs, poems, short stories, and mini screenplays since primary school. Besides writing, they are also passionate about fashion, travel, and intercultural communication.

For more information, you can connect with Amari

via email at amariraepulido@gmail.com

on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/amariraepulido/

and on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/amariraepulido/

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form https://rb.gy/xl7mfj to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

 

Please use #IMPLANTS and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
