story_txt:
The Story of Implants
Implants follows a diverse group of college students who travel to Sweden and shortly after begin facing inexplicable experiences that set them on a mission to make it back home. The four students accepted into The School of International Relations face unique challenges the week before their Fall semester, a semester that never begins.
In this futuristic society, everyone relies on hand microchips for basic activities such as opening doors and making purchases. At one point, the students suspect that their strange experiences are related to these microchips. However, their struggles began before they got implanted. After witnessing the loss of one of their fellow students, the remaining classmates are determined to escape from the experimental program they have become a part of, only to face increasingly precarious barriers as they discover their fate.
My name is Amari Rae Pulido (they/them/theirs), and I am the author of Implants. I wrote this book because I love reading, and it has been my dream to write a story that people enjoy since the age of six. I hope that this book will encourage readers to think critically about the consequences of technological advancements. Implants takes readers on a multi-perspective journey that questions the figures we trust and how we perceive our realities through an intersectional lens.
The main characters are four study abroad students who travel to attend The School of International Relations in Sweden. Within the first week leading up to the start of classes, they learn more about each other and their program directors through conversations and excursions in the country. During one of these excursions, a student tells his classmates something strange has happened to him that they don’t believe. That is, until strange things begin happening to them, too.
After losing a classmate, the students question who they can trust while struggling to control themselves against external and seemingly internal factors. They seek help to leave the experiment they have unwillingly joined, but not all of the students or their program directors turn out to be helpful.
You will love this book if you enjoy science fiction, dystopian stories, psychological thrillers, mysteries, Ray Bradbury, or series like Black Mirror and Stranger Things. Implants speaks to adults and students everywhere who want to grapple with futuristic technology and intersectional journeys in a new way.
 

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:


The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling before publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

 
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish, and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

About the Author
Amari Rae Pulido (they/them/theirs) is a Sakura Scholar at American University studying Global International Relations. They care deeply about creative expression, human rights, animal welfare, and international development. Amari wrote Implants after reading artificial intelligence articles on the current development of microchips in animals, including humans. This information ignited several imaginative scenarios that they found simultaneously admirable and frightening.
Implants is a warning of the dystopia we may be nearing, intertwined with underlying sociopolitical issues to resolve. They have been writing songs, poems, short stories, and mini screenplays since primary school. Besides writing, they are also passionate about fashion, travel, and intercultural communication.For more information, you can connect with Amari
via email at amariraepulido@gmail.com
on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/amariraepulido/
and on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/amariraepulido/

story:
The Story of Aether Wuld

You don’t hear about the grief, the failings, the pressure that heroes go through, and that’s because heroes don’t exist, not in our world and not in Aether Wuld. Just people.

My name is Marlon Rodriguez. I wrote Aether Wuld to provide my readers with a realistic protagonist. I was tired of reading stories where the hero overcomes their obstacles with ease; where they are unfazed by the challenges they’re met with.
Frankly, these kinds of people don’t exist.
Everyone has their demons: trauma, grievances, mistakes. Some are able to face these challenges and move forward. Some cannot, and there’s nothing wrong with that. Eita’s Kihn, a city in the southwest of Aether Wuld’s single continent, Maan Kaal, is meant to be a haven for this latter group, for people that do not want to worry about the hardships of their reality. In Eita’s Kihn, they could be themselves and be protected from all the dangers of life.
Pain is necessary to live, but that doesn’t mean we have to roll over and just let it happen.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll discover the beauty of living. Life has more hardships than I can count and sometimes all you can see is red, but if you know where to look, you’ll be able to see rainbows. The world I created is cruel and unforgiving, but Ymir and her loved ones established Eita’s Kihn to be a safe haven. I welcome you to follow along and witness all that she’s willing to do and has endured to keep our promises.


Our story takes place in the titular Aether Wuld, on the Pangaean continent of Maan Kaal. To the southwest, Ymir the four-armed giant and her friends search for their lost companions Roe and Marin. Little do they know it’s a race against time because they’re not the only ones searching: Arcvadasz, the High Spirit of Death, is also on the hunt.

In addition to Arcvadasz and his followers, Ymir and her friends need to watch out for the Anihu. Thousands of years ago they used to be humans, but have long since diverged into the depths of beasthood. Some retained their wits and humanity and went on to establish their own kingdom known as the Anih Kihn. Others lost themselves to their primal rage and become nothing more than mindless beasts that ravage everything in their path. But the Anihu are just one type of creature they need to evade.

Another is the Sötalo, who originally ripped their way into the world from a separate reality where their entire existence depended on their ability to slaughter and reproduce. For better or for worse, they continuously adapt through evolution to their ever-changing environment. The Sömek, even more scarce than their ancestors, have managed to integrate into the present societies through various means.

You will love this book if you want to read about epic and terrifying creatures, the true effects ‘heroism’ has on an individual, or if you’re like me and try to read into what’s really behind the pages.


Aether Wuld speaks to the determined and the tired who want to experience the realities we share, from the other side of the coin.

Ultimately, I hope that Aether Wuld inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How much, is too much?
  • How much do you really know about the people you care about?
  • Are you willing to be a part of change when it presents itself?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

A Blurb From the Book

Atop the tower Ymir, the giantess, holds the handle of her bow with her two right arms, and draws the full length of the string with her other two. She exhales slowly, and in tempo with her heartbeat, looses the arrow with a deep twang from the bow.
          One, silence fills the air as she watches the enemy advance into her home.
          Two, she watches an overconfident fool revel in his unknowing last moments.
          Three, she closes her eyes as the arrow releases a thunderous explosion in the sky on its way to its mark.
She offers a final warning to the intruders but is met with a lust for death. Ymir draws another arrow before mumbling to herself, “I gave you all an out.” One after another, she looses arrows as a storm rages through the clear skies. She watches as the sturdy formation of the zealots crumbles into chaos. As they trip over each other she feels a weight on her heart but remains stalwart, feeding the storm.
 

About the Author

Marlon Rodriguez is a first-time author and son who can now brag about being the first author in his family.
He wrote this book to be a safe haven for the weary as well as a means to explore the realities we live in.
He’s also someone who spends way too much time in his own head, running unlikely and near-impossible scenarios through it at any given moment. Marlon has a tendency to overthink any and everything, including compliments.

For more information, you can connect with Marlon at aether.wuld.journals@gmail.com and @a.w.journals on Instagram and Facebook.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #awjournals and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instragram - @a.w.journals / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @a.w.journals / @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @awjournals / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Marlon

story:
Edit 27 January 2020: I will be closing this campaign and submitting the book order on Friday, 31 January. If you would like to order, please do so by this Thursday.

(You have to click each perk to view the description. I don't know why.)

Summary

My name is Michael Chidester. I started HEMA in 2001, and for the past ten years, I've been leading a project called Wiktenauer. Wiktenauer grew out of a desire to set the text of our fencing manuals free from the page and put it into the hands of fencers. What I'd like to do with this project is slightly different: put the page, and the whole book, into your hands as well. We're going to produce a facsimile of one of the most beautiful 15th century fencing manuals, the København Talhoffer manuscript.

Facsimile is a word that's thrown around a lot, and means different things to different people. What I mean when I use it is a careful reproduction of the entire physical book in detail. Such facsimiles are often produced of famous manuscripts and early printed books for collectors, and they are also exhibited by museums and libraries in cases where the original can't or shouldn't be displayed.


Comparing the New Haven Gladiatoria manuscript to the Orbis Pictus facsimile of the Kraków version.

I have had the privilege in my day of handling several 15th and 16th century fencing manuscripts, as well as copies of most of the printed fencing manuals published before 1600, and I wish everyone in HEMA could have that same chance. It's a way of connecting to history that's hard to describe. A good facsimile can capture at least a small piece of that magic, and give you a sense of what the origin of our fencing reconstruction really is.


The Extraordinary Editions facsimile of Royal Armouries ms. I.33 (now FECHT 1).

There are many treatises worthy of this sort of project, but to date only two have received it: the Gladiatoria manuscript held by the Biblioteka Jagiellońska in Kraków, Poland, and Walpurgis Fechtbuch, held by the Royal Armouries in Leeds, UK. I would love to produce many more of these, but to start with, I've selected a manuscript written by the famous master Hans Talhoffer and held by Det Kongelige Bibliotek in København, Denmark, the Thott 290 2º.

This manuscript is lavishly illustrated and contains not only the fencing teachings of Johannes Liechtenauer and Hans Talhoffer, but also a German translation of Konrad Kyeser's famous war book Bellifortis, and various esoteric teachings on subjects such as astronomy and physiology. You can learn more about this fascinating text in the National Geographic special Medieval Fightbook.

Should this campaign succeed, then many more such facsimiles may follow in the coming years. (I'd love to do a copy of Fiore next.)

What We Need & What You Get

Facsimiles like this are usually quite expensive. For example, the Orbis Pictus Gladiatoria cost ~$900, while the Extraordinary Editions I.33 was released in two different editions, costing ~$1,000 and $2,000. Other facsimiles can cost into the five figure range.

One of my objectives in this project is to see how inexpensively such a book can be produced. I've selected Grimm Book Bindery in Madison, WI, to do the printing and binding, and spent quite a bit of time discussing the project with them and ironing out every detail to be as precise as possible. We can't source the metal corner protectors and clasp while keeping costs low (the best price I could find for the type used in this period would add hundreds of dollars to the price), but everything else down to the blind tooling on the cover will be as close as we can make it using modern methods.

To do this, we need a minimum of 100 orders, so I have set the funding goal accordingly. I had originally hoped to offer each one for $100, but after tallying the costs up, $150 seems to be the lowest feasible price point.

This price depends on volume, so it will be a one-and-done print run, and people who don't order now will not have a chance again (unless we can scrape together another 100 orders). If we can get up to 250 orders, then some additional enhancements might become feasibly (more on that as we go).

But wait, there's more!

When I discussed this on the Wiktenauer page this summer, some people asked for a translation to go along with the facsimile. Unfortunately, the only complete translation that currently exists was authored by Jeffrey Hull, and I have been unable to contact him for permission to use it.

What I offer instead is a companion volume containing research and discussion of this manuscript by some of the best researchers in HEMA, both academics and auto-didacts, including Dr. Ariella Elema, Dr. Daniel Jaquet, Jens P. Kleinau, Christian Tobler, and Christian Trosclair.  Each of their papers will discuss a specific subject or aspect of the manuscript, and I will also contribute material to round out the book.

More on the contents of this book will be laid out as the campaign progresses.

(If you would like to have a print translation to go along with it, you can always just take the original document that Jeff produced and send it to a POD outfit like Lulu.)

Risks & Challenges

I've never put together a project like this before, and neither has Grimm Bindery. It's possible that there will be problems along the way that we didn't anticipate, despite all of our discussion. We will produce the best book possible, and I will have a chance to make adjustments when a sample book is delivered, but there may be some aspects of the original manuscript that either aren't clear from the scans or can't be mass-produced, and those defects may not be correctable.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this project, please spread the word anyway. I have no doubt that there are 100 people who would love to own this book, but I may not be able to find them all myself.

Please share this campaign with your clubs, with your friends, and on social media!

There are many treatises worthy of this sort of project, but to date only two have received it: the Gladiatoria manuscript held by the Biblioteka Jagiellońska in Kraków, Poland, and Walpurgis Fechtbuch, held by the Royal Armouries in Leeds, UK. I would love to produce many more of these, but to start with, I've selected a manuscript written by the famous master Hans Talhoffer and held by Det Kongelige Bibliotek in København, Denmark, the Thott 290 2º.
This manuscript is lavishly illustrated and contains not only the fencing teachings of Johannes Liechtenauer and Hans Talhoffer, but also a German translation of Konrad Kyeser's famous war book Bellifortis, and various esoteric teachings on subjects such as astronomy and physiology. You can learn more about this fascinating text in the National Geographic special Medieval Fightbook.
Should this campaign succeed, then many more such facsimiles may follow in the coming years. (I'd love to do a copy of Fiore next.)

What We Need & What You Get
Facsimiles like this are usually quite expensive. For example, the Orbis Pictus Gladiatoria cost ~$900, while the Extraordinary Editions I.33 was released in two different editions, costing ~$1,000 and $2,000. Other facsimiles can cost into the five figure range.
One of my objectives in this project is to see how inexpensively such a book can be produced. I've selected Grimm Book Bindery in Madison, WI, to do the printing and binding, and spent quite a bit of time discussing the project with them and ironing out every detail to be as precise as possible. We can't source the metal corner protectors and clasp while keeping costs low (the best price I could find for the type used in this period would add hundreds of dollars to the price), but everything else down to the blind tooling on the cover will be as close as we can make it using modern methods.

To do this, we need a minimum of 100 orders, so I have set the funding goal accordingly. I had originally hoped to offer each one for $100, but after tallying the costs up, $150 seems to be the lowest feasible price point.
This price depends on volume, so it will be a one-and-done print run, and people who don't order now will not have a chance again (unless we can scrape together another 100 orders). If we can get up to 250 orders, then some additional enhancements might become feasibly (more on that as we go).

But wait, there's more!
When I discussed this on the Wiktenauer page this summer, some people asked for a translation to go along with the facsimile. Unfortunately, the only complete translation that currently exists was authored by Jeffrey Hull, and I have been unable to contact him for permission to use it.
What I offer instead is a companion volume containing research and discussion of this manuscript by some of the best researchers in HEMA, both academics and auto-didacts, including Dr. Ariella Elema, Dr. Daniel Jaquet, Jens P. Kleinau, Christian Tobler, and Christian Trosclair.  Each of their papers will discuss a specific subject or aspect of the manuscript, and I will also contribute material to round out the book.
More on the contents of this book will be laid out as the campaign progresses.
(If you would like to have a print translation to go along with it, you can always just take the original document that Jeff produced and send it to a POD outfit like Lulu.)


Risks & Challenges
I've never put together a project like this before, and neither has Grimm Bindery. It's possible that there will be problems along the way that we didn't anticipate, despite all of our discussion. We will produce the best book possible, and I will have a chance to make adjustments when a sample book is delivered, but there may be some aspects of the original manuscript that either aren't clear from the scans or can't be mass-produced, and those defects may not be correctable.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to this project, please spread the word anyway. I have no doubt that there are 100 people who would love to own this book, but I may not be able to find them all myself.
Please share this campaign with your clubs, with your friends, and on social media!

story:
Carnation Books is an independent publisher.

We work exclusively with fanfiction authors to publish original works of fiction that feature LGBTQIA+ romance.

We started Carnation Books because we love fandom.

We believe that fanfiction writers are the hardest-working, most talented writers on Earth, and we want to help them share their work with readers outside of fandom.

The Queer Adventures of Sherlock Holmes

will be our first Sherlock Holmes collection, and will feature the work of well known fanfiction authors who for years have been expressing their adoration for this timeless character through transformative works. We are proud to bring some of their best stories to you in the form of a curated collection of queer romance offering a variety of genres. 

The nine authors featured in this collection include: 

Elyssa Warkentin (Tumblr: doctornerdington, @doctornerdingt1, AO3: doctornerdington, author of A Land So Wild) 

Berlynn Wohl  (Tumblr: berlynn-wohl, @berlynnwohl, AO3: berlynn_wohl, author of Oh, Earthman! and Dreams and Machines) 

Evadare Volney (Tumblr: vulgarweed, @vulgarweed, AO3: vulgarweed)

Morgan Wilde (@morgnwilde)

Merinda Brayfield (Tumblr: merindab , @merindab, AO3: Janto321)

Sarah Northrip (Tumblr: mamafaeriesunshine)

Shai Porter (Tumblr: iwantthatbelstaffanditsoccupant, @Iwantthatcoat, AO3: Iwantthatcoat)

Marta Layton (Livejournal: marta-bee, AO3: Marta)

M.A. Khoury

The talented Max Kennedy (@maxkennedy24), a longtime fanartist and lover of Sherlock Holmes, will provide gorgeous, one-of-a-kind art for the cover of this anthology.

story:
"Mike has helped tens of thousands of entrepreneurs not get screwed by lazy bum co-founders. I am SO excited for this book and can’t wait to have him share this with our entrepreneurs! Congrats and thanks Mike!"

-Dr Susan Amat, Founder, Startup Hive  Support Level: Superfan

 

Story of My Book

Will Work for Pie is a guide to how early-stage bootstrapped companies can use equity, instead of cash, to grow their business and get funded. Equity can be a powerful tool to attract resources and talent to your startup, but dividing it up improperly can cause irreversible damage to the team and derail an otherwise promising company. Will Work for Pie shows how to apply the logic of Slicing Pie — a model for equity splits that has been used by thousands of startups all over the world — to create a perfectly fair equity split.

My name is Mike Moyer and I am the author of Will Work for Pie. I wrote this book because conventional wisdom and advice regarding startup equity splits is just plain wrong and following it will virtually guarantee your team will wind up in an equity dispute that could ruin your working relationships and possibly your company.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that it’s easy to be perfectly fair with your partners, employees, and other participants in your startup. There’s nothing quite like building a startup company with a passionate, collaborative team; and making sure each member gets treated fairly should be a top priority.

In this book, you'll learn what fairness looks like in a startup and how to achieve it including:
  • How the Slicing Pie model works and why it always creates a fair split
  • What motivates employees and teams and how to build an effective incentive program
  • How to determine the fair market value of just about anything your company needs

You will love this book if you have ever been involved in, or are thinking about getting involved in a new startup company. Few books offer such clear, concrete, actionable advice. Even if you are already familiar with the Slicing Pie model, this book will expand on the concept and show how it’s applied to different situations.

Will Work for Pie is a non-fiction book that speaks to startup founders and early participants who are looking at building a team to start a company for the first time or seasoned entrepreneurs who may be wary of equity splits after a bad experience (or two).

Just contributed to this campaign. Mike Moyer has a been an inspiration and a mentor to me as well as many other businesses in Chicago. This follow-up book will really help folks in the startup space define and manage to a smart and fair equity model. Look forward to reading and learning.

-John Geletka, Founder, GELETKA +  Support Level: Beta Reader

 

 

The Book - Will Work for Pie


The book is written in three parts....

Part 1 is an overview of the Slicing Pie model and how it helps companies avoid common equity-splitting mistakes.

Part 2 explains how to motivate employees using a structured incentive program that aligns everyone’s incentives.

Part 3 goes into detail about special situations and scenarios that create compensation challenges and how to solve them.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, signed thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Mike Moyer is a career entrepreneur who has started and run companies in a variety of industries ranging from clothing manufacturing to marketing technology. He developed his expertise in the creation of fair equity splits after a series of really stupid startup mistakes that he won’t make again (and neither will you!)

Today, he runs Slicing Pie, a SaaS company that helps startup founders create perfectly fair equity splits, and MosquitOasis that makes pop-up mosquito net tents for kids.

He teaches entrepreneurship at Northwestern University and has held other faculty appointments at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and MIT.

He has written eight books with a focus on business and entrepreneurship including The Slicing Pie Handbook which has been translated into nine languages and read by founders all over the world.

For more information you can connect with Mike at mike@slicingpie.com.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WillWorkforPie and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mike

story:
Short Summary

The Abuse Algorithm shares the untold stories of child sexual abuse survivors, explores how Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) impact our lives, and how this all-too-common, widespread issue is a treatable, preventable public health crisis.

My name is Shavontana “Starr” Davis and I am the author of The Abuse Algorithm. I wrote this book to make good on a promise I made as a child: to help girls like me. As an adult, that vow extends to all youth, girls and boys, heterosexual, LGBTQ+, nonbinary, those who’ve been abused, and those who have not. 

You’ll read actual experiences from women and men around the world who have never met but are connected by this issue. You’ll also gain insight from healthcare professionals who work with abuse victims.  

Sexual abuse is among the most serious issues that children and youth face. The thought of it is terrifying to parents and caring adults. Addressing the problem directly and responsibly is necessary to foster appropriate awareness and prevention of this difficult topic. 

If a conversation is hard, it's probably the one worth having. Treat this book as a resource guide. Read it from cover to cover with the understanding that it is an uncomfortable read. As you read The Abuse Algorithm: 

1. Carefully consider the difficult topics that will be discussed; 

2. Continue your education and meaningful dialogue;

3. Pledge to utilize this tool to become a trusted adult who will listen to young people, understand their needs, and meet them where they are.

I believe as we make awareness and prevention a priority, and not just a reactionary response to an outcry, then we will be in a better position to protect our children and youth from child sexual abuse and exploitation.  

I hope this book sparks change so that young people can avoid abuse, not recover from it. It's intended for parents, caring adults, and professionals entrusted with the care of young people who are committed to improving the health, wellbeing, and quality of life of children, families, and communities.

We invite you to join the movement to protect our young people. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 220 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook!  A portion of the profits over the $6000 goal will be DONATED to The Starr Institute, Inc. Your support helps young people thrive.  

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author 

Shavontana “Starr” Davis lives by the words "I am not my past, I am my future." Starr is a wife, a mother, attorney, youth advocate, and survivor. As a survivor of childhood sexual abuse, Starr experienced and witnessed things no child should. A thriving and compassionate woman, she has taken her experiences and founded The Starr Institute, Inc., a nonprofit organization. 

Starr has authored curricula and trained youth, the community, and professionals on the indicators of child sexual exploitation. Starr also serves as a keynote speaker addressing such topics as overcoming adversity, living with a drug-addicted parent, and transitioning into entrepreneurship with a husband and two small children.

Starr left the traditional practice of law to pursue her purpose of creating a world where all youth receive the care, support, and skills they need to thrive. Starr turned her pain into purpose. 

When she's not working, you'll likely find her spending time with her family at the beach or park, working out, or encouraging her loved ones. Starr resides in Miami, Florida with her husband Devin and son and daughter, David and Parker. 

For more information, you can connect with Starr Davis and The Starr Institute at sdavis@thestarrinstitute.org 

Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000171... 
https://www.facebook.com/TheStarrInstitute

LinkedIn:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/shavontana-starr-da...

Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/thestarrinstitute_/
https://www.instagram.com/mysafetystartswithmeb...

 

International Preorders 

  • For international preorders, please send me a private message at sdavis@thestarrinstitute.org.  

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help spread the word! 

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on your Facebook (@shavontana starr), Instagram and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theabusealgorithm2021 #abusehacker and tag me as well as my publisher, @New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts. 
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 7 friends, family members or co-workers who you think would benefit from it via text or direct message on social media. 

Thank you so much for your love and support! 

The Abuse Hacker, 
Shavontana “Starr” Davis

Please share my pre-sale campaign on your Facebook (@shavontana starr), Instagram and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theabusealgorithm2021 #abusehacker and tag me as well as my publisher, @New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts. 
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 7 friends, family members or co-workers who you think would benefit from it via text or direct message on social media. 

Thank you so much for your love and support! The Abuse Hacker, Shavontana “Starr” Davis

story:
Short Summary

What would you do if you discovered your mother gave you up for adoption to a wise and loving, Christian woman who happened to be married to a pedophile? What would you do with this truth as you also navigate the Jim Crow South as a young, black woman?

My name is Acasia Olson, and I am the author of The Book of Jo. The Book of Jo is my grandmother’s story and essentially a love letter to my Granny. I wrote this book because I became a mom 2.5 years ago and wanted to explore and unpack motherhood as it was passed down to me. I wanted to understand why and how my mom raised me the way she did, and the best place to start was with her mother, my Granny. But as I sat with my grandmother’s story and what she endured and overcame, I knew I wanted to honor her and all senior survivors of childhood sexual abuse by writing her story.

A Catch 22!

Jo is a precocious little girl who was adopted into the loving arms of Rosa, a God-fearing, older Black woman who can’t have children of her own. But Jo lives with the world of grand opposites. While her mother loves her sacrificially and unconditionally her dad commits horrible acts to her. Jo, who lives in Birmingham Alabama’s Jim Crow Era, must navigate the world of misogyny, racism and sexual abuse all while piecing together her identity and belonging.


Jo comes of age and becomes a young mother at the dawn of the Civil Rights Era in Birmingham, Alabama. Will she draw from the love and wisdom of her mother or crash under the waves of the pain and trauma that shape her world?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will sit with your own generational stories. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for women and mothers and, specifically, Black women who endured and raised children under exceedingly traumatic circumstances. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you tap into compassion and courage to heal any direct or intergenerational wounds that you have noticed in yourself and your own families.

In this book, you'll learn about Black Motherhood in the Jim Crow South and the effects of transgenerational trauma on parenting. You'll hear stories such as:

  • The story of my Granny’s mom, who adopted and raised her as her own flesh and blood.
  • The story of “Pandora’s Box,” a piece of furniture that hid an earth-shattering secret.
  • The story of how my Granny bypassed a 5-year waiting list to become a nurse after dropping out of high school.
You will love this book if you are a mother or celebrate motherhood, miss sitting at your grandmother’s feet and listening to her stories, have southern roots, and/or can appreciate the sweet little phrases and colloquialisms found within Southern dialects.

The Book of Jo is a nonfiction book that speaks to families and women who want to look at motherhood, resilience, and healing from generational trauma in a new way.
 

The Book - The Book of Jo

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 - Chapters 1 - 14 focus on Jo’s childhood, her adoption story, and her upbringing in a culture of sexual abuse and racial trauma.

Part 2 - Chapters 15 - 20 chronicle Jo’s journey into motherhood and marriage. We learn what she felt and knew about motherhood from her own upbringing as well as how she navigated love given her only example of fatherhood and husband in her dad.

Part 3 - The final few chapters detail Jo’s return to herself after faces a few reality checks. We learn about Jo as a working mom and, specifically, what she did to earn her LPN despite dropping out of high school when she became pregnant with her first child.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August - October 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
    • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
    • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
    • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
    • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my final cover and title.
    • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

  • Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
  • Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
  • Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
  • TIER 4: Anything beyond Tier 3 allows me to translate this book into other languages and opens doors for additional, great opportunities to spread the messages within these pages.

The Author

Acasia Olson is on track to be the world’s most interesting woman by the age of 60. A military kid turned military spouse, now raising her own Navy babies, Acasia has lived in and visited over 22 countries and is on track to add another to her travel maven portfolio by the end of the year. In her past lives, she worked as a public health professional in the non-profit and government sectors, managed a federal budget, and served as an educational consultant for a children’s ministry overseas. When she’s not writing books and traveling the world, she’s busy trying to figure out how to take milestone pictures of her girls, Lavender and Laurel, who look more like blurs than humans on her camera phone.

Acasia has always had a book in her hand, as if it were her security blanket. A little bookworm out of the womb, Acasia has written all manner of things, some of which are in the blogosphere, and others may never see the light of day. She comes from a family of modern, self-appointed griots who enjoy oral tradition and storytelling. This is one of the reasons she felt compelled to write this story, so that her grandchildren’s children will know the courage of the women who paved the way.

For more information, you can connect with Acasia at:

acasia@rhymeswithacasia.com

On Instagram: @rhymeswith_acasia

 Facebook: Acasia Olson - Author 
 



 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form [Click Here for form] to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: DON'T use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit . ;0) )

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #TheBookofJo and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instagram - @rhymeswith_acasia / @newdegreepress
Facebook - Acasia Olson - Author / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With gratitude,


Acasia O.

story:
Update: As a thank you to all the backers I'll be adding a postcard print of Hong Kong/London when we reach 50% funded! Selection will be sent to all backers when the campaign ends.

Details: - signed paperback backers will get a postcard print of their choice (London or HK), 2+ copies will get 2 postcard print

- ebook or ebook bundle backers can get one too if they share the campaign on any social media and send me a screenshot and tag me

 

It’s a Match is set in the 2030s, where everyone relies on their Artificial Intelligence Virtual Assistant for everything. When Sarah used hers to help her get online dating matches, she finds more than she bargained for: an algorithm that has been shaping her, and everyone else’s life.

 

 

Short Summary

My name is Nam Cheah and I am the author of It’s a Match, publishing under Samantha Cheah. I’ve always been a fan of Sci-Fi and future, and I was inspired to write this novel by reading books and watching documentaries about technology and AI, in particular Homo Deus and The Great Hack. We are entering the era of big data, where information is the most valuable currency and people are becoming more heavily reliant on technology. What if we all have an Artificial Intelligence Virtual Assistant? And what if it can cast an invisible web that connects everything and everyone?
The story follows Sarah, a final year student in London. Sarah is the last remaining single girl in her friendship group so she decides to try online dating. After a series of bad dates, Sarah authorizes her AI Virtual Assistant to help her get online dating matches to save time. That is, until matches start approaching her in the streets and she discovers that her AIVA has been doing more than just getting online dating matches for her. It has been influencing her decisions her entire life...

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the double-edge sword of technology and its morale implications. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to envision a future that’s neither dystopian nor utopian, where people must decide if they can live with their lives being shaped by engineered fate. A decision that we all might have or have already been faced with.
 

Why would you like this book?

You will love this book if you love a light Sci-Fi that intersects with chic-lit and a sprinkle of mystery. From the decade-old struggle of online dating to being a final year student in an international university, it is a similar world to ours with futuristic technology. The characters are not too different from us, struggling with many of the same challenges we all face every day. Most romance novels make love and dating look so dramatic and easy, but it can be awkward, confusing, and daunting, (and that’s without interference of technology) and the book will reflect that.

It’s a Match speaks to new and young adult who grew up with technology, and those who are on the edge and saw its rise. As someone who split half her life in Hong Kong and the other half in the UK, I also wrote this book in the hope of finding more representation of people like me in fiction. It explores the world (and minefield) of online dating, something that many of us have experienced, and how ethics and morals are not evolving fast enough to catch up with it.

Ultimately, I hope that It’s a Match inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Are you ok with AI, big data, and algorithms influencing you in any way? And in what way?
  • How can we keep relationships of our own when Facebook (and other AIVA in the future) reminds us of birthdays and important dates?
  • We increasingly rely on AI to better our lives, but at what point does it becomes too much? And what data should be off-limits?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Dec 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

The Impact

Being a traditionally published author is a convoluted journey that requires a lot of querying, finding an agent, then a publisher, and you have limited control over the edits and changes they make. I have also tried self-publishing, which lets you have all the control, but I also have to self-fund and find my own contractors for editing and cover design. I was happy with my cover designer but not at all with the edits.


My experience with writing and self-publishing means that I know my way around the book creation process and will make this story the best book it can be. This is a story that I would love to share - a fun read that also explores the moral question that technology can bring. I also offer a package for a book chat if you're interested to learn more about the process beyond being in my beta-reading group.


Hybrid publishing is a mixed approach - funds are raised in this campaign and the New Degree Press will help me polish the book, while I get to retain the rights to my book and decide on the changes. I realize that creating a book takes a community - which is why I have this Indiegogo campaign.

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $6,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $7,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $9,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Samantha Cheah is a pen name used by Nam Cheah for her fiction works. She is a freelance writer based in Hong Kong who has written for National Geographic, GastroObscura, Whetstone, Culture Trip, Matador Network, South China Morning Post, and her own blog Laugh Travel Eat to name but a few. But her first love of writing will always be fiction.

Nam has been writing since she was a young girl, mostly in the genre of Sci-Fi, fantasy, and romance. She was born in Hong Kong and used to scribble stories in Chinese. When she was 11 she went to UK to study and she switched languages when her English became better than her Chinese. But it wasn’t until she found Wattpad, an online platform for writers and readers, that she started to finish novels. Under the username, then author name, Shadow Cheah, she self-published a post-apocalyptic Sci-Fi trilogy - the Protectors of Earth Chronicles - which has garnered a combined 2 million views on Wattpad. It took her five years to write the trilogy, and she finished it when she graduated from Imperial College London.


After entering the work force, Nam got busy with the other side of writing, but the pandemic has given her the opportunity to pick up her (proverbial) pen again. As much as she loves the dystopian genre, she believes that the future isn’t quite as bleak. It’s a Match is an amalgamation of her love for Sci-Fi, her online dating experience, a want for diverse and POC representation that resembles the world she knows, and a version of future that she can see take place.

Nam had adopted the new pen name Samantha Cheah to reflect her new writing journey and to keep her freelance writing separate. It’s a Match is a book for young and new adults who have grown up in an international setting, who want to or have tried online dating, and who are reliant on technology. She doesn’t believe in the dystopian outlook of many Sci-Fi movies like i-Robot and Eagle Eyes, but the moral question of big data, AI, and algorithms should not be ignored.

For more information, you can connect with me at samanthacheahauthor@gmail.com, as well as through Facebook (Samantha Cheah author), and Instagram (samanthacheahauthor).
 

International Preorders

For international preorders (that is not USA and Hong Kong), please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

The estimated shipping costs of 1 book are below (depends on final book weight):

  • UK/Western Europe: 9-13 USD
  • Asia: 5-7 USD
  • Canada: 13 USD
  • Australia: 6-10 USD


Note: shipping might be delayed due to less flights under COVID-19

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier (within US and Hong Kong). For International Preorder, do not select the tiers, instead, make a contribution of the same amount and fill in this form.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #ItsaMatch and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:

  • Instragram - @samanthacheahauthor / @newdegreepress
  • Facebook - @samanthacheahauthor / @NewDegreePress
  • Twitter - @NewDegreePress


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nam

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!
 

The Impact
Being a traditionally published author is a convoluted journey that requires a lot of querying, finding an agent, then a publisher, and you have limited control over the edits and changes they make. I have also tried self-publishing, which lets you have all the control, but I also have to self-fund and find my own contractors for editing and cover design. I was happy with my cover designer but not at all with the edits.
My experience with writing and self-publishing means that I know my way around the book creation process and will make this story the best book it can be. This is a story that I would love to share - a fun read that also explores the moral question that technology can bring. I also offer a package for a book chat if you're interested to learn more about the process beyond being in my beta-reading group.
Hybrid publishing is a mixed approach - funds are raised in this campaign and the New Degree Press will help me polish the book, while I get to retain the rights to my book and decide on the changes. I realize that creating a book takes a community - which is why I have this Indiegogo campaign.
 
Campaign Goals
Tier 1: Hit $6,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)Tier 2: Hit $7,500 and the book will get a hardcover editionTier 3: Hit $9,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
 
About the Author
Samantha Cheah is a pen name used by Nam Cheah for her fiction works. She is a freelance writer based in Hong Kong who has written for National Geographic, GastroObscura, Whetstone, Culture Trip, Matador Network, South China Morning Post, and her own blog Laugh Travel Eat to name but a few. But her first love of writing will always be fiction.Nam has been writing since she was a young girl, mostly in the genre of Sci-Fi, fantasy, and romance. She was born in Hong Kong and used to scribble stories in Chinese. When she was 11 she went to UK to study and she switched languages when her English became better than her Chinese. But it wasn’t until she found Wattpad, an online platform for writers and readers, that she started to finish novels. Under the username, then author name, Shadow Cheah, she self-published a post-apocalyptic Sci-Fi trilogy - the Protectors of Earth Chronicles - which has garnered a combined 2 million views on Wattpad. It took her five years to write the trilogy, and she finished it when she graduated from Imperial College London.
After entering the work force, Nam got busy with the other side of writing, but the pandemic has given her the opportunity to pick up her (proverbial) pen again. As much as she loves the dystopian genre, she believes that the future isn’t quite as bleak. It’s a Match is an amalgamation of her love for Sci-Fi, her online dating experience, a want for diverse and POC representation that resembles the world she knows, and a version of future that she can see take place.Nam had adopted the new pen name Samantha Cheah to reflect her new writing journey and to keep her freelance writing separate. It’s a Match is a book for young and new adults who have grown up in an international setting, who want to or have tried online dating, and who are reliant on technology. She doesn’t believe in the dystopian outlook of many Sci-Fi movies like i-Robot and Eagle Eyes, but the moral question of big data, AI, and algorithms should not be ignored.For more information, you can connect with me at samanthacheahauthor@gmail.com, as well as through Facebook (Samantha Cheah author), and Instagram (samanthacheahauthor). 
International PreordersFor international preorders (that is not USA and Hong Kong), please do the following:Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
The estimated shipping costs of 1 book are below (depends on final book weight):

UK/Western Europe: 9-13 USD
Asia: 5-7 USD
Canada: 13 USD
Australia: 6-10 USD

Note: shipping might be delayed due to less flights under COVID-19
Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier (within US and Hong Kong). For International Preorder, do not select the tiers, instead, make a contribution of the same amount and fill in this form.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!
Please use #ItsaMatch and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!Tag:
Instragram - @samanthacheahauthor / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @samanthacheahauthor / @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @NewDegreePress
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Nam

story:
Story of My Book

Soar Above Life’s Turbulence is a memoir that testifies the power of perseverance. We often perceive life challenges as desist letters to our progress but this book explores how holdbacks can be harnessed and transformed into opportunities. It shows how a young school dropout man (the author) became a scholar at one of the world’s top best universities through perseverance.

My name is Elyse Uwimpaye and I am the author of Soar Above Life’s Turbulence. I wrote this book because I always wanted to share with the world how holdbacks and life challenges are sometimes opportunities presented in a different form. This book will give me a platform to share and hopefully inspire people as a young man who lost his parents at age 12, started to pay his school fees at age 13, and dropped out of school at age 17 - and how that was not the end but just the beginning of life.


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how patience and persistence are the fuels of progress. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn and enhance your ability to harness life challenges and turn them into opportunities and live a life of indistractable purpose.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of personal development hacks and perseverance tricks through narratives like:

  • Maximising commitment: featuring insights about the lessons learnt from the Chinese bamboo tree seed.
  • Being loyal to our dreams: featuring the authentic story behind ‘the why’ we start the journey. Most of the time we give up on our dreams and defy our life purpose not because we are not a good fit for it but because we don’t have a clear vision of where we want to go and why we want to go there. Start with an end in mind.
  • Seek to be better than yesterday: featuring a story of how I made a better version of myself and can be better today than yesterday.


You will love this book if you are a great fan of inspirational stories or a person who is limited by challenges and feel like giving up on maximising his/her potential and want to find some source of inspiration. 

Soar Above Life’s Turbulence not only speaks to youths who are working hard to discover their potentials but also to anyone who wants to grapple with a new way of approaching challenges and turn them into opportunities.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work alongside with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Elyse Uwimpaye is a third-year undergraduate student at the University of Edinburgh. He is pursuing his dreams of becoming an Aerospace Engineer through double majoring in Electrical and Mechanical Engineering. Elyse grew up in a community where education was not as much a priority as farming or looking after cattle, however he was able to challenge this norm through dreaming big far beyond farming. His determination, persistence, passion, and great sense of purpose chained down everything that would limit him from achieving his dreams. Growing up with such a crazy dream, he faced numerous challenges and holdbacks which led him to temporarily drop out of school. Now, he is the first person from his entire family and his entire community to ever become a scholar at one of the top 20 best universities in the world, the University of Edinburgh.

Elyse wrote this book because he firmly believes that passion and persistence is key to progress, and through telling his life story, he could inspire thousands of youths out there who may be at the edge of giving up on their dreams. Through his book, he shows while there is no dream too big to come true, there will always be a price to pay to make that burning dream become a reality. Here is one of his favorite quotes from his book: “With your crazy dream, people may call abnormal but when that dream becomes a reality, your abnormality makes you extraordinary.”

Apart from his engineering dream, Elyse is also passionate about youth empowerment, and advocate for education for all. He is a former World Literacy Foundation Ambassador, a former mentor in Critical Thinking for Peace Camp2019, and Global Buddy Program Group Leader.

For more information you can connect with Elyse via email at euwimpaye@gmail.com, on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/elyse-uwimpaye11..

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SoarAboveLifesTurbulence and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Elyse Uwimpaye

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
