story:
Short Summary

In the Age of AI explores Artificial intelligence and the impact it will have on society and the economy. It argues that AI will transform society in many positive ways, but the consequence of that transformation will displace millions of jobs.

My name is Sam Mielke and I am the author of In The Age of AI. I wrote this book because I recognized that AI will cause every industry to go through incredible changes that we aren’t ready for. I also wrote this book to give you a detailed overview of how emerging technologies will affect the future of work.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that artificial intelligence is not something to ignore, but rather something to embrace and get “ahead of the pack” by dedicating time to learning how it will impact society. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the future of technology. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you navigate this ever-changing world of technology and what you can do to prepare for it.

In this book, you'll learn about AI and the impacts it has on jobs and why this technological change is different from previous ones. You'll read...

A story from Elon Musk about his first-hand experience with AI and how it scared him

A story about why Ray Kurzweil believes we may have the technical capabilities to make everyone double their lifespan by 2029 and then forever by 2045.

An interesting story from Mark Cuban about how AI is bigger than anything in history and what he advises all people do about it to prepare.

You will love this book if you want to be prepared for the AI revolution, enjoy learning about the future and are interested in technology.

In The Age of AI is a nonfiction book that speaks to young people pondering their career choices, as well as workers in every industry who want to look at technology and the future of work in a new way.

The Book

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. The first chapter explores what AI is and its history. It will give you a savvy understanding of AI and how many emerging technologies are evolving to change the world. Chapter 2 looks at the history of job displacement including the industrial revolution which is often compared to this AI revolution. I’ll explain why this change is different and the reasons automation will displace millions of jobs.

Part 2 contains chapters 3-9. In this section, each chapter will be dedicated to an industry where I analyze the impact AI has on the specific industry and subsequently the way it will impact jobs. This section includes numerous expert interviews and interesting stories that provide more opinions on the future.

Part 3 contains chapters 10-11. Here we take a look at the solutions to job displacement and the ways in which you can better prepare yourself for the impending change.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #InTheAgeofAI and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Sam Mielke

story:
Help Me Celebrate!

My debut book of poetry is here! I can't wait to celebrate with all of you and send you a signed copy--but I need your help.

I am a Jamaican-born poet and writer, with a background in TV production and higher education marketing. Between working full-time, obtaining my M.F.A. in Creative Writing, and raising two children…this book has been a long time in the making.

Gathering the Waters was selected by Jamii Publishing from over 100 manuscripts, and includes poems that have appeared in Renaissance Noire, Mosaic Literary Magazine, Small Axe Salon, The Mom Egg, Streetnotes: Cross Cultural Poetics, Multilingual Anthology of the Americas Poetry Festival, and several others.

How You Can Contribute

My goal is to raise $5,000 to cover the cost of a Jan. 10  book launch party at Imagenation's Raw Space, located in Harlem, NY. 

Your funds will be used for:

  • Raw Space rental
  • professional event photography
  • cultural performance
  • DJ
  • food
  • drinks
  • utensils/cups/plates/napkins
  • event poster and other decorations

Perks!

A minimum $25 contribution gets you a signed copy of the book, plus entry to the celebration--but space is very limited. Those who contribute $25 dollars or more and wish to attend the event must send an email with "RSVP" in the subject line to gatheringthewaters@gmail.com in order to be added to the guest list. Guests will be added on a first-come first-served basis.  

For a contribution of $50 or more, not only will you receive a signed copy of the book, entrance to the party (only with advanced RSVP), but you will also receive a beautiful broadside poster with my poetry and original artwork by Iyaba Ibo Mandingo. 

Poetry Heals

See what others have to say about this collection:

"Keisha-Gaye Anderson is comfortable in the language and truth of her poems. Hers is a necessary voice for our times. These poems sing, dance, rumble and cry out like sweet thunder from the coral colored shore of her poetic terrain. I am in awe of these spirit vocals, these healing water sounds."

—Cheryl Boyce-Taylor, poet and author of Convincing The Body

"Gathering the Waters is a potent book of poetry that can intoxicate your senses. Keisha wields her pen like a Samurai swordsman. Her poetry deals with the personal us, the intimate us, and the history of us. Keisha’s poetry takes you on a wonderfully exciting journey through the culture and beauty of being Black, with the promise of tomorrow."

—Abiodun Oyewole, The Last Poets 

All levels of support will be tremendously helpful and greatly appreciated. And please, spread the word! From the bottom of my heart, I thank you.

Warmest,
Keisha-Gaye Anderson
website: www.keishagaye.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/keishagaye
Twitter: @KeishaGaye1

Mosaic Literary Magazine, Small Axe Salon, The Mom Egg, Streetnotes: Cross
Cultural Poetics, Multilingual Anthology of the Americas Poetry Festival, and
several others.

How You Can Contribute

 My goal is to raise $5,000 to cover the cost of a Jan. 10  book launch party at Imagenation's Raw Space, located in Harlem, NY. 


Your funds will be used for:  Raw Space rental
professional event photography
cultural performance
DJ
food
drinks
utensils/cups/plates/napkins
event poster and other decorations



Perks! 
A minimum $25 contribution gets you a signed copy of the book, plus entry to the celebration--but space is very limited. Those who contribute $25 dollars or more and wish to attend the event must send an email with "RSVP" in the subject line to gatheringthewaters@gmail.com in order to be added to the guest list. Guests will be added on a first-come first-served basis.  
For a contribution of $50 or more, not only will you receive a signed copy of the book, entrance to the party (only with advanced RSVP), but you will also receive a beautiful broadside poster with my poetry and original artwork by Iyaba Ibo Mandingo. 


Poetry HealsSee what others have to say about this collection:


"Keisha-Gaye Anderson is comfortable in the language and
truth of her poems. Hers is a necessary voice for our times. These poems sing,
dance, rumble and cry out like sweet thunder from the coral colored shore of
her poetic terrain. I am in awe of these spirit vocals, these healing water
sounds."
—Cheryl Boyce-Taylor, poet and author of Convincing The Body
"Gathering the Waters is a potent book of poetry that can intoxicate your
senses. Keisha wields her pen like a Samurai swordsman. Her poetry deals with
the personal us, the intimate us, and the history of us. Keisha’s poetry takes
you on a wonderfully exciting journey through the culture and beauty of being
Black, with the promise of tomorrow."
—Abiodun Oyewole, The Last Poets 


All levels of support will be tremendously helpful and greatly appreciated. And please, spread the word! From the bottom of my heart, I thank you.


Warmest, Keisha-Gaye Andersonwebsite: www.keishagaye.comFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/keishagayeTwitter: @KeishaGaye1

story:
UPDATE:

Today is the final day of my campaign!

I am really quite close to my initial goal — as of 7am, I am at $2,944, out of the $3,500 wished for!

I would really love to get the funds to $3,000. I think, if I am very careful, I could almost completely cover the cost of the trip with $3,000.

So, I’ve come up with one more perk to perhaps entice you on this last leg of the campaign! ANY contribution (over $1) made today will receive a nice, thickly-printed bookmark, designed by Sebastian (an extremely talented visual artist) and I, with my favorite poem (can you guess what it might be?) inscribed on the back.

Already made a donation, but might like to contribute a few dollars more? No problem — the bookmark will be sent in addition to whatever perk you might have already selected!

Maybe you would like to make a larger contribution to match on of the bigger perks? The bookmark will, again, be an additional gift!

I am completely and absolutely heart-filled with the incredible support I have received from friends and “strangers” alike. I started the project driven by my own desire to tell this story. Now it is so much more than that.

And, you can keep up with the progress of my research trip (and the growth of the book!) on my blog, lady i swear by all flowers (www.chelseab.typepad.com) — or, email me (chelseaslaven {at} gmail {dot} com) with questions!

THANK YOU.
+Chelsea

 

UPDATE:

In the first week following the launch of my campaign, I made over $1000. I find this astonishing. I have many generous friends. And I’ve found the world to be full of generous strangers. And I want to be generous, as well.

So I thought on it, and I’ve created a few more “perks” for my donors to choose from. If you have already donated in one of the amounts indicated below, have no fear! You can retroactively select a perk that matches your donation. I think I should be able to keep track of all of this through indiegogo — you might keep an eye out there for a message from me, if I don’t have your personal email…

$35
Summer Roadtrip Playlist

In addition to the Postcard from Prague, you will also receive a link for a downloadable playlist of roadtrip music, carefully compiled by me.

 

$100
Personalized Reading List

In addition to the postcard and playlist, you will also receive a reading list of 5 recommended books, selected especially for you and your reading adventures. Titles will be chosen per a questionnaire / email correspondence.

 

And this is the one that I, personally, am most excited about…

$250
Online Writing Workshop*

In this four week seminar / workshop hybrid, we will closely read through a range of short works and examine what a short story can be, and the various ways in which we might write one. You will receive feedback on assigned writing exercises, as well as a thorough, thoughtful written response to two works of short fiction submitted during the course.

*The course will focus primarily on short fiction, and will run (tentatively) through the month of January in 2013.


THANK YOU!
+Chelsea




Hello!


I am Chelsea, a writer of fiction, a student of writing, and mama to two little boys.  For the longest time, I thought I only wanted to write short stories.  I love the form, the compactness of them, the fact that I can write them during the course of a nap.  But over this past year, in my MFA workshops, I realized that I was essentially writing the same voice in my stories over and over again.  And I realized that this voice, this character, she needs a novel. 

Much of the book comes from stuff familiar to me -- a small-town Midwestern setting, the experience of a religious Roman Catholic upbringing, the weird world of beauty pageants, a pilgrimage to an apparition site.

But there are also elements of the book that I feel I needed more understanding of, in order to write them authentically: Namely, where and when my fictional apparition of the Virgin Mary would occur. 

After months of digging around in the library, I found my way to Bílá Voda, a small village in the Czech Republic. 

When the Communist Regime took power in the Czech Republic after World War II, thirteen different orders of nuns were pulled from their work in schools and orphanages and hospitals and were exiled to a monastery in Bílá Voda.  They lived there together until the fall of Communism in 1989.  Some still live there today.

This place and time -- Bílá Voda at the start of the Velvet Revolution – are really historically perfect for an apparition of the Virgin Mary to occur.  I feel so lucky to have found my way here.  But I am at a point where I feel I have exhausted the research I can do in libraries.

 

The Plan

I am preparing for a two week trip to the Czech Republic at the end of summer.  I need to spend some time in Bílá Voda, speak with the nuns, walk the streets of the village, get a sense of the place, before I can move forward in writing it.  Next year is my last in the MFA program, and, after staying at home with my boys for three years, I know that I will never again have a time so dedicated to writing, with the support and thoughtful feedback of my talented peers and teachers. 

This is my time for writing this book.

 

What I need and What You Get

My fundraising goal for this campaign is $3,500.  This will help to cover airfare, ground transportation in the Czech Republic, and the cost of a translator. 

As the mother of a young family living on a restaurant server’s wages in New York City, all help in making this magic happen will be deeply appreciated! 

While any and all donations will receive my warmest gratitude, donors of $20 or more will receive a 5x7 “postcard” photograph from the Czech Republic, taken and printed by me. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know, I KNOW, that there may not always be money to give.  If you are unable to make a monetary donation, but would still like to support my project, please spread the word!  Facebook, Twitter, Blogging – just be sure to include the link to the campaign page: http://www.indiegogo.com/thevelvetmother

 

Please check in on the progress of this research trip and the book!  I will be posting -- photographs and words -- on my experiences in this process on my blog: ladyiswearbyallflowers

 

**My warmest thanks to Laura Hadden, videographer and sense-maker extraordinaire.

story:
Short Summary

We are two student girls from Belgrade, Serbia.
  • Dragana Kostica  aka Christine C. A blogger, couchsurfer, social activist, member of AESOP NGO, student of archaeology and huge music and arts fan. Her blog: www.exploringbelgrade.wordpress.com
  • Jovana Bogicevic  aka Johana B. Student of art and member of Banda Panda art collective. Article about Banda Panda:  http://exploringbelgrade.wordpress.com/2012/02/14/omg-they-are-so-contemporary-the-art-collective-banda-panda

The idea for this project originated from a non-profitable blog Exploring Belgrade that covered events in the city, which reached unexpected popularity and followers from all around the globe. Still in Belgrade will be a sort of an upgrade from this blog that will offer wider array of topics and opportunities for still not established authors.

The idea is to make a practical and useful website which will offer fresh updates on all major cultural events in the city.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 1000$ to launch a website with a sophisticated design.

It is only with your help that we can make this project happen. Both of us are still students, and on our own it would be impossible to collect such funds.

Belgrade is a city with long history, and with an ever improving cultural scene, however it lacks a high quality on-line city guide with carefully selected and useful information. It is our goal to make such a guide and help foreigners as well as locals in making the most of it.

There are many very creative people who don’t get a chance to promote their ideas, and our web site will give them an opportunity to do so!

Belgrade is becoming a major cultural destination of the region, and of Europe, and we strongly believe it deserves all of our help.

By donating, you are supporting creativity and art. We hope you will use the information we provide prior to your visit to Belgrade.

See the list and descriptions of perks below.

The Impact

Still in Belgrade is a project conceived as an open, flexible interactive platform in which various authors from different countries will participate.
The idea is to create a website that combines a virtual city guide, an on-line magazine and a blog. 
The primary focus will be on the cultural scene of Belgrade, however more global topics will include global culture, society, music, arts, design, club culture, travel and lifestyle.
 
Articles will be written in English and Serbian
Website will present the fallowing categories:
  • Belgrade city guide
  • Local events
  • Culture & Society
  • Music & Club Culture
  • Arts & Design 
  • Travel & Lifestyle

You can download our PowerPoint presentation from the following link: http://www.slideshare.net/DraganaKostica/still-in-belgrade-13049294

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help us by donating, we would both be very grateful if you would share the word about this project on Facebook, Twitter, MySpace or any other social network you might be using. :)

story:
PRESENTING PART ONE OF THE CITY SERIES: CUBISM IS SO SUPERANNUATED!

Cubism is so Superannuated is an in-progress novel -- due sometime September 2013 -- all about superheroes, weird tentacles (and other tropes!), and filing the proper Re-Alignment of Loyalty Forms (RALFs) for the next betrayal down the line.  It's mostly a comedy, sort of a romance (if throwing buses full of people can qualify..), and possibly a dig on art history along with all the cliches.  It really depends on how you look at it.

George Cuvier is the legendary superhero Iguanodon, his normal alter-ego being the rich lackadaisical man who wears couture because it's proper and lets his butler keep a bear around because it's easier not to argue.  As Iguanodon he is in a constant heroic struggle against the villainous Carnivora, this manipulative evil-doer who seems to steal signatures from everyone and never develops his own schtick.

But of course, Carnivora's alter-ego is really Étienne Hilaire, Cuvier's best friend from childhood.  And of course, instead of bad-guying it up all the time he tends to spend manic bursts of energy mooning over Cuvier and pestering him for a reaction.

Cuvier doesn't really care if his arch-enemy isn't dedicated.  He isn't dedicated either.  He'd rather collect collections from other government mandated Supers than tromp out to get another bus thrown at his head.

Regardless of all this, they're both rather popular.  Little boys adore Iguanodon!  Girls shriek at the name of Carnivora!  So when the Mayor of The City, Paul, is mysteriously in absentia and trouble by way of Alternate Universes, rogue tech from the University, and poor citizens sprouting tentacles from their eye sockets start to happen, the two men have to get involved.  Despite their adamant disinterest.

Humorously slanted and full of every sci-fi/fantasy trope there is with the intent of playing it straight, this is a story about doing your job, dealing with the repercussions, and possibly developing a concoction that takes care of the tentacles problem.  (WITHOUT driving the hosts of said tentacles mad during, please and thank you.)

OKAY, SO WHO ARE YOU?

I'm Sinead Malloy, but my nom de plume is Glitzy Babylon because it's easier to remember.. and spell!  I've been writing since I was seven -- something about Edgar Allen Poe and H.P. Lovecraft teaming up to solve crimes, it was really convoluted and incoherent, I am so so sorry Universe -- and have finally gotten around to figuring out how I can get my stories out to the world.

Self publishing via Kindle Direct (& possible other places) is going to be the name of the game, oh boy.  I can write novella-length -- my faaavourite, why is this my favourite? -- and get them to a reading public without wading hip-deep through pudding while shackled to a sun bear.  It's a process, obviously.

I've got a weird living situation -- no electricity!  only solar.. eventually? -- and a desire to write.  And too many dogs, too.  Hold me?

BUT WHY IS THIS A PROJECT HERE, JIM?

Unfortunately as things are now, I'm having a hard time writing as much as I'd like, as I need to.  My laptop is dying a horrible, Julius Caesar death -- it's from 2001, I can't blame it for wanting to expire on the steps of the Roman Senate in a dramatic fashion and take all my files with it -- and I need to somehow find funds to hire someone to edit what I write before it gets flaunted all over the world.  (Because all over the world it shall go!) 

This is where the campaign comes in.  I'm asking for funding to pay a freelance unbiased editor to whack at Superannuated with a chainsaw, keep my hosting bill paid for a few more months so I can try out this weird platform thing people keep telling me I need to get onto, and (hopefully) have enough left over to pay for a pawn shop special laptop.  It's okay if it has viruses.  My mother's got tech friends, I'll beg familial favours for a fix.
 
The funds priority is as follows:
  1. Editing services for the final mss, so the published work is as poslished as possible.
  2. Laptop.  One that doesn't cost more than $200 or so.  And doesn't take 6 hours to open a .pdf file, what the hell that was a freaky occurrence.
  3. Hosting bill.  Not very high up on the list, but it weighs on the mind, so putting it here anyway!

WHAT DO I GET IF I THROW MONEY AT YOU?

EVERY SINGLE LAST CONTRIBUTOR WILL GET:
  • a copy of the novella once it's finished, edited, and swanked up.
  • a mention in the acknowledgements page in the final product.  INFAMY!  YOU WILL HAVE IT!

OKAY, SO.. HOW DO WE KNOW IF YOU CAN WRITE??

Well, I've got the first five thousand words of the novella up on google docs for you to read?  Is that good?
 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p6oA-h6D6skUBhiKi-V2Vgk0N_oFZnzswRdbFyroHkg

Nothing else I can really say here, sorry.

YEAH, OKAY, SO. CONCLUSION, ERROL FLYNNS AND FLYNNETTES.

My goal for this project is basically on the high end, because I don't know how much it'll cost to pay the editor.  Somewhere around $500 to $700 is what I'm going on right now.  The projected final count is going to be upwards of 60,000 words, but it might require multiple edits.  I don't really know.  But I do know that I need to make it tip-top and worth an absolute stranger's money, so.. Crowdfunding.  Gotta give it a whirl.
 
If you like the provided opening and want to see more of the story, please consider chucking a few dollars in the tin.  If you'd like to, but haven't the cash, then please tell your friends! 
 
 
My absolute endgame in life is to pay my bills and manage to entertain people at the same time.  The bills are being taken care of at the moment.  Please help me out with the entertainment portion if you can <3

Crowdfunding.  Gotta give it a whirl. If you like the provided opening and want to see more of the story, please consider chucking a few dollars in the tin.  If you'd like to, but haven't the cash, then please tell your friends!   My absolute endgame in life is to pay my bills and manage to entertain people at the same time.  The bills are being taken care of at the moment.  Please help me out with the entertainment portion if you can <3

story:
THANK YOU

WE RAISED $2004, so my take-away was $1,863. WOW!


About Me

I have twenty-one years, a deep heart, and a wise gut.  I understand words as acts of power, resistance, gratitude, and celebration.  In terms of life commitments, I work to erode oppressions and to hearten body-mind-spirit selves.


About Your Dollars

Submissions to four publishers: $50. 

College application fees [Antioch in Seattle + Fairhaven in Bellingham]: $80

Round-trip plane ticket to participate in March 8 speaking event in MA: $398

Money for food, travel, + housing while in MA for 8 days: ~$140

One-way plane ticket to Seattle + train ticket to Bellingham in late March: $142

21 pounds of food for Oliver [feeds him for 6-8 weeks]: $53

Rent for April and May: ~$1,000

Total for above expenses = ~$1,860

story:
Who am I? I am a mother of five, a grandmother of 13, a full-time hospice nurse, and an independent woman. My younger years were spent raising my children, most often alone. At 40, I obtained my RN license. At 58, I completed my bachelor's degree. As a mother, my purpose and passion was always my children. As a single mom, it was challenging, to say the least. They are all independent with their own lives. I am taking this opportunity to pursue my dreams. My biggest dream for a long time is to write my first children's book. The ideas have been in my head for a long time. 

The purpose of my campaign is to raise the funds I need to write, obtain the illustrations and publish my first children's book. I have hired an illustrator to complete the illustrations for my book. This campaign is to help me pay for the illustration alone. I will be pursing a publisher while the book is being put together and I am not sure what costs I will ensue at that time. But, first things first.....I must have a book.   

If you choose to contribute to my campaign, you will help me to achieve my hopes and dreams of becoming a bonafide, published author. You will be supporting a strong and independent woman who believes in female entrepreneurs. You will support the reality that we can overcome any obstacle set before us, by believing that anything is possible and that one must never give up on making their dreams come true. 

Reading to children when they are young is important because it promotes a love for books and reading at an early age. It is educational and provides a bonding time with parents and loved ones.  My goal is to make my books fun and easy to read for parents and children alike. My illustrator has captured the vision I had in my head for so long. My hope is that the illustrations and story will make the parent and the child laugh! 

Being my first book, it does not speak to my success as an author. I believe my efforts and success as a mother, obtaining my education with five children at home, earning my bachelor's degree at the age of 58,  my dedication to my profession, and overcoming much adversity and opposition, illustrates my determination and ability to succeed with my book. I hope you will have faith in my ability to succeed. 

To make this dream come to life, I need my illustrator will do her magic for about 18 pages of illustrations. Her fee is $130 per page. That illustration cost creates a challenge for me financially, but I believe in myself and my talent. I just cannot complete it without support. 

It is my fervent hope that you will consider a contribution to my book's creation and success. If you would please share this site with people you know, who might have an interest in new authors, and in promoting entrepreneurs and women. There are "share tools" on my site that can help you spread the word! I would appreciate any interest in my endeavor and any contributions,

My sincere "THANK YOU" for taking time to read this and consider a contribution.  I hope you find the information I have given helpful and that it inspires you, as well. And, I hope you can read my book(s) to a child!

Kindly and gratefully,

Ellen

story:
Depuis toujours, la photographie exerce sur moi son pouvoir d’attraction. Dès l’âge de douze ans,  je m’initie aux principes de base, j’apprends le fonctionnement d’un appareil 35mm et aussi les rudiments de la chambre noire.  Je poursuis ensuite mes études universitaires dans ce domaine et deviens photographe de plateau pour le cinéma et la télévision au Québec et au Nouveau-Brunswick.  Depuis plus de vingt-cinq années, ma passion est devenue mon métier. 

Il y a sept ans, je décide de revenir vivre en Acadie dans une petite maison qui surplombe la baie de Caraquet, ma ville d’origine.  Chaque jour, de chez moi, je regarde, je scrute, j’admire  le ciel et la mer, la neige et la pluie, le soleil et la lune et les oiseaux aussi.  Je photographie ce paysage tout simple qui me parle et m’inspire plus que tout autre.  Parfois, je suis touchée par la grâce que seule la nature peut offrir.

Aujourd’hui, j’ai le goût de partager avec vous ces moments de grâce dans le cadre d’une exposition prévue de la mi-mai au début juillet 2015 à la galerie Bernard-Jean à Caraquet.  Afin de donner la dimension nécessaire à mon art paysager, j’aimerais présenter une sélection d’images sous forme de tirages grand format.  J’entreprends cette campagne de financement participatif pour offrir à mes œuvres la meilleure présentation qui soit et concrétiser un projet qui me tient à cœur depuis maintenant plusieurs années.  Votre contribution m’aidera à financer les coûts élevés d’impression et d’encadrement des dix-huit photographies que j’ai soigneusement choisies.

Vous pouvez voir une grande sélection de mes photographies en consultant ma page Facebook à l'adresse :  www.facebook.com/jdlphotographies

Je vous remercie de votre soutien,

Julie D’Amour-Léger

story:
OK, What's This About?

Research Notes is two things : firstly a website that gathers links to and summarizes online news reports, articles, research, and books related mainly to the subjects of health, science, media, governments and corporations. Secondly, it's a public domain book, which is also on the site, and the book page is updated is it's written.

One aim is to help share information with people researching the same areas, and also people newer to the subjects. Another is to do this without a lot of the agenda driven nonsense that you often find in the mainstream media, various think tanks, governments, and corporations. (and pointing out those problems will obviously be a focus with this work.)

What the site will do is post regular links, then below the links give : notes, summaries, or short extracts from what the link contains. This can help people get a quick view of some of the main parts, and also help gather notes and information for the book.

The book will gather up a lot of the research posted on the site, and then organize it into subjects that will go into more depth. An eventual physical book will hopefully be sorted out once the writing is complete, around February or March.

What's The Funding For?

This is simple for the most part :

- Living expenses.

- Money to keep the website going.

- To buy more books on the subjects being covered, so that the research is better.

- To help get a physical version of the book sorted out.

The main reason for requesting funding is so that there's no distraction at all, and I can fully focus on making this work. There's a lot of different of things that can be added to the site and the book, and that can hopefully help others who are looking into the same subjects.


Who Are You, And Why Do You Think You Can Do This?

I'm Rob Hines, from the UK, and for over a decade now I've spent hundreds of hours in my spare time trying to learn more about the subjects I'm focusing on here. I did try this before but it didn't work, I didn't really have the confidence or enough of an idea of what I was doing. This time though I do think this can be done, and it's now already started. The idea of what I'm doing is clearer, the site is underway, and so is the book. This can also be seen via the link at the bottom of this page.

I just think and feel that this is what I'm supposed to do. If I was getting a huge wage doing something else but couldn't write about these subjects it would mean next to nothing. This is the main thing that matters to me right now, and I have to try doing it.

Are You Going To Post Updates?

Of course.

There'll be several updates related to how the site is going, and also how the formation of the book is going later on. The book will likely be completed around February/March next year if things go well enough, but clearly several updates on that will be posted here as well.

If I could explain how much I believe in what I'm doing here, I would, but I can't really do that in words, I can just try to get close. Thanks to anyone that can help this work.

story:
Short Summary

My name is M.C. St. John, and I am a writer from the Midwest. All 14 tales in my first short story collection Other Music are ready to be published--with your help, that is! By donating to this campaign, you will not only be financially supporting this first run of publication, you will also be receiving a book yourself. I want as many people to read and enjoy these stories as possible; with your contribution, we are one step closer to making that happen. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to have a robust first printing, we need a minimum of $1500. This amount covers the cost of design, copyright, printing, and shipping of Other Music. With your contribution, you will not only have the opportunity to secure your own copy of the book, you will also have the ability to select one of these personalized literary perks:

  • A pre-order copy of Other Music at a reduced price (the book will retail for $15, but you will only pay $12!)
  • An autographed copy of said pre-order!
  • A live or recorded reading of a passage from Other Music by me on the phone!
  • An original poem written by me based on your song of choice!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word by sharing this link on social media as much as you can! You can also check out my website mcstjohn.com to read snippets from the stories in Other Music as well as other published writing.

story:
Not Your "Normal" Grief Book 

Ever since I can remember, I always pictured myself as writing a book one day. I used to fall asleep to dreams of being on David Letterman's show, bantering and joking with him and making him laugh, while plugging my latest novel about life and comedy and whatever else I was planning on writing about. 

Never in a million years did I ever think I'd be writing a book about loving, marrying, and then losing my beautiful husband. But life's a funny thing, and now here we are, and that is what I'm writing. 

The idea for this book began out of the very real desperation of me reaching out in the days and weeks after my world collapsed - just searching like mad to connect with someone, anyone - who would answer me back. I began posting every emotion and feeling about the death and the loss on my Facebook page. Eventually, that turned into me writing everything down in my blog (www.ripthelifeiknew.com), which at some point, morphed into turning all of it into this book. 

This book is not like any other grief-related book that is currently out there. Aside from being brutally honest and painfully funny, the book is unique because it is written in several different forms: poetry, blog pieces, the original Facebook posts taken from my page, actual dialogue snippets from my grief-counseling sessions, quotes and thoughts from other widowed people I have met, love letters that tell the story of the man who changed me forever, and much more. Because the book covers everything , in real-time, from the day he died until three years later - the reader is able to witness first-hand, the ever-changing and fascinating world that is grief. With each turn of the page, time moves forward, so the reader watches as the tone, writing style, and topics all begin to slowly change, as I slowly change. Trust me, you have never read anything quite like this before. I should know, because I have never written anything like this before - until, of course, I did.

Where's My Money Going, Bitch?

Well, there's really no need to be cursing at me, as I am more than happy to answer this very important question.  All the monies from your generous donations will be used to cover the many different and varied costs associated with the self-publishing of my book. These costs include things like:

  • Copy and  Content Editing

  • Printing

  • Shipping

  • Cover Design and Cover Art

  • Internal Design and Layout

  • Marketing and Publicity 

  • Traveling, Speaking Engagements, and Events to Help Promote the Book

  • Book-release / launch party in NYC, tentatively scheduled for November

  • Additional costs associated with self-publishing such as editing programs, software, website revisions, etc. 

Why am I asking?

My husband's death was sudden and completely unexpected. He was a paramedic, and I was a part-time professor, teaching Acting and Comedy Courses at Adelphi University

We were only 4 years into our marriage, and so we did not own a house yet, or have a chance to start our family that we dreamed of. Therefore, I was left with nothing. There was no life insurance, no savings, and I lost my health insurance because I was covered under his. Although we were extremely happy, we lived paycheck to paycheck and struggled financially. His death led to me struggling even more, and I was forced to move out of our apartment, sell his car, and get a roommate. Twice. In the past 2.5 years since his death, I have been known to work 2 and sometimes 3 jobs at once, just to stay afloat. 

I do not have the funds to be able to publish this on my own. So the only way that I can make this a reality is with the help of others… of you. 

Got No Cash? You Can Still Help! 

Believe me, if there is anyone who knows what it is like to be broke, it is me. Trust me on that. So, if you truly cannot afford to help financially, you can still help by making yourself heard. Spread the word about this campaign to anyone and everyone you know. If you are part of a large family or big group email list, share it with all of them! Tell all of your friends to share this. If you don't have any friends, I'm sorry about that. You should really go out and get some. Hey - you know a great way to get friends? Buy them stuff. Like an autographed copy of my book, for example. A simple donation of $45 will get you that, and then you will have a new friend. See, I told you this book is going to help people. 

They Like Me! They Really Like Me! 

You do not have to be widowed in order to benefit from this book. In truth, this book is being written for everybody. If you have ever been in love or wanted to be in love, or wished to be in love - then you should read this book. If you have ever suffered from PTSD, anxiety, or been through a trauma of any kind - you should read this book. If you have lost anything in your life, or been through hardships, and felt completely alone and like nobody could ever understand you - then this book is for you. If you know someone who is grieving the loss of the person that they loved most in this world, and you have no idea how to help them or how to be their friend - then you should read this book, or give it to them as a gift from you, when you don't know what to say. I know what to say. I have been where they are. I am there now. I am still crawling through it. This book is for anyone and everyone that has ever felt hurt or pain or loss; anyone who is human and has a beating heart. 

Here are a few words from a few of my readers. Reading their thoughts puts in concrete what I already knew - that this book will change lives, and make people feel less alone :

"Kelley, I want you to know what you have done for me. It's a gift you probably haven't considered, but reading your blog has made me straighten up and zip my lip whenever my husband does something. Can't put his dish in the dishwasher? Could be worse. He could be gone. Your strength is inspiring, but your insight is mindblowing. Thank you." - Karen B.

"You paint such beautiful and vivid pictures of your love through your words. I feel like Im watching a movie whenever I read them. You probably have no idea how much your words have helped others. You have taught me to live each day, for we have no idea what tomorrow will bring. Sometimes when I get discouraged, I remember your words and I find it so much easier to see the humor in the difficult days. You have reminded me how blessed my family is to still have our dad here with us, and to be able to hug him.  Bless you, Kelley. Keep writing, and keep sharing with the world, your story." - Kelli R.

"I think I love you. Your brutal honesty is refreshing, and you say so many things that I am thinking. For the first time in 18 months I can really see that I am not alone in my pain. Thank you for your writing; which is brilliant, funny, and brutally real. Well done, my friend. " - Gini L. 

"My wife died suddenly 5 months ago today, and for 5 months, I have sat like a hermit in our apartment, letting the darkness overtake me.  I dont want to see anyone or feel anything. I go to work and then come home. One night, I decided to google blogs by widowed people, and I found you. The first thing I clicked on was a post called "I Miss His Farts." Two minutes later I was laughing so hard, I almost scared myself. I had forgotten that I knew how to laugh, and there I was, laughing. Then I read a post you wrote about how people dont get it and they say move on, get over it, stop being sad. I found myself in the fetal position, sobbing my face off for an hour, just like you described doing on those post-office steps. For 5 months, I hadnt let out my emotions. Im not sure why, but I think its because I was ashamed. Reading your words gave me the push and permission I needed to let it all out. Everything else I have read that is grief-related is always a bunch of bullshit. Nobody tells the truth. You tell the truth. Ill be reading for a long time." - Frank S.

Shipping


Cover
	Design and Cover Art


Internal
	Design and Layout


Marketing
	and Publicity 


Traveling,
	Speaking Engagements, and Events to Help Promote the Book


Book-release
	/ launch party in NYC, tentatively scheduled for November

Additional costs
	associated with self-publishing such as editing programs, software, website revisions, etc. 
Why am I asking?My husband's death was sudden and completely unexpected. He was a paramedic, and I was a part-time professor, teaching Acting and Comedy Courses at Adelphi UniversityWe
were only 4 years into our marriage, and so we did not own a house
yet, or have a chance to start our family that we dreamed of.
Therefore, I was left with nothing. There was no life insurance, no
savings, and I lost my health insurance because I was covered under
his. Although we were extremely happy, we lived paycheck to paycheck
and struggled financially. His death led to me struggling even more,
and I was forced to move out of our apartment, sell his car, and get
a roommate. Twice. In the past 2.5 years since his death, I have been
known to work 2 and sometimes 3 jobs at once, just to stay afloat. 
I do not have the funds to be able to publish this on my own. So the only way that I can make this a reality is with the help of others… of you. 



Got
No Cash? You Can Still Help! 

Believe
me, if there is anyone who knows what it is like to be broke, it is
me. Trust me on that. So, if you truly cannot afford to help
financially, you can still help by making yourself heard. Spread the
word about this campaign to anyone and everyone you know. If you are
part of a large family or big group email list, share it with all of
them! Tell all of your friends to share this. If you don't have any
friends, I'm sorry about that. You should really go out and get some.
Hey - you know a great way to get friends? Buy them stuff. Like an
autographed copy of my book, for example. A simple donation of $45
will get you that, and then you will have a new friend. See, I told
you this book is going to help people. 
They
Like Me! They Really Like Me! 

You
do not have to be widowed in order to benefit from this book. In
truth, this book is being written for everybody. If you have ever
been in love or wanted to be in love, or wished to be in love - then
you should read this book. If you have ever suffered from PTSD,
anxiety, or been through a trauma of any kind - you should read this
book. If you have lost anything in your life, or been through
hardships, and felt completely alone and like nobody could ever
understand you - then this book is for you. If you know someone who
is grieving the loss of the person that they loved most in this
world, and you have no idea how to help them or how to be their
friend - then you should read this book, or give it to them as a gift
from you, when you don't know what to say. I know what to say. I have
been where they are. I am there now. I am still crawling through it.
This book is for anyone and everyone that has ever felt hurt or pain
or loss; anyone who is human and has a beating heart. 

Here
are a few words from a few of my readers. Reading their thoughts puts
in concrete what I already knew - that this book will change lives,
and make people feel less alone :

"Kelley,
I want you to know what you have done for me. It's a gift you
probably haven't considered, but reading your blog has made me
straighten up and zip my lip whenever my husband does something.
Can't put his dish in the dishwasher? Could be worse. He could be
gone. Your strength is inspiring, but your insight is mindblowing.
Thank you." - Karen B.

"You
paint such beautiful and vivid pictures of your love through your
words. I feel like Im watching a movie whenever I read them. You
probably have no idea how much your words have helped others. You
have taught me to live each day, for we have no idea what tomorrow
will bring. Sometimes when I get discouraged, I remember your words
and I find it so much easier to see the humor in the difficult days.
You have reminded me how blessed my family is to still have our dad
here with us, and to be able to hug him.  Bless you, Kelley.
Keep writing, and keep sharing with the world, your story." -
Kelli R.

"I
think I love you. Your brutal honesty is refreshing, and you say so
many things that I am thinking. For the first time in 18 months I can
really see that I am not alone in my pain. Thank you for your
writing; which is brilliant, funny, and brutally real. Well done, my
friend. " - Gini L. 

"My
wife died suddenly 5 months ago today, and for 5 months, I have sat
like a hermit in our apartment, letting the darkness overtake me.  I
dont want to see anyone or feel anything. I go to work and then come
home. One night, I decided to google blogs by widowed people, and I
found you. The first thing I clicked on was a post called "I
Miss His Farts." Two minutes later I was laughing so hard, I
almost scared myself. I had forgotten that I knew how to laugh, and
there I was, laughing. Then I read a post you wrote about how people
dont get it and they say move on, get over it, stop being sad. I
found myself in the fetal position, sobbing my face off for an hour,
just like you described doing on those post-office steps. For 5
months, I hadnt let out my emotions. Im not sure why, but I think its
because I was ashamed. Reading your words gave me the push and
permission I needed to let it all out. Everything else I have read
that is grief-related is always a bunch of bullshit. Nobody tells the
truth. You tell the truth. Ill be reading for a long time." -
Frank S.

story:
The Short Version

Create a service to support pro-indy groups and help them with fundraising, merchandise, design, web hosting, and administration.

Background

One of the strengths of the Yes campaign was its creative diversity. Hundreds of groups and thousands of individuals stood up to carry forward the arguments for independence. It was a mad, frenetic, vibrant, inclusive campaign crackling with positive energy, like somebody had tipped the Fringe Festival into a national political debate. And although we lost that vote, we're all proud of the part we played in it, because it was an almost magical political awakening for Scotland.

But one of the flaws of the campaign was that these fantastic people were largely unsupported and had to learn on the run. They all had to plan and strategise for meetings, demos, performances... but before they could do ANYTHING they needed money. So everybody went on a fundraising learning curve.

Then they needed 30 hours a day just to do half of what they'd agreed to, and find time to package and label hundreds of products - like some nightmarish version of last minute Christmas shopping - and... my God, is that how much postage costs these days?

All of these wonderful, hard-working campaigners went through the same journey. Many are still on that path, as folks like Wings, Bella, Newsnet, Wee Ginger Dug, WFI, Common Space and many, many more continue to do the job that the media has utterly failed to.

The Pitch

We've been taking care of Wings Over Scotland's fulfilment for the last three years, including distributing the Wee Blue Book. When we first approached Stu our idea was quite simple; let us take care of the admin stuff, and you can concentrate on writing. And that's the idea behind ayeMail – we want to offer everybody these services. It's a support system for pro-indy groups; it's what Yes Scotland should have been, and what we need before a second referendum.

We'll send out letters, posters, perks, merchandise, books – you name it, we'll deliver. We'll hold stock so that campaigners are no longer tripping over boxes of product in hallways, bedrooms or garages. We'll free up their time to do what we all love them doing; campaigning for indy.

But it's not just a gift wrapping service, we can do so much more. We can manufacture many of the items needed at a fraction of the cost of commercial suppliers; badges, keyrings, magnets, donor certificates and much more. We can build websites; create posters, banners and flyers; shoot and edit video; even publish books.

We've got the skills, experience and technology to do all this, and by co-ordinating across multiple pro-indy groups and individuals, we can bring economies of scale to everyone.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is time, full-time in fact. A small part of the ask is towards equipment, but the majority of it is to enable us to work full-time supporting not just Wings, but all groups who campaign for independence. The sums are quite modest. We don't need a lot, just enough to keep the lights on and the computers running - but to us it would make a huge difference, and enable us to support the work of hundreds of others.

So first of all we're asking for £2,000 to fund two people to work (mostly to volunteer, in fact) over an initial five month period (and if we have enough work after that, we'll keep going). I know that's a heck of an ask in these cash-strapped times, but it's only £200 a month apiece. That's enough to keep the bank manager off our backs for the moment, so that's all that we humbly ask for.

Secondly, we need some equipment;

  • A high quality digital printer
  • A high volume franking machine
  • A floor-standing paper guillotine
  • Badge-making machines

  • Shelving and storage bins

Over the next three months we want to produce at least 30,000 badges (with packaging) for pro-indy and EU-IN groups. These will be around 30% cheaper than commercial suppliers - and yes, we'll be offering them to all pro-indy groups, not just the SNP!

That lot comes to £1,200, which brings us to £3,200 thus far which, with Indiegogo's fees and a small contingency, totals to £3,500.

The franking machine is really what empowers everything else; with that we can offer much reduced postage rates to campaigners, and we project that it will pay for itself within two months.

Three grand is a large amount of money to ask for, especially at this time of year and with a lot of uncertainty still about. All I can do is point to our track record with Wings; you all got your perks and books the last 3 years, yeah? That was me, alone, working evenings and weekends. Imagine what we can do with two full-time folk!

If we don't make the target then we'll scale things back, but still get what equipment we can and get our badge production line up and running.

If we exceed the target then we'll expand our capacity, buy materials in larger quantities to reduce the unit cost, and look at adding stuff like mugs and t-shirts to our in-house manufacture so that we can offer these at discounted rates too.

story:
Ever wonder how emotions evolved into the complexly nuanced feelings that they are today, and how that evolutionary process is reflected in human history?

I have in my possession the most exciting and embodied map of human development yet. With this new framework I show how the avoidance of difficult feelings, and the trouble this avoidance brings to the world stage, is part of a complex process that has fueled both cultural evolution and the interior evolution of individuals everywhere throughout history. Furthermore, seen from this perspective it becomes clear that by recognizing the complex contours and life given necessity of emotional trauma, we can learn to embrace our worst fears as the fiery doorways to our deepest embodiment, and greatest freedom.  Through this new lens it becomes obvious that humans are slowly waking up to this increasing capacity for inner acceptance that is our ultimate evolutionary destiny, and the makings of a truly empowered, conscious humanity!!!

How I arrived at this.

Without warning I have stepped across a once imagined boundary into a grander vision of my long suspected purpose. In wake of this birthing, as though possessed by some great creative force I spent my nights and days in the library absorbed in some new genus. It felt as though my mind had suddenly synthesized a decade of theory, experience, and data, into something new, something that screams for me to put it forth into the world, an experience that up until now I have only heard about in movies and books. I’m now left with 20 refined typed pages and a small pile of complex hand drawn charts and maps.

The basic gist of my work involves the combination of three uniquely calibrated cutting edge psychological frameworks into a new and approachable explanation of emotional trauma and its place in human development, both ontogenetically (individual development), and phylogenetically (human development over the last 30,000+ years). I believe I’ve created the most comprehensive, experientially accessible, map and explanation of human interior development ever presented. My goal is to create a highly approachable book that brings these concepts to life for the everyday person and scholar alike. An additional goal is to put together a short academic paper that I can submit to various conferences around the country. My sense is that the work I will create will be the foundation of my life’s work, and will be applicable to a wide range of endeavors including business modeling, progressive anthropological research, psychotherapy, leadership methods, and group work of any kind.

What I need to see it through.

To complete this book I need isolation and around the clock monk-like devotional focus. To this end, I would like 10,000 dollars to cover all my basic living expenses for the next 6 months. This will include food ($350+/month), rent ($800+/month), utilities ($100+/month) and other expenses.

My background.

For years I have tortured myself with underpaying jobs that compromised every level of my integrity, a limbo that existed simply because I was not ready to give birth to anything less than a diamond. Each time I tried to write, it ended in some heady contrivance that was not enough to burn through my societal imbued sense of worthlessness, and for this very reason I persisted on, fueled only by a vague intuition of something down the road.

So now I have this uncut diamond, and to keep doing these menial jobs would be a form of violence upon myself. I need to be able to bring into fruition the real work I’ve been doing, without the burden of compromise.

My real work spans back over a decade; a journey to understand the mind, spiritually, developmentally, emotionally, socially, culturally, and anthropologically. I have perused this drive through all sorts of methods, psychedelics, shamanic ceremonies, meditation, hitchhiking, interpersonal group work, mentors, relationships in general, tons of books, and just plain being as honest with myself as I was able. It has been a struggle to find where I fit into this world; feeling myself expanding, and growing, never finding a place to take root, to give back, to use my wisdom for the betterment of the cultures around me. In the past asking for your faith in the form of money would have been a vulnerable thing for me, to be held to a certain level of accountability, that up until now I would never have felt comfortable offering up. However, like a soldier returning from battle tested, I’ve never had such faith in my worthiness and readiness to make this contribution to the world.

You have my gratitude for taking the time to read this; your help in the completion of this journey, and faith in me, will not be forgotten.

Sam Spicher

Samspicher@gmail.com

story:
¿Qué?

La Cara Oculta es una novela de género donde dos personajes de distintos orígenes, contrapuestos realmente, se ven obligados a iniciar una investigación que los llevará a situaciones límite al borde del abismo.

Para Joaquín Navarro la vida no podría presentarse mejor: un buen trabajo, un apartamento elegante en el centro de la ciudad y una joven y atractiva esposa. Pero todo parece cambiar cuando descubre que unos ladrones han entrado en su casa y que Macarena, su esposa, ha desaparecido. Mientras que, en la otra punta de la ciudad, la promesa del boxeo Miki González presencia impotente como secuestran a su manager a punta de pistola tras uno de los combates más importantes de su carrera.

Los dos hombres empiezan así una búsqueda desesperada de las personas más importantes de su vida. Unas pesquisas que los empujarán a indagar en los secretos más profundos de sus seres queridos, al tiempo que desentrañan una red de mentiras y medias verdades que rodea a una de las familias más influyente de Valencia.

Todo el mundo tiene una cara oculta.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Emilio Chapí.

Un autor fascinante que combina su pasión por la escritura con su labor de Ingeniero de Informática, habiendo vivido las mieles y hieles de tanto el sector público como el privado.

Apasionado de los libros de todo tipo desde pequeño, ha publicado más de una decena de relatos en diversas revistas literarias de género. Desde el más puro noir hasta el realismo sucio.

Queda claro que Chapí, con su personal estilo, ha venido para quedarse.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La Cara Oculta que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Emilio Chapí vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
What Is Mythos ABC?

  • A big, illustrated book of rhymes for geeky kids and their parents.
  • Features creatures, places, and deities from H.P. Lovecraft’s Cthulhu Mythos
  • From A-Z. From Azathoth to Zann.
  • Gives children a fun introduction to both unspeakable horrors and the alphabet.
  • Available in English and Danish. Look at bottom of page for more info in Danish. 

The book is out! Visit mythosabc.dk to order a copy!

A is for apple, B is for book, C is for … I’m bored already!

Kids have plenty of opportunity to learn about apples and books, so why don’t we teach them about things that really matter? Why not combine learning letters and bedtime stories with essential knowledge they will thank us for later in life?

Why, in other words, can’t A be for the blind god Azathoth? It should be, and now it can.

My name is Mads Brynnum. I’m a comedian, game designer and high school teacher, but I’m also very much a geek dad of two wanting to share some of my favourite places and monsters with my kids. And since Lovecraft’s stories aren’t exactly kids friendly, I’ve written a series of rhymes that’ll introduce them to important stuff like deeps ones, R’lyeh and shoggoths. 

Lovecraft For Six Year Olds

Mythos ABC is an alphabet book where you at last get rid of Zebras and Xmas since Lovecraft liked to use the entire range of letters. But most of all, it's a tribute to his mythos put into nursery rhymes. Imagine it as a way of exploring Lovecraft’s world of ancient gods, monsters and otherworldly geometry with a six year old in hand. That way the mythos may still be occasionally scary, but it’ll also be funny, strange and wonderful. 

And it is going to be a wonderful book, with 26 beautiful illustrations made by talented artists who love the Cthulhu mythos as much as I do - you can see some of the illustrations right here on this page. And very importantly - this is not going to be some small book that's easily lost. We’re going to a produce a huge A4 wide-format book that really shows off the artwork and gives the kids something to look at. After all, you don’t want to hide your mythos, do you?

The Poster

Part of this project is to raise great old one awareness worldwide, and what better way to do that than by starting in the classroom. So we've made a poster showcasing all the letters of the alphabet and the Lovecrafty entities they fit with. If that won't teach kids both their letters and their mythos, nothing else will. You can select the poster as a perk alone or combine it with a book. Preview of the poster below - do note that this is based on the Danish version so for instance F is The Colour Out of Space because colour = farve in Danish. 


For $5,000 this can actually happen!

$2,500 go to printing 200 books (which is quite cheap)
$2,000 go to artists (they work for peanuts, but not for nothing)
$250 go to cover small expenses (transport for meetings, film, etc) and $250 go to Indiegogo (since they also need to make money!)

Of course, this is the bare-bones minimum! If we manage to get some more money for the project, we can do some cool things soon to be revealed. 

English Or Danish

Yes, the book will be done in both the original Danish and English for all you international geeks. And hopefully we’ll be able to do it in hardcover, add the special Danish vowels that’s not meant for human tongues to pronounce, and maybe even print in more languages, but that all depends on you. 

Every little bit counts. For just a dollar I'll make an eldritch chant in your honor, and for $30 you get a book. For $100 you get four, but you can also get a cool poster or even be pictured with your own scary portrait and credited as grand master of the Mythos ABC on the very first page of the book. 

Buy a book by pledging in the menu on the right and help make Lovecraft's fantastical world spring to life. And if you're short on cash, talk about the project or send a prayer to some obscure deity - everything helps. 

Thank you.

- mads

Hvad er Mythos ABC?

H.P. Lovecraft var en amerikansk horrorforfatter der skrev om unævnelige rædsler, ældgamle guder, mystiske byer og frygtelige monstre. Hans univers kaldes for The Cthulhu Mythos, og bogen er et forsøg på at introducere børn til noget lidt uhyggeligt, men også sjovt, sært og fantastisk. Og når man nu er i gang med at lære om unævnelige rædsler, hvorfor så ikke lære alfabetet ved samme lejlighed. 
Bogen rummer en tegning og et rim for hvert bogstav i alfabetet, og selvfølgelig tager vi æ, ø og å med i den danske udgave så der er rim om alt fra den blinde gud Azathoth over mærkelige mi-go'er til ådselsædere fra drømmelandet. 

Du kan sikre dig et eksemplar ved at vælge en "perk" i menuen til højre. For 30 USD får du for eksempel et fysisk eksemplar af bogen på enten dansk eller engelsk - den perfekte gave til børn eller børnebørn. Især hvis de er sådan nogle der godt kan lide monstre og hyggelig uhygge. 

- mads

story:
My name is Rashid Darden.  In 2012, I was the Director of Development at a Washington nonprofit organization.  After 11 years in the nonprofit sector, I decided it was time to stop being miserable and start fulfilling my destiny.

I quit my day job to invest in my career as a novelist.

Now, in 2013, I have written a novel in a new genre. I have created a world in which African vampires have come to America during the transatlantic slave trade and have been imbedded in the New World since colonial days.

I'm no stranger to writing.  While an undergrad at Georgetown, I wrote my first play and participated in poetry readings on and off-campus.  Over the next several years, I wrote and independently published three novels and a book of poetry:  Lazarus, Covenant, Epiphany, and The Life and Death of Savion Cortez.  Each of my books averages no less than 4.8 of five stars on Amazon!  You can find out more about my career so far at www.oldgoldsoul.com and www.rashiddarden.com. 

I want to add to the growing canon of vampire stories a legend that reflects the traditions and values of the African diaspora.  Although we all grew up with many wonderful, well-written, and successful vampire stories, it's high time that everyone gets a great story from a different cultural perspective.  

Your investment will help me publish and raise awareness of this novel.  It will also help me to inspire the next generation of novelists.

 

My goal is significant, but realistic: $3890

$220 for the cover designer, Charlis Foster, who has provided an extraordinary discount for services which could easily be over four figures.

$413 for greatly reduced copyediting and editorial development fees.

$220 for printing and postage of promotional postcards.

$606 for printing of review copies.

$616 for shipping costs of review copies.

$1815 for travel and lodging for free writing workshops at 20 colleges and universities.

In the event that I raise an additional $2,110 beyond my goal, I will use the extra funding to hire a public relations assistant and add even more schools to the writing workshp tour! 

 

There are many fun perks for investing in the Black Vampire Project, including thank yous on my website, acknowledgements in the novel, an e-book, signed copies of Birth of a Dark Nation, Lazarus, Covenant, and Epiphany, a poster version of the cover, a Skype conversation with me, and even getting a character in the novel named after you!

 

 

I write books to change the world.  This is how your investment in my career accomplishes that.

I have chosen 20 colleges and universities in several states that will receive a free writing workshop if this project is fully funded.  I have chosen universities that do not have large endowments and are not necessarily able to provide the same level of programming that other schools may be able to.  If I am able to reach 50 students at each school, then I will have inspired 1000 emerging writers to pursue careers as poets, novelists, essayists, and other noble paths in the writing professions.  I believe that I can reach many more than 1000 with cooperation from the schools themselves.

 

 


I have conducted workshops and lectures at colleges and universities since 2005, including Georgetown, Howard, Ohio, Cal State LA, and the University of Maryland; for the National Multicultural Greek Council; and for the Deltas, AKAs, Lambda Psi Delta, Alpha Phi Omega, and the Links.

I am also committed to writing as a full-time job.  Your investment helps me get the right start on that career.  Prior to now, writing was always secondary to having a "regular job."  Now that I am making my dreams and my vocation one in the same, I could use help bridging the gap between my goals and my reality.  I can do this because I have the tenacity, endurance, and creatvity.

 

More information about my previous appearances can be found at www.oldgoldsoul.com and www.rashiddarden.com.

 

I know all too well that the freedom of being a fulltime novelist isn't free. I've made a lot of sacrifices to be able to do this and I know that everyone's money is precious.  If donating to this project just isn't in your budget, I have a lot of things you can do to help:

  • Share, share, share!  Please use Indiegogo's sharing tools above to share this project with your circles.  Our hastag is #BlackVampireProject
  • Do you have contacts at any of these colleges?  These are my target schools where I'd like to conduct writing workshops.  Help me get connected to the people who can make it happen!
  • Do you live in any of these cities?  You can host a meet & greet when the tour gets started.  Contact me!
  • Do you have access to air, rail, or hotel points, vouchers, or discounts that you'd be able to transfer or donate for the writing workshop tour?  Let's talk!
  • Are you a professional editor who is willing to donate your services?  Let's talk!

You might have other ideas to share to help make this project come together.  I'm open to hearing them!

 

 



Justin tensed up and peered out of the window.  A uniformed security guard and another woman walked out of the house.   The small white woman wore a long black coat, a Baltimore Orioles baseball cap, and ear buds in her ears.  She locked the door behind her.  The guard got into the company issued sedan and sped off.  The woman got on a bicycle and rolled by us at a moderate pace.

“Follow her,” I ordered.

“I got this,” he snapped back.  He made a quick U-turn and stayed about half a block behind the woman as she pedaled through the neighborhood.  She never looked back once.

We followed her through Rock Creek Park as she neared Georgia Avenue, pedaling slightly harder and slightly faster.

“She made us,” I said.

“I think so, too,” Justin said.  He accelerated as she sped across Georgia Avenue onto Missouri, pedaling furiously.

“She’s gonna make that left on Fifth Street,” Dante said.

“I know,” Justin replied.  “Relax, we’re in my territory now.”

Justin was right behind her as she turned onto Fifth Street.  She pedaled as fast as a superhuman could and we were on her tail.  We both ran through red lights.

Justin’s fangs began to elongate as he concentrated on the road.

“You hop out as soon as I go past her,” he instructed.

“What?!” Dante and I said in unison.

“You hop out of this truck as soon as I pass her!”

“That’s crazy!” I said.

Justin ignored us and put his pedal to the metal just as we reached Coolidge High School, a large colonial style building with red brick and slanted green roofs.  A huge, modern gymnasium was attached to the building on its far side.

We passed the woman just on the other side of Coolidge and she hopped off her bike, running through the parkland next to the gym.

“Get her, bitch!” Justin screamed at me.

Without argument, Dante and I bailed from the truck and hit the ground, tumbling a few times but hopping right back up in pursuit of the vampire.  Justin sped off down the street.  Our stakes were in our hands, ready for action.

story:
My Story

I am a novelist. I have published in the past. My novel GLINT was praised in reviews. For example, Kirkus Reviews, the organization that reviews books for libraries said, in part, ...Valentinetti shapes scenes with a sizzling terseness that will make you tingle... I have written a novella about the sinking of the atomic submarine Thresher and its possible link to the assassination of John F. Kennedy. Here's a synopsis:

I Am Diving

An overview of the novel by Joseph Valentinetti

© 2009 Joseph Valentinetti

 

The story is a fiction based on fact. My protagonist, Jack York, is an ex-sailor. He suffers from Fugue, a distinctive dissociative disorder characterized by geographical displacement and amnesia for the episodes. The misunderstanding of his condition is the reason for his dishonorable discharge from the Navy. The story concerns the events that lead Jack York to be in Dallas on November 23, 1963. The premise of the story is the Dallas tragedy was carried out by two men who had no prior knowledge of each other and different targets in mind.

 

          `There exists a type of phenomenon…which has puzzled man. The seemingly accidental meeting of two unrelated causal chains in a coincidental event which appears both highly improbable and highly significant.’

Arthur Koestler

 

The significant factor motivating Jack York is the loss of the Atomic Submarine Thresher with one hundred twenty-nine men aboard. The premise is based on actual letters, part of one is excerpted here. Please note the date.

 

Letter date: August 12, 1963. Notarized and mailed/receipted August 12, 1963

To: Hon. John Connally, Governor of Texas.

From: Field Engineer on Thresher.

Dear Governor;

A plot is underway to assassinate you. As former Secretary of the Navy you are well aware of the Submarine Thresher disaster, and how Bendix used fraudulent pressure/depth curves on equipment designed and built by Bendix for submarines of the Thresher class.

An organization…Justice For The Crew Of The Thresher is being formed.

Sir, I beg you, if you do visit Dallas and ride in an open car, please do not allow your loved ones to ride in an open car with you. If a sniper’s bullet, meant for you, was fired from a high powered rifle by one of these disgruntled former service men…

 

The letter’s author was questioned in August 1963 by Naval Intelligence, The FBI and postal authorities. The FBI and the other investigative agencies, failed to file a report concerning this and later failed to inform the Warren Commission.

 

The letter, send three months before the Dallas event, named the three salient factors of the crime: disgruntled ex-serviceman, high powered rifle, open car.

 

The Impact

This is timely. The 50th anniversary of this event, in 2013, is just around the corner. It is important that this alternate view of events become more widely known.


What We Need & What You Get

First let me say what what the money will NOT be used for. You are NOT paying me to write this. It is already written, edited and ready for publication.

The publication date is 07.05.2011. You will receive your perk around that time.

The money raised will be used for:

Professional publishing and printing of a soft cover trade size first edition book.

Distribution of the novella.

For copies to made available to reviewers.

Advertising.

The novella will also be available through Kindle and other electronic formats. Your participation will be noted in any and all formats.

The money will be used in these ways no matter if the final goal is met or is not met. If less the full amount is raised the campaign will simply be scaled back to match the funds available. Under no circumstances will the project be abandoned. You will receive what you sign up for no matter what funding level is achieved.

The final product will make you proud to have participated in this project. Thank you, I appreciate your courtesy,

Joseph Valentinetti

Other Ways You Can Help

Join my team. Get a special mention on the team member page in the preface of the novella. Please tell everyone you know about this. Post it to your Facebook, MySpace, Web Page. Do a mass mailing to you contacts in your various email accounts.
