Advertising.
The novella will also be available through Kindle and other electronic formats. Your participation will be noted in any and all formats.
The money will be used in these ways no matter if the final goal is met or is not met. If less the full amount is raised the campaign will simply be scaled back to match the funds available. Under no circumstances will the project be abandoned. You will receive what you sign up for no matter what funding level is achieved.
The final product will make you proud to have participated in this project. Thank you, I appreciate your courtesy,
Joseph Valentinetti

Other Ways You Can Help
Join my team. Get a special mention on the team member page in the preface of the novella. Please tell everyone you know about this. Post it to your Facebook, MySpace, Web Page. Do a mass mailing to you contacts in your various email accounts.

story:
Our Story

I am a Lifestyle & Etiquette Expert and I've vowed to take on bad manners one person at a time. I present workshops and seminars to a number of various groups and organizations. My first book Girls Have Style tackled issues that tween/teen girls face everyday at school. It is currently available for purchase on our website, Amazon.com, Barnes&Noble.com, and Kindle.

Now this next book "THE POWER OF POLITE â€“ How to Get What You Want, Get Your Point Across, and Gently Put Rude People in Their Placeâ€ will deal with everyday challenges for adult men and women. We are raising funds to publish the book from start to finish.  It too will be available for purchase on our website ElaineSwann.com, Amazon.com, Barnes&Noble.com, and Kindle.


 

The Power of Polite Movement

Whether itâ€™s business, family or personal relationships at some point in time or another we are all faced with that â€˜what to do momentâ€ This book gives you a road map on how to handle those awkward social situations.  We want to help people get through those challenging moments. So we're starting a movement! We're asking folks to join in to help get this next book published. And become a part of something our modern society desperately needs - Better Manners! And with your help we can do it!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Through our publishing company we will hire all of the players that will go into the production of the book. This includes the editor, cover designer, interior designer, book printer, and more. They are all local business owners and professionals in the San Diego area. So your generosity will also help small business thrive and flourish. Weâ€™ll need to launch and promote the book as well. So part of the funding will go towards marketing the book to make it a great success. Now if we donâ€™t reach our full goal our plan B is to still hire an editor, because thatâ€™s very crucial, and then release the book in digital format. It will be distributed as an e-book on Kindle and other platforms. We will allow proceeds from the e-book work our way towards the production of a hard cover book.

Weâ€™ve got some great perks to thank you for your support. Starting with having your name listed on our website to one of our many etiquette-inspired products, books, and services.  How about a nice wallet-sized table setting card? Great for those times when you are at a table full of dinnerware and you need a little reminder. Or, how would you like a set of stationery from our signature line? We'll mail a set directly to you. Would you like a signed copy of the new book BEFORE it goes on sale? It will arrive on your doorstep before it hits the market. Would you like to have me speak to your group or organization? Iâ€™ll do it for free! Travel is not included but we can work out the details. The bottom line is we would be so grateful for your help. It's grass-roots movements like this that help American businesses thrive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute monetarily, that's perfectly fine. You can still join the movement and help get the word out by passing this along to others. We've got some simple  tools to make sharing easy. And if you do we'll still give you a great shout out and let the world know we thank and appreciate you.

story:
Short Summary

Although an educator by profession, Clayton Perry's brief career in music journalism has led him down an unprecedented path. Through guerrilla marketing and "old-fashioned" networking, Perry has conducted over 200 celebrity interviews. Among the impressive list: pop stars Lady GaGa andKaty Perry; industry visionaries Clive Davis and Simon Cowell; hip-hop pioneers Chuck D (of Public Enemy) and Darryl "DMC" McDaniels (of RUN-DMC); super-producers Kerry "Krucial" Brothers and Christopher “Tricky” Stewart; and soul music vanguards John Legend and Adele.

HOW I DID IT: CLAYTON PERRY’S INCREDIBLE EVOLUTION FROM ELEMENTARY SCHOOL TEACHER TO CELEBRITY JOURNALIST is a blueprint for dreamers dreaming “the impossible dream.” Over the course of TWENTY "THEMATIC" CHAPTERS – filled with personal ANECDOTES and INTERVIEW excerpts – DISCOVER the traditional tools and non-traditional tactics you can employ to accomplish any goal.

Perks of Sponsorship

The tentative release date for HOW I DID IT is August 31, 2012. (Drafting will begin mid-May and end mid-August. Updates will be provided on a bi-weekly basis.)

There are five levels of sponsorship: $10+ (bronze), $25+ (silver), 50+ (gold), $100+ (platinum) and $2500 (diamond). 

Of the many perks included with sponsorship: the text (in various digital, physical, signed and limited-edition formats), contributing sponsor credit, ticket(s) to HOW I DID IT book-release event(s), digital "thank you" video (on claytonperry.com) with name in credits, exlusive access to a forthcoming HOW I DID IT video teleconference with one-hour Q&A session at the end, a rare PUBLIC speaking engagement with YOUR corporation, association, or nonprofit organization, and and a PRIVATE lunch/dinner with 2-7 companions.

Total Projected Costs

**  Manuscript Editing – QUOTE: Scribendi.com – 20 individual chapters of 1,000 words edited for style, tone, word choice, and sentence structure within 24 hour intervals - $447.20 (20 x $22.36) without tax

**  Select Publications from the Writer’s Digest Shop – including a one-year subscriptions to the following magazines: BOOKMARKS ($37.50 - Summaries of hundreds of opinions from every major newspaper and magazine are distilled into each issue for a comprehensive look at the latest fiction, nonfiction, and children's books.), THE WRITER ($42.00 - Today's best-selling writers discuss dialogue, plotting, characterization, suspense, romantic fiction; non-fiction writers cover interviewing, research, finding good subjects, how and when to query, turning personal experience into salable articles and books), WRITER’S DIGEST ($47.02 - For the writer at heart. Each issue focuses on the craft of writing, the tools and information for writing, and the markets for writing. Features examine how to write and sell magazine and newspaper articles, books, plays, poetry and scripts) and POETS & WRITER’S MAGAZINE ($29.70 - Includes interviews with poets and fiction writers as well as essays written by established authors, with news about the publishing community and coverage of political issues of interest to writers.) - $500

**  Publication Rights to Twenty (20) Royalty-Free Images – QUOTE Corbis Images – color illustrations from “The Big Picture – ImageZoo” serving as chapter headers/dividers - $550 without tax

**  down-payment on audio/composition services by Harvey Cummings, award-winning musician, songwriter and educator – for the recording an original rendition of “Lift Every Voice and Sing” to be utilized as background music in digital marketing tools and bi-weekly webisodes related to “HOW I DID IT” - $500 | LINK: http://harveycummings.tumblr.com

**  down-payment on forthcoming visual art services rendered by Fahamu Pecou, Atlanta’s premier contemporary artist, circa June 2012 – for book cover design - $500 | LINK: fahamupecouart.com

**  down-payment on forthcoming photographic services provided by Shannon McCollum, “The Gordon Parks of Hip-Hop,” circa July 2012 - for “the obligatory headshot” and a historic photo-shoot in Atlanta, Georgia (with a host of cameo appearances from “special guests”) - $500 | LINK: shannonmccollum.com 

**  honorarium to Ayofemi Hunter-Kirby, treasured confidant and author of “foreword” - $500

**  honorarium to Chloe Russell, beloved companion and author of “afterword” - $500

**  honorarium to Edward Garnes, life-long mentor and author of “biographical profile” appended to “afterword” - $500 | LINK: afrostoshelltoes.com

**  down-payment on public relations services provided by Los Angeles "PR Rockstar" Chey Bell between August 17 and September 14, 2012 - $500 | LINK: janicemccaffertypr.com/chey.html

**  expansion (and strengthening) of claytonperry.com (and the "Clayton Perry" brand) through networking and professional development opportunities, which includes - but not limited to - organizational membership fees, conference attendance, travel and lodging for: BlogWorld & New Media Expo in New York City (June 5-7, 2012), James Scott Bell's Next Level Writing Seminar in Austin, Texas (June 16-17, 2012), 2012 National Association of Black Journalists  Convention and Career Fair in New Orleans, Louisiana (June 20-24, 2012), and Online News Association Conference (September 20-22, 2012) - $2500 - [SPECIAL NOTE: Password-Proected Notes and Audio-Visual Documentation of each experience will be shared on Clayton Perry's "Passion + Memory" blog to all sponsors of HOW I DID IT for their own personal and professional development! WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER!]

Other Ways You Can Help

If a contribution is impossible at this time, then considering helping in other ways:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools - and notify members with your social networks.

**  down-payment on public relations services provided by Los Angeles "PR Rockstar" Chey Bell between August 17 and September 14, 2012 - $500 | LINK: janicemccaffertypr.com/chey.html
**  expansion (and strengthening) of claytonperry.com (and the "Clayton Perry" brand) through networking and professional development opportunities, which includes - but not limited to - organizational membership fees, conference attendance, travel and lodging for: BlogWorld & New Media Expo in New York City (June 5-7, 2012), James Scott Bell's Next Level Writing Seminar in Austin, Texas (June 16-17, 2012), 2012 National Association of Black Journalists  Convention and Career Fair in New Orleans, Louisiana (June 20-24, 2012), and Online News Association Conference (September 20-22, 2012) - $2500 - [SPECIAL NOTE: Password-Proected Notes and Audio-Visual Documentation of each experience will be shared on Clayton Perry's "Passion + Memory" blog to all sponsors of HOW I DID IT for their own personal and professional development! WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER!]


Other Ways You Can Help
If a contribution is impossible at this time, then considering helping in other ways:

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools - and notify members with your social networks.

story:
¿Qué?

Querido enemigo puede parecer una apuesta arriesgada, pero quizá va siendo hora de que las historias empiecen a cambiar.

odio sust. masc. 1. Sentimiento profundo e intenso de repulsa hacia alguien que provoca el deseo de producirle un daño o de que le ocurra alguna desgracia.

Clara y Dante quieren empezar de cero. Ella carga con un presente que se hace cada vez más pesado, y él arrastra un pasado que amenaza con alcanzarlo a cada paso que da. Son dos polos opuestos que se encuentran en el escenario idóneo para iniciar un romance épico de esos sobre los que se escriben las canciones, pero por desgracia el amor no es algo de lo que sepan nada, así que su historia toma un rumbo totalmente distinto.

En su escalada para salir del agujero en el que se encuentran, tanto Clara como Dante aprenderán, no sin ayuda, que la salvación se encuentra en los lugares (y en las personas) más inesperados.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Qoyari A. Miriel.

Nacida en España, de madre pintora y padre arqueólogo de vocación, he pasado la infancia a caballo entre El Salvador y Nazca y el Valle Sagrado, en Perú. Estudié Diseño de Moda en Madrid, y posteriormente cursé un Máster de Escritura Creativa y otro de Lectura Crítica. Actualmente escribo prosa, poesía, lo que surja, pero sin parar.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Ella sonríe, y de repente está muy, muy cerca.
          ―Yo me daría cuenta si murieras y bailaría sobre tu tumba ―dice ella y a él, de una manera retorcida y extraña, no le parece algo malo del todo.
          ―No pienso morir antes que tú.
          Ella se ríe; una risa suave y musical, y le pasa una mano por el pelo.
          ―Eso está bien, no me he tomado todas estas molestias como para que te me mueras ahora.
          ―Eres una enferma ―masculla él apartando la cabeza, pero ella vuelve a reír.
          ―Entre enfermos nos entendemos.
          Y no se equivoca. No del todo»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Querido enemigo que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Qoyari A. Miriel vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Major Update

Several new developments have caused me to drastically change the focus of this campaign. I'm getting some significant press coverage for the website, and things are actually going quite well, with some money coming from an outside source.

But I've recantly launched a prgram to provide inexpensice eBook Readers to kids who can't afford them. eBooks are without doubt the wave of the future, and it won't be long before they're even being assigned in classrooms. Kids who can't access them will be like the kids who didn't have TV when I was young, and couldn't watch an assigned TV Special about history, or the Apollo Moon Landings. Those kids were alughed at, ostracized, because of their lack.

This program will provide e-Readers to such kids. The device I've found is simple. It has WiFi capability, can browse the web, and can display eBooks and play music or audiobooks. In volume purchases, my cost is around $20 each. 

I can't change the whole campaign here, so I'm using this spot. Since I no longer need funding for the company itself, I'm asking you to contribute to this program. However much comes in will help.

All contributions to this Indiegogo Campaign will aid this program, now.

Thank you.

Wayne Hicks

 

Short Summary

I'm a guy who's come to understand just what it means to have a dream and not know how to make it a reality. I'd wanted to write novels all my life, but working kept me from it for years. When an accident put me in a wheelchair, I suddenly had nothing but time, and so I started writing.

But having written several novels, I soon found that the real work was only beginning. You can't sell a book if no one ever hears of it, and so I spent months doing nothing but promoting my work.

Now I've developed some ideas that work, and I want to share them with other writers. I've built an online publishing platform that is far better than most of the choices new writers face, and now I'm trying to expand it into something that will make a real difference for everyone who's trying to live that same dream!

And if you're not familair with eBooks, then check this out: I'm giving away one of my own novels, Magic Trixie and the Crystal Witch, for free, right now on the website. This is a book that has already delighted readers from 8 to 80! Feel free to download it and check it out, and see what the buzz is all about!

What We Need & What You Get

What I'm seeking is up to $35,000.00. With that money, I can hire the staff I need to take this to the nest level, and I can build a marketing campaign that will get it out in front of every new Author and millions of Readers.

The goal I've set may seem high, but it's not impossible to reach. I've seen many Campaigns here on Indiegogo raise far more. However, it isn't entirely necessary for me to raise it all right here and now. Every dime that does come in will help, as it will let me promote the benefits we can offer to more and more writers. And as the company becomes better known, it's quite likely that I'll find the investors who can see its amazing potential, and help me take it the rest of the way to the top!

The Impact

This company will make it possible for many, many Authors to actually get their books published, and connect with Readers who will enjoy them. With all of the special services we offer, eBookOnFire.com can help a good writer become a Great Writer!

That means that every contribution, large or small, is going not only to help me expand this company, but to improving the lives of countless new writers who need the services we offer, and even more readers, who long for a good book! Help us make both of those dreams come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

And of course, I know that not everyone who reads this will be able to contribute to it financially, but there are many other ways you can help. Use the Shairng Buttons on this website to let others know about this campaign. Tell yur friends, especially if you know someone who is a writer! And if you enjoy reading, then please come and join our community so taht you can be one of the first to discover the great new writers whoa re becoming part of it...
story_txt:
Major Update
Several new developments have caused me to drastically change the focus of this campaign. I'm getting some significant press coverage for the website, and things are actually going quite well, with some money coming from an outside source.
But I've recantly launched a prgram to provide inexpensice eBook Readers to kids who can't afford them. eBooks are without doubt the wave of the future, and it won't be long before they're even being assigned in classrooms. Kids who can't access them will be like the kids who didn't have TV when I was young, and couldn't watch an assigned TV Special about history, or the Apollo Moon Landings. Those kids were alughed at, ostracized, because of their lack.
This program will provide e-Readers to such kids. The device I've found is simple. It has WiFi capability, can browse the web, and can display eBooks and play music or audiobooks. In volume purchases, my cost is around $20 each. 
I can't change the whole campaign here, so I'm using this spot. Since I no longer need funding for the company itself, I'm asking you to contribute to this program. However much comes in will help.
All contributions to this Indiegogo Campaign will aid this program, now.
Thank you.
Wayne Hicks
 
Short Summary
I'm a guy who's come to understand just what it means to have a dream and not know how to make it a reality. I'd wanted to write novels all my life, but working kept me from it for years. When an accident put me in a wheelchair, I suddenly had nothing but time, and so I started writing.
But having written several novels, I soon found that the real work was only beginning. You can't sell a book if no one ever hears of it, and so I spent months doing nothing but promoting my work.
Now I've developed some ideas that work, and I want to share them with other writers. I've built an online publishing platform that is far better than most of the choices new writers face, and now I'm trying to expand it into something that will make a real difference for everyone who's trying to live that same dream!
And if you're not familair with eBooks, then check this out: I'm giving away one of my own novels, Magic Trixie and the Crystal Witch, for free, right now on the website. This is a book that has already delighted readers from 8 to 80! Feel free to download it and check it out, and see what the buzz is all about!


What We Need & What You Get
What I'm seeking is up to $35,000.00. With that money, I can hire the staff I need to take this to the nest level, and I can build a marketing campaign that will get it out in front of every new Author and millions of Readers.
The goal I've set may seem high, but it's not impossible to reach. I've seen many Campaigns here on Indiegogo raise far more. However, it isn't entirely necessary for me to raise it all right here and now. Every dime that does come in will help, as it will let me promote the benefits we can offer to more and more writers. And as the company becomes better known, it's quite likely that I'll find the investors who can see its amazing potential, and help me take it the rest of the way to the top!


The Impact
This company will make it possible for many, many Authors to actually get their books published, and connect with Readers who will enjoy them. With all of the special services we offer, eBookOnFire.com can help a good writer become a Great Writer!
That means that every contribution, large or small, is going not only to help me expand this company, but to improving the lives of countless new writers who need the services we offer, and even more readers, who long for a good book! Help us make both of those dreams come true.


Other Ways You Can Help
And of course, I know that not everyone who reads this will be able to contribute to it financially, but there are many other ways you can help. Use the Shairng Buttons on this website to let others know about this campaign. Tell yur friends, especially if you know someone who is a writer! And if you enjoy reading, then please come and join our community so taht you can be one of the first to discover the great new writers whoa re becoming part of it...

story:
Our Story

Hi, my name is Udi Jacoby and I live in Melbourne Australia. About a year ago Daya, the author and my niece, sent us an email stating "That's it! I just finished writing my first novel - Murderess". After reading the 240 pages of Murderess and learning that this is only the first of six books in "The Exiles of Greywall'd Saga", we (my family and I) decided that this amazing fantasy cannot remain unknown. 

Together, with Daya and our family we started the long and exciting journey of self-publishing a book. Murderess, will be published in two languages. Hebrew, the language it was written in and of course, in English. Today, we are at the final stage of making Daya's new world - Greywall'd, a reality for all ages to read and enjoy.

We are inviting you to join our journey, support us and become active members of our new community. Your support will help us overcome the expensive secret of publishing a book in two languages.

             

Please feel free to download and enjoy the first two chapters:

Murderess - first two Chapters in English

Murderess - first two chapters in Hebrew

For our Hebrew readers, here's the Hebrew version of our promo:


Here is The Blurb

Lu never wondered if her name was strange. ‘Lu Killer’. How was she to guess that her ancestors fought ferociously against the royal family for generations? How was she to know that her family lived in Greywall’d, a completely different world? All that 16 year old Lu cared for was when she could next listen to her music, next be left to her own devices and when she could truly feel at peace.

But her life changed completely when a young boy with a hat fell from the sky into her train…

What We Need & What You Get

We seek your help and support to raise US 18,000 in order to complete publishing the book in two languages (that's more than a duplicate effort) as eBooks as well as printed editions. We also plan to start marketing it and make it available for a wider audience around the world.

As you can see we placed duplicate perks! One set is for our English readers and one for our Hebrew readers. 

Claiming any one or more perks makes you a member of our community!

  • Your recommendation matters and could appear on the back of the book - Since we write to you and seek your support, we thought it will only be fair to add at least one recommendation written by one of you. 
    It's easy! This is how to participate:
  1. Download and read the first two chapters from the links above.
  2. Tell us what you liked!
    Every active member (regardless of the perk you claimed) can send us an email or write it in the blog (under the comments tab above). We will pick one recommendation and include it in the actual back cover with your name! 
    Furthermore, if we receive more than a 1000 recommendations, we will also insert the top 50 into the digital editions of the book and the second editions of the printed books. 
  3. Please note, every recommendation must be 30 words or less.
  • Pre-order the second book - What's really cool is that you can pre-order the second book already and be one of the firsts to read the next part of the saga. 
    We offer this because we can't wait to know what lies ahead for Lu Killer.
  • If our goal isn't met then we will focus on delivering our perks to our contributors (that's YOU guys) and then running a short print of as many books as we can.

The Impact

Daya just celebrated her 16th birthday this week and started to write Murderess when she was 13. Yet, we were all inspired by this fantasy, the amount of detail and level of sophistication and imagination. We would like to see this community grow and as time goes by, we plan to launch the rest of the books in the series as well as the history of Greywall'd. Daya almost finished the second book and we plan to start editing it in order to launch it during 2014.

Where is Your Money Going? 

Translation from Hebrew to English - 900

Editing in Hebrew and then in English - 2,800

Book cover image - 500

eBook creation English and in Hebrew - 1,100

Printed edition, setup, graphic design - 2,400

Product launch - 1,700

Printing a 1000 copies - 6,500

Website - 2,000

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution, small or large, will be greatly appreciated. Whether it is sharing our campaign with your friends and family or pledging to one of our perks, it's a tremendous help. 
We want the world of Greywall'd to be seen by the rest of our world; we truly believe we have something special on our hands and we would love to share it with everyone. 
Please use Indiegogo's available share tool, write your comments and tell us what you think.

I would like to thank you for your support and hopefully welcome you to our journey through Greywall'd. 

We look forward to hearing from you.
Udi
